Byline: A series of photographs showing injured police officers are genuine, but they are several years old and have nothing to do with immigrants or caravans.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Is This a Photograph of Susan B. Anthony Being Beaten on the Street?
Byline: A "get out the vote" meme highlights a photograph that was crucial to garnering public support for the British suffragette movement.
Author: Arturo Garcia

Title: Does This Photograph of a Marine Saluting the U.S. Flag Violate Twitter's Rules?
Byline: Despite claims that an image of a marine saluting an American flag was deemed offensive by Twitter, we found no evidence that it violated the company's rules.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did George Soros Pay Refugees in Honduras to Join a Caravan and Storm the US Border?
Byline: A baseless, fear-mongering and factually inaccurate tweet claiming that a group of refugees in Honduras were paid by George Soros to storm the border was posted by a United States Congressman in October 2018.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Do These Photographs Show the Same Spot in the Arctic 100 Years Apart?
Byline: A glacier comparison project documented some stark changes in the Arctic landscape across the span of a century.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Is Gladys Baker Morris the Daughter of JFK and Marilyn Monroe?
Byline: An article about a secret child supposedly born to JFK and Marilyn Monroe resurfaced online years after its original publication.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did Georgia's Secretary of State 'Block' the Registrations of 53,000 Voters, Most of Them African-American?
Byline: Left-wing Facebook pages weighed into Georgia's gubernatorial race with widely shared memes about alleged voter suppression in that state.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Is Barron Trump a Chess Grandmaster?
Byline: Barron Trump was once photographed with a chess set, but that doesn't make him a Grandmaster.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did Sarah Jeong Tweet That She Hopes 'Bald White Kids' Have Leukemia?
Byline: A series of fake tweets have been created and circulated in order to denigrate New York Times journalist Sarah Jeong.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Does the Antifa Flag Resemble a Nazi Flag?
Byline: A political group without an official flag has nonetheless been represented by many photoshopped ones.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: School Shootings in Christian Texas vs. Non-Christian Japan
Byline: A viral tweet, offered in response to remarks made by the Republican candidate in a Texas senatorial debate, gets the facts right.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Was This Man Whipped to Death for Molesting a 2-Year-Old Child?
Byline: A graphic video showing a man being brutally whipped while tied to a post is real, but it has nothing to do with pedophilia.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Are 20 Percent of Homicide Victims with Restraining Orders Killed Soon After Obtaining Them?
Byline: An image disseminated online cites part of a 2008 study on domestic violence but omits one key piece of information.
Author: Arturo Garcia

Title: Do These Photographs Show a Nazi Flag and Homophobic Merchandise at a Trump Rally in Pennsylvania?
Byline: Politics does make for strange bedfellows at times, but not quite as claimed here.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Machine Gun Kelly Death Hoax
Byline: Rumors swirled on Twitter that Rapper Machine Gun Kelly (MGK) had died from a ‘ligma overdose.’
Author: David Mikkelson

Title: Does This Photograph Show Neo-Nazis Posing Under a Burning Swastika in Draketown, Georgia?
Byline: An extraordinary photograph from an April 2018 rally re-emerged on social media several months later.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Is This a Photograph of Hurricane Michael?
Byline: A photograph of an approaching storm is real, but it was taken months before Hurricane Michael made landfall in Florida.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did a 'Pro-Choice Activist' Set a World Record by Getting Her 27th Abortion?
Byline: A long-running junk news site used a legitimate stock photo for another one of its "satirical" stories.
Author: Arturo Garcia

Title: Were Gay Concentration Camp Prisoners 'Put Back in Prison' After World War II?
Byline: An online comedy series highlighted the fact that the end of the war did not mean the end of persecution for many gay German men.
Author: Arturo Garcia

Title: Does a Municipal Code Limit Trick-or-Treating to Children 12 and Younger?
Byline: A viral image of one municipal ordinance regarding Halloween activities left viewers wondering whether police were going to be hauling off bigger youngsters for trick-or-treating.
Author: David Mikkelson

Title: Is This a Photograph of Nazi SS Troops Shooting a Child?
Byline: A chilling historical image was used to illustrate a political point, but it was taken from a cinematic depiction and not real life.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Is This a Photograph of a Florida Airport Flooded During Hurricane Michael?
Byline: Some social media users recycled an old, digitally-edited photograph that misled viewers in October 2018.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Is Mylan CEO Heather Bresch the Daughter of W.V. Democratic Senator Joe Manchin?
Byline: A meme about Manchin's vote to confirm Kavanaugh accurately notes that Heather Bresch is Manchin's daughter, but it's not clear why that's relevant.
Author: Bethania Palma

Title: Did Brett Kavanaugh Rule That a Raped Immigrant Teen Must Delay Her Abortion in Order to 'Think About it Maturely'?
Byline: A widely-shared meme got the basic facts right about an October 2017 case involving the newest Supreme Court justice but embellished certain details.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Was Taylor Swift 'Busted' on a Date with Colin Kaepernick?
Byline: Junk news sites published a spurious report saying Swift was photographed with the controversial former NFL quarterback at a San Francisco nightclub.
Author: David Emery

Title: Did a Virginia School Leave a Transgender Student Unprotected During a Shooting Drill?
Byline: An activist group's account of the incident at Stafford County Middle School spread rapidly online.
Author: Arturo Garcia

Title: Is This a Photograph of Tom Hanks Wearing an Anti-Trump T-Shirt?
Byline: Buy a fact check scorecard, because you can't always tell celebrities apart by the shirts they wear.
Author: David Mikkelson

Title: Did a School Employee Tweet 'Who's Gonna Take One for the Team and Kill Kavanaugh?'
Byline: A paraprofessional with Rosemount, Minnesota, school district resigned after posting the tweet.
Author: Bethania Palma

Title: Did a 'West Virginia Republican' Tell Women to 'Get Your Coat Hangers Ready' ?
Byline: Parkersburg City Councilman Eric Barber made the "coat hanger" comment in a reply to a Facebook post about Brett Kavanaugh's Supreme Court confirmation.
Author: Bethania Palma

Title: Did This Protest Sign Suggest the Mass Killing of White People in Order to End White Supremacy?
Byline: Social media users express vehement distaste for fake protest signs -- without realizing they're fake.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Does This Grocery Store Have an Aisle for Lonely Single People?
Byline: An image of a grocery store aisle sign is often shared with jokes about single and lonely people.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Is This a Photograph of a 'Rainbow Butterfly'?
Byline: If this were a new brand of candy, we'd definitely give it a try.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: 'Got Another Friend Request from You' Facebook Warning
Byline: A warning about a Facebook user's supposedly having received a second friend request from you is mostly useless.
Author: David Mikkelson

Title: Was Maya Angelou Sexually Assaulted as a Child?
Byline: A graphic shared online relays details that Angelou first revealed in her 1969 autobiography, "I Know Why the Caged Bird Sings."
Author: Arturo Garcia

Title: Is This a 'Lava Moon' Melting into a Waterfall?
Byline: A photograph of the moon and a waterfall seemingly align just right to create a "lava moon" melting into the water.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Does Adding Your Age to Your Birth Year Equal 2,018 for 'One Day Only'?
Byline: Simple mathematics, rather than a mysterious once-a-millennium event, explains a popular meme.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Is This a Picture of Christine Blasey Ford in 1982?
Byline: A picture said to be one of a 15-year-old Christine Blasey Ford has been proffered as "evidence" that Brett Kavanaugh did not sexually assault her.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Do Facebook Donations Recur Every Month Even When a User Chooses a One-Time Contribution?
Byline: The social network says they're working to fix a glitch that causes one-time donations to appear on bank statements as recurring even though they're only debited once.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Does This Photograph Show Barack Obama Holding a 'Michelle Obama 2020' Shirt?
Byline: Wording displayed on t-shirts is one of the easiest and most common targets for digital image manipulators.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Have 260 Out of 535 Members of Congress Settled Sexual Assault Charges?
Byline: A popular Facebook message claiming that 260 members of congress had settled sexual assault charges seriously misread the data.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did a UK University Ban Clapping at Student Events?
Byline: The University of Manchester Student Union caught flak online for their proposal encouraging the use of British Sign Language at some events.
Author: Arturo Garcia

Title: Is This 'Back to the Future' Image Comparison with President Trump Real?
Byline: An image comparison featuring Donald Trump and Biff Tannen from the movie "Back to the Future" has not been digitally manipulated.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did Protesters Vandalize Brett Kavanaugh's House?
Byline: Junk news websites used an unrelated image from 2016 to illustrate a story falsely claiming that the Supreme Court nominee's home had been vandalized.
Author: David Emery

Title: Do These Photographs Show a Protester Paid to Disrupt the Kavanaugh Confirmation Hearings?
Byline: Viral images shared with misleading information about protesters resulted in harassment and death threats.
Author: Bethania Palma

Title: Did Christine Blasey Ford Claim She Called a Friend on a Cellphone in 1982?
Byline: Internet trolls manufactured a fake story in an attempt to discredit Dr. Christine Blasey Ford's testimony.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Is This a Photograph of Donald Trump's Mother?
Byline: Although some claim that Donald Trump wears a wig, an image of his mother Mary suggests that the presidential pompadour runs in the family.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Is This a Photograph of Donald Trump with Tupac Shakur?
Byline: Two legends, one photo -- but not necessarily a photograph that showed them in the same place at the same time.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Is This a Photograph of a Wasted Brett Kavanaugh?
Byline: The only similarity between the men in these two pictures is what appears to be a shared love of beer.
Author: Alex Kasprak

Title: Did a Woman Accuse Country Music Star George Strait of Stalking and Sexual Harassment?
Byline: A Facebook page that calls itself "the Alt-right Onion" posted a fake story based on the lyrics of one of George Strait's songs.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Is This a Photograph of Christine Blasey Ford's Lawyer with Hillary Clinton?
Byline: More purported evidence that all of Brett Kavanaugh's accusers can somehow be linked to every prominent liberal political figure.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Do These Photographs Show a Homeless Veteran Dying Under a Bush?
Byline: "We want to discard the parts of society we don’t want, but like plastic, it’s never going to go away."
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Is This a Video of Bikers on Their Way to Washington to Support Brett Kavanaugh?
Byline: According to internet trolls, bikers everywhere in the world are supporters of President Trump and frequently rally to his support.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did Judge Robert Meadows Pen an Essay Entitled 'Thank You, Canada?'
Byline: A viral piece urges Americans to be thankful for their Canadian neighbors.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Is This a Photograph of Christine Blasey Ford with Bill Clinton?
Byline: Dr. Christine Blasey Ford is apparently a Zelig-like figure who has met and posed with every prominent American liberal.
Author: David Mikkelson

Title: Was This Photograph Taken at a Trump Protest?
Byline: An image from a gay pride parade in New York was shared on social media as if it showed people at a protest against President Trump.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Does This Photograph Show a Nude Man Walking the Runway with a Group of Young Girls?
Byline: A photograph showing a nude man on a stage with a group of young girls is real, but it was not taken in the United States and has little to do with the "liberal left."
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did Christine Blasey Ford Make a Sexual Assault Accusation Against Neil Gorsuch?
Byline: Believing this claim also requires believing that someone who tweets #Pizzagate and #Qanon conspiracy theories is a credible source of breaking news.
Author: Alex Kasprak

Title: Is This a Photograph of Christine Blasey Ford Partying?
Byline: Apparently any photograph of a woman semi-clothed and drinking can be used to smear the credibility of someone who reported a sexual assault.
Author: David Mikkelson

Title: Does This Photograph Show Irish Slaves in the United States?
Byline: A disturbing photo of mining conditions, likely from Belgium in the early 20th century, has often been misrepresented to fit various political narratives.
Author: Alex Kasprak

Title: Does This Photograph Show a Woman Abused by Keith Ellison?
Byline: Rep. Keith Ellison's former girlfriend has leveled charges of "narcissist abuse" against him, but a picture of a badly injured woman used in a meme shows someone else.
Author: David Mikkelson

Title: Did Ann Coulter Tweet That 'Men Have No Choice But to Rape ...'?
Byline: A controversial tweet by Ann Coulter is a few years old and was issued in response to another tweet.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Is This a Photograph of Christine Blasey Ford Holding a 'Not My President' Sign?
Byline: A conservative Facebook page's attempt to smear Christine Blasey Ford used a stock photograph of an entirely different woman.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did David Attenborough Say 'I Am Unaware of Any Animal That Is as Cruel as Israelis'?
Byline: A stray comment on an Iranian news web site formed the basis of a bizarre meme involving Sir David Attenborough.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Does This Photograph Show a Stretch of I-40 in North Carolina Underwater?
Byline: A photograph documents that a portion of Interstate 40 in North Carolina was completely underwater after Hurricane Florence.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Is This a Photograph of an Elephant Carrying a Lion Cub?
Byline: A photograph of an elephant carrying a lion cub should need to be real to be considered the "best photo of this century."
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Are These Pictures of Pigs on a Farm Flooded by Hurricane Florence?
Byline: Photographs showing a group of pigs on a flooded farm are real, but they were not taken after Hurricane Florence in 2018.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did George Zimmerman Sign a Bag of Skittles?
Byline: An image showing a bag of Skittles autographed by George Zimmerman came from the documentary "Rest in Power: The Trayvon Martin Story."
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Does This Photograph Show 'Brittany L' After Killing a Leopard?
Byline: A photograph posted by Safari Club International went viral after being shared by outraged animal-lovers.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Was the Appointment of Dr. Jerome Adams as Surgeon General Ignored by the Press?
Byline: This meme is not only false, but it seemingly undermines the very point it's trying to make.
Author: David Mikkelson

Title: Was President Trump's 9/11 'Fist Pump' a Greeting to a Cancer Victim?
Byline: Deceptive memes purport to correct misinformation offered by other supposedly deceptive memes.
Author: David Mikkelson

Title: Did a Man Die from Shooting a Gun at Hurricane Florence?
Byline: A report that a Facebook event encouraging people to "shoot guns at Hurricane Florence" had caused the storm's first fatality was junk news.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Was the Georgia State Line 'Blocked Off' Because of Hurricane Florence?
Byline: A Facebook user's bogus claim about hurricane escape routes was spread online even by people who proclaimed to know it was false.
Author: Arturo Garcia

Title: Can Mobile Phone Users Update Their Voicemail Greetings Without Cellular Service?
Byline: A "hurricane tip" circulating online would not, in fact, help everyone who might be affected by Hurricane Florence.
Author: Arturo Garcia

Title: Does This Photograph Show a Large Spiral Cloud Forming at Sunset?
Byline: An image of a large spiral cloud forming at sunset was created with the help of digital editing tools.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did President Trump Fist-Pump at a 9/11 Memorial?
Byline: An image showing President Trump making an excited hand gesture on 11 September 2018 is genuine, but the photograph was snapped at an airport, not at a 9/11 memorial.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Police Training and Police Killings: USA vs. the Nordic Countries
Byline: A meme used mostly accurate stats to draw a somewhat questionable link between the duration of academy training and the use of deadly force by police.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Does This Photograph Show Barron Trump Wearing Nike Shoes?
Byline: An ongoing controversy over Nike's endorsement deal with Colin Kaepernick expanded to include an old photograph of the president's 12-year-old son.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Did Ford Make Colin Kaepernick the Face of Their New Ad Campaign?
Byline: A joke posted to the political humor section of Reddit was mistaken as genuine news by a number of social media users.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did Madonna Say She Would Vote for President Trump in 2020?
Byline: A widely-shared meme fabricated a statement by the singer and actor, who is a fervent opponent of the 45th president.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Is This Nike 'Make America Great Again' Hat Real?
Byline: An image purportedly showing the Nike 'swoosh' symbol on the tag of a 'Make America Great Again' hat is a hoax.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Do Nike Factory Workers in Vietnam Earn 20 Cents Per Hour?
Byline: Critics of Colin Kaepernick's endorsement deal with Nike shared viral claims about the pay and conditions of the company's factory workers.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Did Nike Offer 'People of Color' a 75 Percent Off Coupon?
Byline: Users of the controversial online forum 4Chan produced racially-charged and potentially dangerous fake coupons, in the aftermath of Nike's endorsement deal with Colin Kaepernick.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Were Brett Kavanaugh's Children Escorted from a Senate Hearing Room Because They Were Harassed by Hecklers?
Byline: An Internet meme characterized the planned departure of the Supreme Court nominee's daughters from Senate chambers as a reaction to being heckled.
Author: David Emery

Title: Did the Widow of 'American Sniper' Chris Kyle Criticize Nike's Colin Kaepernick Campaign?
Byline: Taya Kyle wrote on Facebook that the ad campaign's message of "sacrificing everything" was "insulting to those who really have sacrificed everything."
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Does This Photograph Show 26 'Corrupt' Politicians Executed by China?
Byline: Not a picture of 'corrupt' politicians or an execution, although some of the latter followed afterwards.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did Trump Once Criticize the Obama White House for 'Attacking' Bob Woodward?
Byline: A Donald Trump tweet from 2013 about the Obama administration and reporter Bob Woodward was seized on by the president's critics in 2018.
Author: David Mikkelson

Title: Did 125 Women Terminate Their Pregnancies During a Protest in South Korea?
Byline: A photograph of women participating in a protest demanding the legalization of abortion in South Korea apparently captured most of them taking vitamins, not the abortion drug Mifepristone.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did the University of Alabama Cut Ties with Nike Over the Colin Kaepernick Endorsement Deal?
Byline: A false viral Facebook rumor was fabricated using an online "fake news generator."
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Did an Ohio Police Officer Say 'Abolishing Slavery Was the Worst Thing' Ever Done?
Byline: A volunteer officer with the Fairview Park Police Department posted the comments online. He resigned from the department in 2014.
Author: Bethania Palma

Title: Did Ashton Kutcher's Software Help Rescue 6,000 Children from Sex Trafficking?
Byline: Viral social media posts exaggerated the impact of the actor's much-lauded efforts to end child exploitation.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Is $1 Donated for a Girl's Kidney Transplant Every Time Her Photo Is Shared on Social Media?
Byline: Nobody is paying for ailing children's organ transplants or life-saving surgeries based on how often a social media post is shared.
Author: David Mikkelson

Title: Did Colin Kaepernick Immediately Lose a Nike Endorsement After an Anti-White Rant?
Byline: Reports that Nike rescinded their offer to make Kaepernick one of the faces of their 'Just Do It' campaign were junk news.
Author: David Emery

Title: Did a Man Injure Himself by Setting the Nike Shoes He Was Wearing on Fire?
Byline: An internet hoax involving Nike shoes, an internet protest, and an unrelated photograph of a burn victim fooled a number of viewers in September 2018.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Is This a Picture of an 'Intense Supercell with a Mass of Tornadoes' in Kansas?
Byline: An image purportedly showing multiple tornadoes touching down in Kansas is actually a composite image showing the "evolution" of a single tornado.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Does This Image  Show Heath Ledger's Joker Doing a Skateboard Kickflip Over Batman?
Byline: A doctored image purportedly showing Heath Ledger's Joker doing a kickflip over Batman has been fooling internet users for years.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did Musician Sean Combs Fail to Buy a Twitter Handle from Comb-Seller 'Sean's Combs'?
Byline: Screenshots purportedly documenting Puff Daddy's futile attempt to buy a Twitter handle from comb-seller 'Sean's Combs' was created for a humor web site.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Is This a Picture of an Unusually Short Giraffe?
Byline: Not every member of a species exhibits what is considered a 'standard' appearance.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Is This a Picture of a Snake Found in a Milk Jug?
Byline: We've heard of "milking snakes," but not usually in this context.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Were Gatorade Bottles Designed with a Cap Holder on the Bottom?
Byline: An image shows a cap neatly nestled into the bottom of a Gatorade bottle, but this is not an intentional design feature.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Is Sheriff Joe Arpaio Taking Over John McCain's Seat in the Senate?
Byline: Online reports that the controversial former Maricopa County Sheriff was nominated to replace the late Senator John McCain originated on a junk news website.
Author: David Emery

Title: Did Sen. Lindsey Graham Call Trump a 'Race-Baiting, Xenophobic Bigot' in 2015?
Byline: An online graphic accurately quoted the South Carolina Republican disparaging his then-opponent on CNN.
Author: Arturo Garcia

Title: Did Actor Morgan Freeman Call President Trump a 'Bonafide Sack of Sh*t?'
Byline: An expletive-laden tweet excoriating the president in the wake of the Jacksonville shootings was mistaken by some as having been written by actor Morgan Freeman.
Author: David Emery

Title: Does This Photograph Show John McCain with Osama bin Laden?
Byline: A doctored photograph purportedly showing John McCain posing with terrorist Osama Bin Laden was widely circulated in the wake of the Arizona senator's death in August 2018.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Is California Gov. Jerry Brown Moving a Veterans Cemetery to Make Way for Low-Income Housing?
Byline: A notorious producer of junk news posted a fabricated meme about the relocation of a military cemetery in California.
Author: David Mikkelson

Title: Is Colin Kaepernick on the Cover of Time Magazine as the 2018 'Person of the Year?'
Byline: An image purportedly showing Colin Kaepernick as the "Person of the Year" on the cover of Time Magazine is a hoax.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did MSNBC Use a 'Trump Worried About Pecker Leaking' Chyron?
Byline: The chyron 'Trump Worried About Pecker Leaking' was created by an internet prankster, not the graphics team at MSNBC.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did 'Liberals' Set Up a GoFundMe Campaign for Murder Suspect Cristhian Rivera?
Byline: A hyperpartisan Facebook page spread a fake and inflammatory meme after the death of Iowa college student Mollie Tibbetts.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Is This Dashing Young Man Franklin D. Roosevelt?
Byline: A 1930s photograph of Franklin D. Roosevelt, Jr., the President’s son, is a popular item online but it is often miscaptioned as a picture of his father.
Author: Alex Kasprak

Title: Did Vladimir Putin Rescue an Injured Donald Trump from the Viet Cong During the Vietnam War?
Byline: An example of how no meme can be so over-the-top ridiculous that it won't at least prompt some questions.
Author: Bethania Palma

Title: Did Michael Cohen Tweet at Hillary Clinton That Room and Board Will Be Free When She Goes to Prison?
Byline: President Trump's long-time personal attorney deleted the tweet after pleading guilty to multiple counts relating to fraud and campaign finance violations.
Author: Bethania Palma

Title: Did a 'New Deadly Spider' Species Kill Several People in the U.S. in the Summer of 2018?
Byline: A viral, scare-mongering Facebook post fabricated a series of fatal spider bites and used photographs of the relatively harmless woodlouse spider.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Did Robert Smalls Steal a Confederate Ship to Rescue Himself and Others from Slavery?
Byline: A meme accurately recounts the life of a man born into slavery who stole a Confederate ship to rescue fellow slaves, became a war hero, and got elected to the U.S. Congress.
Author: Alex Kasprak

Title: Is This 'Trump Made America the Best Country in the Nation' Sign Real?
Byline: An image purportedly showing a logically challenged sign in support of President Trump is actually a digital creation.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did a Florida Judge Give Vastly Different Sentences to Two Men, Whose Only Difference Was Their Race?
Byline: A viral meme, based on a piece of investigative journalism, left out some important context in the cases of Chase Legleitner and Lamar Lloyd.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Did Two Police Officers Cook Dinner for Children After Their Mother Was Taken to the Hospital?
Byline: An image of two police officers washing the dishes after they cooked a meal for a sick mother's children is real and was taken in the Netherlands in 2015.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Was a Giant Blue Whale Spotted Near Jennette's Pier?
Byline: An image purportedly showing a giant blue whale sighted near Jennette's Pier in North Carolina is actually a composite of at least two different images.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did Education Secretary Betsy DeVos Register Her Yacht in the Cayman Islands?
Byline: Several viral memes made unfounded assumptions based on the complicated inner workings of the DeVos family's business interests.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Did Fox News Use an Image of Patti LaBelle During Their Aretha Franklin Tribute?
Byline: Fox News accidentally included a photograph of singer Patti LaBelle instead of Aretha Franklin as they reported on the latter's  passing.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Kohl's $150 'Black Friday' Coupon Scam
Byline: Kohl's department stores are not distributing $150 "Black Friday" coupons as part of an online promotion.
Author: David Mikkelson

Title: Does This Photograph Show a Man Wearing a 'Make 45 Becomes 46 Again' T-Shirt?
Byline: A photograph purportedly showing a man wearing a ridiculous pro-Trump shirt was a digital manipulation.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Was Mount Rushmore Defaced with Political Graffiti?
Byline: A meme showing political graffiti scrawled on Mount Rushmore originated with a Facebook trolling page.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Was William Harvey Carney the First Black Medal of Honor Recipient?
Byline: A pro-Trump Facebook group used Carney's real-life military efforts to criticize current NFL player protests.
Author: Arturo Garcia

Title: Was a 'Muslim Extremist' Granted Bail by a 'Liberal Democrat' Judge After Training Children to Shoot Up Schools?
Byline: Despite Internet outrage saying otherwise, New Mexico "compound" defendant Siraj Ibn Wahhaj has not been released on bond, because he is being held on an out-of-state warrant.
Author: Bethania Palma

Title: Did Fired FBI Agent Peter Strzok Tweet That President Trump is a 'Dictator,' a 'Russian Asset,' and an 'Unhinged Madman?'
Byline: A parody account in Strzok's name issued the combative tweet in the wake of the FBI agent's firing for sending text messages critical of President Trump.
Author: David Emery

Title: Did a Harvard Study Prove That “Unvaccinated Children Pose No Risk” to Other Kids?
Byline: A deceptive and factually challenged blog post on an anti-vaccine website is not a “Harvard study,” yet its false conclusions are popular on social media.
Author: Alex Kasprak

Title: Did President Trump Share a Photo of a 'Bikers for Trump' Member with a Nazi Tattoo?
Byline: President Trump may have greeted the 'Bikers for Trump' at one of his golf courses, but he didn't tweet a photograph of one of them bearing an 'SS' tattoo.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did Uninsured Medal of Honor Recipient 'Duane Devane' Die After Being Refused Treatment?
Byline: A notorious producer of junk news posted a fake meme about veterans with a reference to a video game character.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Does This Photograph Show the Cooking Instructions on a Bacon Package?
Byline: The instructions on the back label of a bacon package advised consumers to "complain to elected officials" if they "don't know how to cook bacon."
Author: David Mikkelson

Title: Were Additional Donald Trump 'Stars' Placed on the Hollywood Walk of Fame?
Byline: A group of right-wing street artists called "The Faction" posted a video claiming responsibility for the stunt in August 2018.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Does This Photograph Show ICE Arresting Small Children?
Byline: Although a photograph of handcuffed children is shared with the claim the youngsters were arrested by ICE, the image is unrelated to immigration.
Author: Bethania Palma

Title: Does This Photograph Show a Woman About to Be Stoned to Death in Iran?
Byline: Iran has been criticized by the international community for allowing the use of stoning as a form of capital punishment
Author: David Mikkelson

Title: Did Major News Networks Ignore a Story About Korean War Remains Returning to the U.S.?
Byline: A widely shared meme suggested that mainstream American news outlets largely ignored North Korea's return of the remains of U.S. soldiers killed during the 1950-53 war.
Author: David Emery

Title: Did Winston Churchill Say 'The Fascists of the Future Will Call Themselves Anti-Fascists?'
Byline: A quote incorrectly attributed to the former British prime minister was spread on social media by Texas Governor Greg Abbott.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Does This Photograph Show Clouds Over the California Wildfires?
Byline: A spectacular image of red-tinted clouds at sunset was repurposed to falsely connect it with 2018 wildfires in California.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Are These 'I'd Rather Be a Russian Than a Democrat' Shirts Real?
Byline: A photograph of two men wearing "I'd Rather Be a Russian Than a Democrat" t-shirts was taken at a rally for President Trump in Ohio.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Is Dwayne 'The Rock' Johnson Holding a Facebook Giveaway?
Byline: Despite the prevalence of numerous social media come-ons, Dwayne Johnson is not giving away money, cars, or anything else on Facebook.
Author: David Mikkelson

Title: Did Barack Obama Mock President Trump's 'IDs for Groceries' Speech on Twitter?
Byline: A seeming tweet circulated online was designed to mimic the former president's social media account.
Author: Arturo Garcia

Title: Is Facebook Taking Down a Photograph Showing the Burial of Korean War Remains?
Byline: Facebook is not taking down a picture of the interment of Korean War dead in order to minimize an achievement of President Trump's.
Author: David Mikkelson

Title: Does Public Law 92-313 Allow Americans to Claim 'Federal Rent Checks'?
Byline: An author's online financial pitch is based upon existing information, but experts caution that it is no "hidden pot of money."
Author: Arturo Garcia

Title: Was a 'Pedophiles Are People Too' Notice Posted Near an Oregon School?
Byline: A sign reading "Pedophiles are People Too" was briefly pinned to a telephone pole near a school in Oregon, but this poster was likely created as part of a troll campaign.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Is Starbucks Replacing Plastic Straws with Paper Straws Wrapped in Plastic?
Byline: A meme criticizing Starbucks' use of paper straws wrapped in plastic packaging employed an image of an unrelated product.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did Outback Steakhouse Announce They Are Banning Supporters of President Donald Trump?
Byline: A notorious producer of junk news posted a fabricated meme about the popular restaurant chain.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Is a Stone Mountain Implosion Event Being Planned by the City of Atlanta?
Byline: A Facebook event inviting viewers to watch the implosion of Stone Mountain was created by a parody account.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Does This Image Show a Peaceful Meeting of a Lion and a Zebra at a Watering Hole?
Byline: Food and drink, all in the same place!
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Will Eating an Egg and a Banana Kill You?
Byline: A viral warning seems to ignore the obvious truth that eggs and bananas are commonly and deliciously mixed together with no harmful effect on consumers.
Author: Alex Kasprak

Title: Chipotle $100 Gift Card Giveaway
Byline: Chipotle is not offering free $100 gift cards for National Avocado Day to internet users who share a link with their friends.
Author: David Mikkelson

Title: Is the Hammerhead Bat a Real Animal?
Byline: A photograph showing an odd-looking, large bat with an elongated face features a real animal, but the image may make the bat appear larger than normal.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Does This Photograph Show the Water Filtration Power of Oysters?
Byline: Oysters sustain themselves by sucking microscopic plankton out of the waters they inhabit, and this behavior also turns them into natural water filters.
Author: Alex Kasprak

Title: Is This Image of a Lenticular Cloud Over the Giza Pyramids Real?
Byline: The Giza Pyramids and lenticular clouds are spectacular photographic subjects individually, but did someone manage to capture both in one shot?
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did All Christian Churches in Dearborn, Michigan, Close in April 2018?
Byline: A notorious producer of fake news attempted to provoke outrage with yet another fabricated memetic claim.
Author: David Mikkelson

Title: Does This Photograph Show a Future French Politician as a Shepherd in Morocco?
Byline: Internet memes falsely used an unrelated image of a Moroccan girl to illustrate the unusual life story of Najat Vallaud-Belkacem.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Did President Trump Say Pedophiles Will Get the Death Penalty?
Byline: In a 2012 tweet, Donald Trump called for a "fast trial, death penalty" for "perverts" who abduct children.
Author: Bethania Palma

Title: Did a Russian Asbestos Company Put Trump's Face on Their Product?
Byline: A Russian asbestos producer shared a photograph of their product to social media with a seal of Donald Trump’s face and the text "Approved by Donald Trump”.
Author: Alex Kasprak

Title: Did the Obamas Wear Che Guevara Shirts During a Cuban Trip?
Byline: A poorly edited image supposedly showing the Obama family wearing Che Guevara shirts in Cuba has been shared tens of thousands of times on social media.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Do These Photographs Show the Croatian President in a Bikini?
Byline: A set of images purportedly showing Croatian President Kolinda Grabar-Kitarović in a bikini actually show model Coco Austin.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Does This Photograph Show Putin Pulling President Obama's Tie?
Byline: A popular image seemingly shows Russian president Vladimir Putin aggressively pulling President Obama's tie.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Dollar General $150 Coupon
Byline: Businesses do not celebrate their anniversaries by giving away hefty coupons to Facebook users who share and like posts. Those offers are a form of online scam.
Author: David Mikkelson

Title: Did Congress Vote to Take Away Food Stamps from 1.5 Million Veterans?
Byline: A partisan Facebook page significantly exaggerated the likely consequences of the House's version of the 2018 "farm bill."
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Was Accused Russian Spy Mariia Butina Photographed in the Oval Office?
Byline: An image purportedly showing accused Russian spy Mariia Butina in the Oval Office with President Trump is a case of misidentification.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did President Trump Break Protocol in His Meeting with Queen Elizabeth?
Byline: Criticism of the U.S. president's actions in the U.K. was largely based on cherry-picked images and misinformation about royal etiquette.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Did Donald Trump Say He Believes the UK Has 'Different Names'?
Byline: President Trump made a comment during an interview with British media personality Piers Morgan suggesting he believes terms such as "U.K." and "England" are interchangeable.
Author: Bethania Palma

Title: Were None of 154 Mass Shootings in 2018 Committed by a Black Man, Illegal Alien, or Woman?
Byline: A hyperpartisan Facebook page gave readers an incomplete picture of mass shootings in America in 2018.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: 'Trump Suffering from a Stroke' Virus Warning
Byline: Pictures of President Trump's suffering a stroke and a supposed virus attached to them are both non-existent entities.
Author: David Mikkelson

Title: Did Comedian George Lopez Urinate on Donald Trump's Hollywood Star?
Byline: The mischievous use of pixellation gave some viewers the false impression that a video showed Lopez relieving himself on the president's piece of pavement.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Was This Photograph Taken Moments Before a Bear Attack?
Byline: An image showing a bear dangerously close to an oblivious fisherman was created for a Photoshop contest.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Is This an Image of a 'Cow Crusher' Device Designed to Crush Cows?
Byline: A photograph of a common piece of farm equipment was shared with false accusations concerning animal torture.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did a Man Harass a Woman for Wearing a 'Puerto Rico' T-Shirt in the United States?
Byline: A Facebook Live video prompted widespread outrage and an internal investigation into the conduct of a Cook County, Illinois, police officer.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Did Cars Melt in Saudi Arabia or Kuwait Due to a Heat Wave?
Byline: Images showing "melted" cars in are real, but the extreme heat came from a nearby construction fire, not the sun.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did Congresswoman Ateesha Nubbins Put an Upper-Age Limit on Voting?
Byline: A meme created by a satirical Facebook page convinced some viewers that a fictional congresswoman was attempting to pass a non-existent law.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did an Outbreak of a Deadly 'HR3211 Virus' Occur in Louisville, Kentucky?
Byline: Reports of a viral epidemic that supposedly killed 16 people in Louisville originated on a prank news generator web site.
Author: David Emery

Title: Does This Image Show How Four Different Presidents Celebrated the 4th of July?
Byline: An image graphic purportedly comparing how Obama, Clinton, Bush and Trump celebrated the 4th of July consists of cherry-picked photographs, none taken on Independence Day.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Does Trump Donate All of His Presidential Salary, While Obama Donated None?
Byline: An Internet meme made misleading comparisons between presidential donations and the sizes of the first ladies' staffs, calling the Trumps "givers" and the Obamas "takers."
Author: David Emery

Title: Did Pastor Joel Osteen Launch a 'Sheep's Clothing' Apparel Line?
Byline: A satirical website's post about the American televangelist was re-disseminated online in meme form.
Author: Arturo Garcia

Title: Was This Hallway Designed to Prevent Children from Running?
Byline: An image showing an optical illusion created with floor tiles is genuine, but it wasn't created to discourage young students from running in the hallways.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did Facebook Flag the Declaration of Independence as Hate Speech?
Byline: A phrase contained in a excerpt from one of America's founding documents triggered the social network's acceptable content filtering.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Did Senate Democrats Call for Supreme Court Nominees to Ignore the U.S. Constitution?
Byline: A meme containing fake quotes from a satirical article managed to take in some followers of conservative commentator David Clarke.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Did Betsy DeVos Tweet 'It's Is My Favorite Country' About America?
Byline: In response to a hashtag asking Twitter users to describe the United States in three words, a parody account for the Secretary of Education described it in five.
Author: Bethania Palma

Title: Did Maxine Waters Call for an 'Illegal Immigrant' to Be the Next Supreme Court Justice?
Byline: A hyperpartisan Facebook page shared an edited image from a real interview by the California congresswoman.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Did a Priest in France Slap a Baby During a Baptism Ceremony?
Byline: Disturbing video footage of the incident went viral in June 2018.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Did Mark Twain Say 'Fear the Media, for They Will Steal Your Honor'?
Byline: The anachronistic use of the word "media" is just one reason to be skeptical of a quote often attributed to American author Mark Twain.
Author: David Emery

Title: Did President Obama Oversee the Separation of 89,000 Children from Their Parents?
Byline: A right-wing Facebook page published a grossly misleading meme that compared the immigration policies of the 44th and 45th presidents.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Was Joe Biden Refused Service at 'Crumb and Get It' in 2012?
Byline: A Virginia cookie shop declined to host a media event with the former U.S. vice president during a campaign stop in 2012.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Is the Bluegill One of the Most Dangerous Fish in North America?
Byline: According to a Facebook meme, a school of bluegills can completely dismantle a human body in less than fifteen minutes.
Author: David Emery

Title: Did Anti-Trump Protesters Call for Republicans to Be Assassinated?
Byline: Hyperpartisan web sites used shoddy image editing to spread inflammatory disinformation.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Did ICE Hurl a Pregnant Woman Over a Border Wall?
Byline: In June 2018, a piece of satire from "The Onion" became more confusing to social media users.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Is L.L. Bean Refusing to Hire Registered Gun Owners?
Byline: A "satirical" blog used a fake meme to gin up outrage by attempting to link the company to Michelle Obama.
Author: Arturo Garcia

Title: Are These Women 'Democrat Party Supporters' Protesting Trump?
Byline: A photograph showing a protest against extreme violence toward women in Argentina was re-captioned "Democrat party supporters."
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did the King of the Netherlands Tell Donald Trump That The Hague Is Waiting for Him?
Byline: A parody account posing as Willem-Alexander of the Netherlands tweeted that the International Court of Justice was waiting for the United States president.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did Canada's Prime Minister Say Canadians Don't Need American Farmers Because 'We Have Grocery Stores'?
Byline: Hyperpartisan social media pages and bots used yet another fake quote in order to attempt to drum up criticism against Canada's leader.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Is an 'Obama Don't Separate Me From My Mommy' Protest Sign Real?
Byline: A photograph showing protesters holding a sign is real, but the sign is referring to separations due to the deportation of family members in the United States rather than forcibly separating families at the border.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Were These Children Separated From Their Parents Under Obama?
Byline: A 2014 photograph of unaccompanied minor immigrants is misleadingly being described as showing children separated from their parents by the Obama administration.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Does This Photograph Show Border Agents Forcibly Separating Children From Families?
Byline: A Pulitzer Prize-winning photograph of a federal agent seizing Elián González was recycled nearly twenty years later with a misleading caption in the wake of a family separation scandal.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Does This Photograph Show Barack Obama Dressed as Satan?
Byline: "Gosh, that cheek looks awfully familiar.  Could it be ... Satan?"
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did a New Hampshire Congressman Deface Donald Trump's Limousine?
Byline: A prolific producer of fake news publishes yet another false meme about an 'Arnim Zola'.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Were Gun-Toting Children Photographed on the United States Border?
Byline: The Drudge Report used a years-old photograph of children in Syria holding toy guns without credit, a description, or attribution to illustrate a story about immigration to the United States.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Are Children Being Assigned Numbers in Detention Centers?
Byline: Viral posts on social media contain claims that immigrant children are receiving numbers like Holocaust victims.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Does This Photograph Show an Octopus Falling from the Sky in China?
Byline: Strong winds did hit a Chinese city, but the objects they displaced didn't include a whole octopus.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Can Amputees Take Their Limbs Home?
Byline: A Reddit user's account of his post-amputation experience of bringing home his leg and making tacos out of it is decidedly uncommon, but at least part of his story is not unheard of.
Author: Arturo Garcia

Title: What Does the Effect of a Bullet Fired From an AR-15 Look Like?
Byline: Photographs shared widely on social media offer an incomplete explanation of the kinds of damage done by gunshots.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Did Jeff Sessions Say 'If We Inflict Fear and Pain on Children, Adults Won't Want to Come Here'?
Byline: A quote widely attributed to the Attorney General appeared to stem from a viral video shared by Sen. Jeff Merkley's visit to a detention center.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Does This Photograph Show Two Boys — One Vaccinated, One Not — Who Were Exposed to Smallpox?
Byline: In the early 1900s, Allan Warner documented several cases of smallpox and the effects of vaccinations.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did an Iowa Congressman Retweet a White Supremacist?
Byline: Rep. Steve King engaged in yet another round of white nationalist speech on his Twitter account.
Author: Arturo Garcia

Title: Did 'the Whole of London' Protest in Support of Far-Right Activist Tommy Robinson?
Byline: A viral photograph showed massive crowds out on the streets of an English city, but the scene was not what far-right supporters claimed it was.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Does This Photo Show a Toddler in a Cage Detained by ICE in 2018?
Byline: A heart-rending photograph of a crying child in a cage was part of a protest to call attention to immigration practices.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Did the 'Distracted Boyfriend' Meme Come From a 1920's Silent Film?
Byline: Saying that Charlie Chaplin invented the "distracted boyfriend" meme is a bit of a stretch, but an early version of the viral image can be spotted in the 1922 short film "Pay Day."
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Is This a Real Photograph of G7 Leaders?
Byline: A German photographer covering the G7 summit captured an image of U.S. President Trump seemingly taking a posture of opposition to other world leaders.
Author: Arturo Garcia

Title: Did Chelsea Clinton Tweet That 'Pizzagate Is Real'?
Byline: Neither Pizzagate nor a "child trafficking bunker" in Tucson is real or connected to illegal activities supposedly directed by Hillary Clinton.
Author: David Mikkelson

Title: Was 'Back to the Future IV' Confirmed by Michael J. Fox?
Byline: A Facebook page posing as the actor posted a hoax message about a new movie in the popular time-traveling series.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Are These Immigrant Children in Orange Jumpsuits?
Byline: A viral Facebook post falsely implied a photograph of youngsters in orange jumpsuits shows detained immigrant children.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Did a Mother Deer Sacrifice Herself to Cheetahs to Save Her Fawns?
Byline: A haunting photograph and a stirring tale of maternal sacrifice: one is real, the other isn't.
Author: David Mikkelson

Title: Was Pope Francis 'Found Guilty' of Child Trafficking and Murder?
Byline: A blog devoted to the roundly-debunked "Pizzagate" story reprinted an equally false post from 2014 about the leader of the Catholic Church.
Author: Arturo Garcia

Title: Was James Doohan Shot Six Times on D-Day?
Byline: A popular meme recounting the actor's involvement with the D-Day invasion at Normandy is largely accurate, but some of the details are a little hazy.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Is 'Courage the Cowardly Dog' Getting Rebooted?
Byline: Yet another spurious rumor about an old show returning to the small screen appeared on Facebook in June 2018.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did Paul Krugman Say the Internet's Effect on the World Economy Would Be 'No Greater Than the Fax Machine's'?
Byline: In a 1998 article about the pitfalls of making predictions about technological progress, the Nobel Prize-winning economist questioned the future role of the Internet.
Author: David Emery

Title: Did a Georgia Lawmaker Tweet a Photograph of Nazis on D-Day?
Byline: Rep. Drew Ferguson posted, and then deleted, an image with German soldiers from his Twitter account.
Author: Arturo Garcia

Title: Did Roseanne Adopt an African Child After a Racism Kerfuffle?
Byline: A fake news site capitalized on controversy involving the comedian, claiming she adopted a black child from Africa to prove she wasn't racist.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Did Barack Obama Pardon More Than 330 Criminals During His Final Week in Office?
Byline: A popular meme confused pardons with commutations and spread an erroneous rumor about the former president.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Does a Photograph of Kidney Stones Show the Effect of Sodas and Energy Drinks?
Byline: Experts say that blaming soft drinks or energy drinks alone for the formation of kidney stones is dishonest.
Author: Arturo Garcia

Title: Is Story Land Closing?
Byline: A viral Facebook post falsely claimed that the New Hampshire amusement park Story Land was permanently closing its doors.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Do People Really Wear Live, Jewel-Encrusted Beetles as Brooches?
Byline: A viral video shows people wearing jewelry consisting of what appear to be live beetles decorated with gold and gemstones.
Author: David Emery

Title: Are Gasoline Prices Over $6.00 per Gallon in California?
Byline: A photograph shared widely online made it look as if the prices for gasoline in Los Angeles had skyrocketed.
Author: Arturo Garcia

Title: Did the National Cancer Institute 'Finally Admit' That Marijuana Kills Cancer?
Byline: Viral stories falsely suggest that a NIH fact sheet was “quietly” amended to state that cannabis kills cancer cells.
Author: Alex Kasprak

Title: Was a Texting Driver Found Still Clutching a Phone After a Fatal Car Crash?
Byline: A photograph of a car crash scene is real, but the accompanying story was evidently manufactured to dissuade people from texting while driving.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Obama and the FBI -- Connect the Dots
Byline: A photograph of President Obama with current and future FBI directors is neither ominous nor revealing.
Author: David Mikkelson

Title: Did Martha Stewart Say She'd Refuse to Accept a Pardon from President Trump?
Byline: A satirical Twitter account added its own "update" to a report saying that President Trump was considering a pardon for Martha Stewart.
Author: Arturo Garcia

Title: Did Melania Trump Spell 'HELP' in a Tweet?
Byline: An artist's satirical post about the First Lady circulated online, eventually spreading without his name attached to the joke.
Author: Arturo Garcia

Title: Is State Farm Denying Insurance to Gun Owners?
Byline: Both the company and an insurance expert refuted online anecdotes painting the company as hostile toward firearm owners.
Author: Arturo Garcia

Title: Did Sarah Sanders Offer Roseanne Barr a White House Job?
Byline: A widely shared Facebook post from the press secretary appeared to offer an official White House position to the controversial comedian.
Author: Snopes Staff

Title: Is Starbucks Installing 'Shatter-Proof Windows'?
Byline: An image circulating online falsely promised "free coffee for a year" to anyone who could damage the company's new windows.
Author: Arturo Garcia

Title: Did Melania Trump Plagiarize a Memorial Day Tweet From Michelle Obama?
Byline: A meme falsely claims Melania Trump plagiarized a Memorial Day statement made by Michelle Obama in 2014.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Can You Text to 83361 to Receive a Free Target Gift Card?
Byline: An insidious scam ends not with free gift cards, but with Facebook users involuntarily spamming the groups to which they belong.
Author: Snopes Staff

Title: Is This a Picture of ICE's 'Special Prison Bus for Babies'?
Byline: A transport vehicle outfitted for children held at an immigrant detention facility has been described as a "prison bus for babies" by some.
Author: David Mikkelson

Title: Is This a Photograph of a Children's Concentration Camp in the U.S.?
Byline: Debate continues over how temporary holding facility and processing centers for undocumented migrant children should  be described.
Author: David Mikkelson

Title: Did California's Governor Sign a Law Requiring All Students to Learn Spanish?
Byline: A notorious producer of fake news provokes yet more outrage with another fabricated meme.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Was a Muslim Educator Named Superintendent of Atlanta's Schools?
Byline: A "satirical" blog's Facebook page used an actual news outlet's photograph to make a stinker of an Islamophobic "joke."
Author: Arturo Garcia

Title: Is the Navy Naming a Ship 'USS Tig Ol Bitties' After an Online Vote?
Byline: A article joked that an online naming contest resulted in the Navy naming a ship the "USS Tig Ol Bitties," but it was just satire.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Will Snapchat's 'Cosmo After Dark' Channel Show Pornography to Children?
Byline: "Cosmo After Dark" will feature content about sex, but this Snapchat channel isn't porn and will only be available to viewers 18 and older.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Has the CEO of Wonder Bread Cut Ties with the NRA and Other Conservative Companies?
Byline: A meme about Wonder Bread's supposedly cutting ties with the NRA is just a bit of political trolling.
Author: David Mikkelson

Title: Did Trump Echo Hitler by Calling Undocumented Immigrants 'Animals'?
Byline: A meme summarized Nazi beliefs about Jewish people but drew a less accurate link to President Trump's comments about immigrants.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Does a Photograph Show Germans Protesting High Fuel Prices?
Byline: The picture in question actually has nothing to do with Germans, fuel prices, or any form of protest.
Author: David Mikkelson

Title: Did Hillary Clinton Say 'Trump Deplorables' Were the 'Biggest Threats to America'?
Byline: A notorious producer of hoax news stories turns a fabricated quote into a Facebook meme.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Were AR-15s Used in Every Major Mass Shooting in the United States After Aurora?
Byline: An attempt to link the rifle to several major mass attacks circulated widely online in the hours following a school shooting in Texas.
Author: Arturo Garcia

Title: Did Facebook Executive Jeff Rothschild Say 'We Need a Third World War'?
Byline: The former Facebook vice president supposedly advocates solving global problems by exterminating 90 percent of the human population.
Author: David Emery

Title: Is This the Aftermath of a 2018 Plane Crash in Havana?
Byline: Old, unrelated images were passed around social media just after news broke about a plane that crashed in Cuba.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Was Nikola Tesla a Swimming Instructor?
Byline: An image of an unidentified man on a New York beach in 1898 is frequently described as showing inventor Nikola Tesla.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did President Donald Trump Tweet That There Should Be a Mother's Day for Fathers?
Byline: A tweet attributed to Trump about the "liberal media" prohibiting a Mother's Day for fathers is a hoax.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Did the Ku Klux Klan March at the 1924 Democratic National Convention?
Byline: An Internet meme holds that the KKK touted its political power by marching en masse outside the convention, which allegedly became known thereafter as the "Klanbake."
Author: David Emery

Title: Was Sarah Huckabee Sanders Voted Among the 'Most Admired' Women in the United States?
Byline: A pro-Trump Facebook page accurately alludes to the results of an April 2018 survey from YouGov.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Is the 'Blue Bow' Trout Real?
Byline: Is an image of a new type of trout genuine, or is it just another fish story?
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Does This Photograph Show Only White Military Spouses at the White House?
Byline: A tweet suggesting White House invitations for military spouses were not diverse was based on a few inaccurate assumptions, but it was widely shared anyway.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Are 'Illegals' Lining Up to Vote in Battsville, Arizona?
Byline: An image circulating on Facebook was taken in Mexico, not Battsville, Arizona — a city that does not exist.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Did Ayatollah Khamenei Share a Picture of Himself Reading 'Fire and Fury'?
Byline: An image apparently showing Iran's Supreme Leader reading Michael Wolff’s controversial book about U.S. President Donald Trump is authentic.
Author: Alex Kasprak

Title: Is This an Asian Giant Hornet?
Byline: Asian giant hornets are real, and large, insects — but a viral photograph purporting to show one actually features a movable insect model.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Does This Photograph Show a Couple Kissing During the 1971 May Day Protests?
Byline: When advertisements imitate scenes from the past, modern commercial creations often become mistaken for history.
Author: David Mikkelson

Title: Did London's Mayor Encourage Muslims to Riot During Trump's UK Visit?
Byline: A prime example of why considering the context and content of video information is so important in discerning fake news.
Author: David Mikkelson

Title: Is Flying J Taking Down U.S. Flags Because They 'Offend Foreigners'?
Byline: A Facebook user claimed that a truck stop in Texas took down a flag because it offended "foreigners," but Flying J saids in reality the flagpole was broken.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Did President Obama Bow to Ayatollah Khamenei?
Byline: This questionable image was posted in an attempt to stir up outrage and sell hats.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did Major General Paul D. Eaton Say Trump's Decertifying Iran Deal 'Dishonors America'?
Byline: A meme reproduces a former general's comment about President Donald Trump's announcement that the U.S. would be withdrawing from a nuclear deal with Iran.
Author: Snopes Staff

Title: Was a Massive Rat Caught in London?
Byline: A photograph of a large rat captured in England is real, but it appears that forced perspective made it look larger than it actually was.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Are Schools Removing Analog Clocks Because Students Can't Read Them?
Byline: A news report about analog clocks and timed exams morphed into a Internet-wide bashing of "kids today."
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Does a 'Welcome to Kansas City' Sign Contain an Unfortunate Typo?
Byline: An image of a welcome sign featuring the word "anally" instead of "annually" is a digital creation.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Was a Black Man Acquitted of a Crime — and Also Jailed for It?
Byline: A viral video gets some details right about the case of Ramad Ahshad Chatman, but leaves out one crucial fact.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Is the Shoebill Stork a Real Animal?
Byline: Images and videos of the shoebill stork, a large African bird, are often met with skepticism.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Were Two Young Black Men Lynched in Oklahoma Without Media Attention?
Byline: Some have called the murder and dismemberment of two African-American men over a gun sale gone wrong a "modern lynching."
Author: David Emery

Title: Was a Weapon Advertised For Its Ability to Fit in a Backpack?
Byline: A photograph of a gun displayed in a clear plastic backpack is real.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did Maryland 'Deplorables' Erect a Billboard Warning About Attempts to Impeach Donald Trump?
Byline: A viral photograph shows a real roadside sign near Huntingtown in Calvert County which warns "liberals" to arm themselves.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Is Willie Nelson Seriously Ill?
Byline: A sketchy Facebook page claimed Willie Nelson was seriously ill, sharing video content known as "engagement bait."
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Michelle Obama Never Placed Her Hand Over Her Heart During the National Anthem?
Byline: A right-wing, pro-Trump Facebook page uses a photograph of Melania Trump to attack her predecessor — and gets the facts badly wrong in the process.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Did Rosie O'Donnell 'Plead Insanity' Over Illegal Campaign Donations?
Byline: Right-leaning web sites falsely accused the actress and comedian of trying to set up a "Trump Derangement Syndrome" defense.
Author: Arturo Garcia

Title: Does the Honey Browser Extension Work?
Byline: Is the browser extension Honey (which automatically applies coupons and finds deals) real or a scam?
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Is Abraham Lincoln in the Wrestling Hall of Fame?
Byline: A popular meme contained a mixture of myth, rumor, and facts (as well as a ridiculous digitally edited image) about the legendary United States president.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Is This a Real Hand With Eight Fingers?
Byline: A set of images purportedly show a rare congenital syndrome called "ulnar dimelia," also known as "mirror hand syndrome."
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did an Exorcism Save a House from Destruction During a Hurricane?
Byline: A viral meme fabricated supernatural involvement in an already remarkable hurricane survival story.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Did Samuel L. Jackson Tweet About Overpaid 'Modern Mumble Rappers' and Teachers' Pay?
Byline: A poorly-formatted purported Twitter quote attributed to the actor is just a hoax.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Are People Dying From Exposure to Sarah Jessica Parker's Perfume?
Byline: A variant on a long-running online hoax accused the actress's "Lovely" fragrance line of being used by terrorists.
Author: Arturo Garcia

Title: Is This Sign at the United States-Mexico Border Real?
Byline: An image purportedly showing a U.S. border sign saying "lots of free stuff ahead" is — you guessed it — nothing more than a poorly-done digital edit.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Was a Hearse Towed Away During the Middle of a Funeral?
Byline: An image purportedly showing a depressing event actually shows a group of actors filming a scene for a television show.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did Mike Huckabee Complain About Michelle Wolf After Mocking 'Triggers' on Twitter?
Byline: Two tweets by the former GOP presidential candidate were combined to highlight a discrepancy in his views regarding what should be considered comedy.
Author: Arturo Garcia

Title: Did Sarah Huckabee Sanders Say She Was 'Proud' to be Compared to Aunt Lydia From 'The Handmaid's Tale'?
Byline: A parody Facebook account tricked some readers into believing that the White House Press Secretary had embraced an unflattering comparison made by comedian Michelle Wolf.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Did Barack Obama and George W. Bush Tweet Criticisms of Kanye West?
Byline: Doctored images appear to show the 43rd and 44th U.S. presidents leading a Twitter backlash against the controversial rapper.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Did Planned Parenthood Defend Bill Cosby?
Byline: Reports that the nonprofit organization defended the comedian after his felony sexual assault conviction stemmed from a Christian-themed satire site.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Is This 'Apocalyptic Sunset Over Moscow' Real?
Byline: A striking "photograph" is actually a composite of at least two different images.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Does This Photograph Show a Man Washing Aborted Fetuses in Brazil?
Byline: A viral photograph purportedly shows a "pro-lifer" washing aborted fetuses in Rio de Janeiro, but the image appears to have originated elsewhere.
Author: David Mikkelson

Title: Was Comedian Michelle Wolf Once Arrested for Bestiality?
Byline: An image of a doctored newspaper article contained the false claim that comedian Michelle Wolf was arrested for bestiality in 2015.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did a Virginia Newspaper Run a KKK Ad on the Front Page?
Byline: The Westmoreland News published a photograph of a KKK recruitment flyer, a decision that was criticized as providing free advertising for the Klan.
Author: Alex Kasprak

Title: Fascism, Corporations, and Merriam-Webster
Byline: A popular meme repeated confused and inaccurate claims about the purported links between fascism and modern corporations.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: 'I Live in Sweden': Facts About Swedish Society and Health Care
Byline: A popular meme outlines the purported benefits of living in Sweden.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Did a Man Lock His Head in a Cage to Quit Smoking?
Byline: Photographs showing a man wearing an "anti-smoking cage" around his head may seem strange, but they originated with a genuine news report.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Do U.S. Citizens Have the Right to Resist 'Unlawful Arrest'?
Byline: It's probably best not to get your legal advice from social media.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Did a New Study Show That Marijuana Leads to a Complete Remission of Crohn's Disease?
Byline: The results of a 22-person pilot study have been misrepresented through years of viral reporting and celebrity promotion.
Author: Alex Kasprak

Title: Was Trump Labeled 'Best President' or 'Worst President' on a 'Time' Cover?
Byline: Two images purportedly showing President Trump on the cover of "Time" magazine under the headlines "Best President Ever" and "Worst President Ever" are both hoaxes.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did Jane Goodall Compare Donald Trump's Actions to Primate Dominance Behavior?
Byline: A meme about United States President Donald Trump and French leader Emmanuel Macron possibly references an apocryphal quote by the famous anthropologist and primatologist.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Does a 'Plastic' Layer Cover Romaine Lettuce?
Byline: A viral video purporting to show a woman peeling plastic off lettuce leaves is misleading.
Author: Bethania Palma

Title: Did a Daredevil Ride a Motorcycle Across Lake Como?
Byline: A viral Facebook post showing a man riding his motorbike across Lake Como failed to mention that it was outfitted with special skis.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Can Rapists Sue for Child Custody, While Rape Victims Cannot Sue for Child Support?
Byline: A meme's claims about rape, child custody, and child support oversimplified a very complicated legal scenario.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Did Attorney Michael Cohen Advertise His Services as 'The Fixer?'
Byline: An anonymous New York prankster put up satirical posters for President Trump's lawyer on the city's subway system.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Did Planned Parenthood Donate $30 Million to Democrats to Influence the Midterm Elections?
Byline: Social media memes misleadingly conflated Planned Parenthood itself with a coalition of organizations and PACs.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Does a Photograph Show a Real Giant Manta Ray?
Byline: A photograph showing a giant manta ray caught in 1933 features the work of a taxidermist.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Is a Mysterious Creature Terrorizing Argentina?
Byline: A photograph purportedly showing a mysterious 7-foot creature is actually a digitally manipulated image based on concept art for a 'Harry Potter' werewolf.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did a Game Show Contestant Need Help Distinguishing Horsepower From 'Llamathrust'?
Byline: A viral meme shows a real moment of mental difficulty for one contestant on "Who Wants to Be a Millionaire?"
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Proof the White Helmets 'Staged' a Chemical Attack in Syria?
Byline: Images purportedly proving that the White Helmets staged a chemical attack in Syria are actually stills from a movie set.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did Malia Obama Found an Anti-Trump Website?
Byline: The art of using memetic fake news to publicize fake web sites.
Author: David Mikkelson

Title: Are Michigan Lawmakers Marking Immigrants' Licenses with Yellow Stars?
Byline: Memes suggesting Michigan lawmakers wanted to place a yellow star on immigrants' licenses were conflated a withdrawn proposal.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Suge Knight Death Hoax
Byline: A disreputable web site managed to trick thousands of internet users with false claims that the former rap producer was murdered in prison.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Did Mark Zuckerberg Announce That He's Closing Facebook?
Byline: A video purportedly showing Mark Zuckerberg announcing that closure of Facebook is a digitally altered hoax.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did Donald Trump Tweet Warnings About Obama Ordering Syrian Airstrikes?
Byline: In 2013, Donald Trump issued multiple warnings to his predecessor about attacking Syria without congressional approval.
Author: David Mikkelson

Title: Did a Shadowy Conspiracy Involve 'Purging' the Internet of Records Relating to Lisa Barsoomian?
Byline: A conspiracy theory fomented by Roger Stone gets even basic facts wrong.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Is Article 54 of Obamacare Taking Effect in May 2018?
Byline: A meme proclaims that "Article 54 of Obamacare" will take 30 percent of seniors' social security payments to cover insurance for undocumented immigrants.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Was Mike Pence at the White House During the U.S. Strike Against Syria?
Byline: After she was criticized online, White House press secretary Sarah Huckabee Sanders said a photograph which included the traveling Vice President was not misleading.
Author: Arturo Garcia

Title: Is This Jeffrey Dahmer Next to an Ice Bong?
Byline: A photograph of a college student standing proudly near a bong made out of snow is frequently shared with a misleading caption.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Is Tilapia a Boneless, Skinless 'Mutant' Fish That Is Unsafe to Eat?
Byline: An evidence-free Internet meme says that tilapia, one of the most popular freshwater fish consumed in the United States, is "killing our families."
Author: David Emery

Title: Did a Sperm Whale Die After Swallowing 64 Pounds of Plastic Debris?
Byline: A photograph of an art installation is frequently attached to genuine reports about a dead whale's washing ashore with trash and debris in its stomach.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did Donald Trump Once Fight Against Installing Sprinklers in New York Apartment Buildings?
Byline: A viral meme accurately describes the future president's lobbying efforts, but it leaves out the fact that his stance on sprinklers later softened.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Is Facebook Removing the Share Button from Pro-Trump Posts?
Byline: Rumors about Facebook's suppression of content (in this case posts supportive of President Trump) resurfaced after Sen. Ted Cruz referenced them.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Is This a Photograph of 'Liberals' Protesting Against Donald Trump?
Byline: An image from a 2010 gay pride parade in Germany was shared as if it showed liberals protesting against Donald Trump in the United States.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Can This Stone Dissolve Iron?
Byline: A viral video claims to document a mysterious and unexplained phenomenon, but in reality it shows a neat science experiment.
Author: Alex Kasprak

Title: Did Elementary School Principal Muhammad Al-Salad Forcibly Implement a Halal Menu?
Byline: A satirical Facebook page used a food-based pun to spread fake news about a fictional school principal.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Are These Daredevils Playing Tennis on an Airplane?
Byline: A photograph of two wing walkers holding tennis rackets on top of an airborne airplane is genuine, but they weren't playing a real game of tennis.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did Joy Behar Publish a Crude Tweet About a Fire at Trump Tower?
Byline: Shortly after a fatal fire at Trump Tower, a fake tweet attributed to Joy Behar of 'The View' began circulating on social media.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Did a Young Woman Deliberately Infect 324 Men With HIV?
Byline: A dubious story is based on a baseless, unverified, and anonymous Facebook post.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did a Sick Child's Classmates Refuse to Wish Him a Happy Birthday?
Byline: A photograph of young child with a rare disease was exploited for likes and retweets on social media.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did Donald Trump Say Community College Is '13th Grade' for 'Dummys'?
Byline: An image suggesting that the president called community college "13th grade ... for dummies" is fabricated.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Can Facebook Users Receive $17,500 Each Over a 'Data Breach'?
Byline: Facebook users everywhere are not entitled to collect cash in compensation over the Cambridge Analytica user data controversy.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Is Amazon Bankrupting the United States Postal Service?
Byline: President Donald Trump has claimed the giant online retailing company is jeopardizing USPS's financial health.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Did Facebook Suspend the Account of the Whistleblower Who Exposed Cambridge Analytica?
Byline: The social media giant suspended Christopher Wylie's account after he went public with accusations that the psychographics firm abused the platform.
Author: Bethania Palma

Title: Was the 'March for Our Lives' Permit Application Made Months Before the Parkland Shooting?
Byline: A viral story based entirely on a misunderstanding falsely insinuates that the Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School shooting was staged.
Author: Bethania Palma

Title: Does Facebook Categorize Users By Political Preferences?
Byline: A graphic circulating online in March 2018 brought new attention to one of the company's data-gathering tools.
Author: Arturo Garcia

Title: Is Daniel Radcliffe Starring in 'Harry Potter and the Cursed Child'?
Byline: An April Fool's Day prank featuring a fan-made movie poster left some aficionados of the Harry Potter universe disappointed.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Is the 'Condom Snorting Challenge' a Real Teen Trend?
Byline: Despite the media's breathless coverage of this alleged social media "craze," most of the extant videos of teens snorting condoms are a year or more old.
Author: David Emery

Title: Is There a Dedicated Hall & Oates Phone Line?
Byline: A trivia-loving Facebook page accurately shares the joy of "Callin' Oates."
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Is This a 'Short-Tailed Weasel'?
Byline: An image of a felt doll is frequently shared as if it was a genuine photograph of a particularly toy-like weasel.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Is a 'Stop Killing Alligators to Make Gatorade' Protest Sign Real?
Byline: A photograph from a 2011 labor strike in London was repurposed to spread a goofy meme about Gatorade being made from real alligators.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did Roseanne Barr Pose as Adolf Hitler for a Magazine Photo Shoot?
Byline: Controversial images of the comedian were originally published in a 2009 issue of a satire publication catering to young Jewish readers.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Is Using 'Bug Spray' to Get High an Alarming New Trend?
Byline: Media reports conflate a number of events, some of them speculative, to manufacture the existence of an emerging trend about the use of bug spray.
Author: Alex Kasprak

Title: Are These the Northern Lights Seen From Space?
Byline: A purported photograph of an aurora is actually a screenshot from a computer animation.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did Indiana Gov. Eric Holcomb Sign a Law Mandating Women Disclose Abortions or Face Jail Time?
Byline: Vague social media posts and news items led to confusion over a broad Indiana law addressing "abortion complications."
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Did Planned Parenthood Say There Should Be a Disney Princess Who Had an Abortion?
Byline: Screenshots of a purported Planned Parenthood tweet circulated that appear to suggest a controversial idea for a Disney heroine.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Was Emma González Photographed Swinging an Umbrella at a Truck?
Byline: A famous 2007 photograph of singer Britney Spears is being used to spread a false accusation against the mass shooting survivor turned gun safety advocate.
Author: Arturo Garcia

Title: Was Emma González Wearing a Cuban Flag Patch During Her 'March for Our Lives' Speech?
Byline: An image of the Parkland school shooting attack survivor attempts to cast her as a "communist" for paying respect to her father's heritage.
Author: Arturo Garcia

Title: Did Florida Pass a Bill Legalizing Recreational Use of Marijuana?
Byline: A fake news item falsely led social media users to believe that Florida became one of the states in which recreational marijuana is now legal.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Did the Obama Campaign Employ the Same Tactics as Cambridge Analytica?
Byline: Attempts at "whataboutism" with a scandal involving social media and psychographics fail to acknowledge that Cambridge Analytica obtained data by misleading people.
Author: Bethania Palma

Title: Did NASA Warn of an Impending Earthquake in India?
Byline: A viral hoax managed to trick some people.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Was Joe's Crab Shack Criticized for Displaying a Picture of a Man Being Hanged?
Byline: A 2016 incident at a Minneapolis location of the food chain has since been recirculated through social media.
Author: Arturo Garcia

Title: Does Facebook's Green 'BFF' Prove Your Account Is Secure?
Byline: A Facebook status update meme claims that a green "BFF" in typed comments is an indicator of account security; it isn't.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Did People Start Licking Toilets as a Protest Against Donald Trump?
Byline: A grotesque hoax involving doctored images of people in bathrooms managed to trick some Internet users.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Donald Trump, Melania Trump, and Stormy Daniels?
Byline: An image purportedly showing the United States president with his wife and alleged mistress has been digitally manipulated.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did an Instagram Post by Rihanna Cause Snapchat's Stock Market Value to Fall?
Byline: The megastar's exhortation to her 61 million followers to "throw away" the app likely did make a significant contribution to a $750 million one-day loss.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Did Police in Delaware Shoot and Kill a Man in a Wheelchair?
Byline: Jeremy McDole's death in 2015 received renewed attention online in 2018.
