Author: Arturo Garcia

Title: Was a Karl Marx Banknote Released in Germany?
Byline: A photograph showing a young woman holding a Karl Marx bill (worth €0) is real, but it is a souvenir note rather than a genuine article of currency.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Is 'Super' Antenna Octa Air a Legitimate Replacement for Cable?
Byline: A suspicious advertisement used doctored photographs and exaggerated claims to promote a new "super" antenna called Octa Air.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did Stephen Hawking Become a Christian After a Blessing from Pope Francis?
Byline: A disreputable Facebook page engaged in a time-honored ritual — the phony deathbed conversion of a prominent unbeliever.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Was Flight MH370 Found with an Eerie Black Box Recording Saying: “SOS, They Are Not Human”?
Byline: An Internet hoax links missing Malaysian Airlines Flight MH370 with — what else? — aliens.
Author: Bethania Palma

Title: Were These Three World Leaders Friends in High School?
Byline: A photograph of Angela Merkel at a party as a teenager does not feature Theresa May or Dalia Grybauskaitė.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did a GOP Candidate Insult a Parkland Shooting Survivor on Twitter?
Byline: Leslie Gibson, a Republican candidate Maine's House of Representatives, called Parkland school shooting survivor Emma Gonzalez a "skinhead" and a "lesbian."
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Stephen Hawking at a Vietnam War Protest?
Byline: An image misidentifying a man at a Vietnam War protest as Stephen Hawking went viral after the theoretical physicist's death in March 2018.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Is California's Governor Requiring Students Use Arabic Numbers in Schools?
Byline: A "satirical" blog posted a story seizing on readers getting angry about a nonexistent California law.
Author: Arturo Garcia

Title: Did Disney Announce a Remake of 'Bedknobs and Broomsticks' with Kate Winslet?
Byline: A fan-made movie poster tricked some readers.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did President Trump Sign an Executive Order Giving Veterans Free Care at Any Hospital?
Byline: A viral Facebook post exaggerated efforts to give military veterans affordable and accessible health care.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Was Ellen DeGeneres Surrounded by Armed Guards at an Anti-Gun Rally?
Byline: An image showing the comedian and television host next to a possibly armed guard is real, but the photograph was not taken at an anti-gun rally.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did a Trump Golf Course Use the Presidential Seal on Tee Markers?
Byline: Social media images stoked controversy and legal questions over the Trump Organization's apparent commercial use of the seal.
Author: David Emery

Title: Did Michele Bachmann Say That 'Jesus Created Assault Rifles'?
Byline: A meme featuring a quote from the former Minnesota congresswoman is a hoax.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did the Kray Twins Use an Elephant to Rob a London Tram?
Byline: An image of an elephant standing near a tram in London is frequently shared with a fictional backstory about English twin gangsters Ronnie and Reggie Kray.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did a Little Girl Have a 'Joker Smile' Carved Into Her Face in South Africa?
Byline: A gory image of a child who had been attacked by a dog was stolen and used by propagandists to spread fear about "white genocide" in South Africa.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Is This a Jumping Baby Elephant?
Byline: An image that appeared to be a luckily timed photograph was actually created with digital manipulation software.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did Melania Trump Plagiarize Michelle Obama's Statement on Women's History Month?
Byline: A meme suggesting that Melania Trump plagiarized her Women's History Month statement from Michelle Obama is based on paraphrased and inaccurate quotes.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did a First Responder Say He Was Told to 'Stand Down' in Parkland?
Byline: A headline on the conspiracy blog Infowars.com mischaracterizes a tweet by a legitimate news reporter.
Author: Bethania Palma

Title: Was a Young Girl Decapitated by a Seat Belt in a Car Crash?
Byline: A website that publishes viral content accurately recounts the terrible story of Katie Flynn's death in 2005.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Is a Vibrant Bra Promotion a Criminal Scam?
Byline: A Vibrant Body Company bra promotion has been linked to rumors of a human trafficking scheme.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Did CNN Purchase an Industrial-Sized Washing Machine to Spin News?
Byline: The news media organization reportedly invested in mechanical assistance to help their journalists and news anchors spin the news before publication.
Author: David Mikkelson

Title: Does Suave Shampoo Contain an Ingredient That Causes Hair Loss?
Byline: Social media posts inaccurately claim that the formulation of Suave Professionals brand products causes hair loss.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Are Hackers Stealing Private Information via 'What Would You Look Like Bald' Facebook Apps?
Byline: Viral warnings about "extreme hackers" stealing information via popular entertainment apps on Facebook are false and misleading.
Author: David Emery

Title: Does Iowa Grant Gun Permits to Blind People?
Byline: Reports about a 2011 change to Iowa's gun licensing rules in Iowa went viral after a mass school shooting in 2018.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Did the NRA's Dana Loesch Tweet That CNN's Rick Sanchez Was 'Fired by a Jew?'
Byline: A tweet posted in 2010 by NRA spokeswoman Dana Loesch about a fired CNN reporter was criticized several years later as anti-Semitic.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did Pepsi 'Admit' Their Sodas Contain Cancer-Causing Ingredients?
Byline: Viral stories rehash a legal tussle between Pepsi and the Center for Environmental Health, but they mischaracterize that battle’s outcome.
Author: Alex Kasprak

Title: Did a Gay Man 'Turn Heterosexual' After a Near-Death Experience?
Byline: A fake news web site used a photograph of a white nationalist to spruce up another of their fabricated stories.
Author: Arturo Garcia

Title: Is This Carl Sagan Holding a 'No Billboards in Space' Sign?
Byline: An image purportedly showing famed astronomer Carl Sagan holding a sign reading "No Billboards in Space" is fake.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Is the NRA a Tax-Exempt Nonprofit Organization?
Byline: A Facebook meme gets the basic facts right about the gun lobby's status as a social welfare organization.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Did a Muslim Scholar Advocate 'Colonizing' U.S. and Canada with Sharia Law?
Byline: A fabricated quote attributed to Tariq Ramadan has once again gained attention on the internet after the academic was arrested on rape charges.
Author: Bethania Palma

Title: Did Trump Use 'Crib Notes' During Listening Session with Parkland Survivors?
Byline: A photograph showing President Trump holding notes during the listening session with survivors of the Parkland, Florida, school shooting is genuine.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did People 'Attack' the Father of a School Shooting Victim for Wearing a Donald Trump T-Shirt?
Byline: A very small minority of Twitter users expressed a critical view of Andrew Pollack, but none appear to have addressed their comments directly to him.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Did Donald Trump Encourage Violence at His Rallies?
Byline: A viral cartoon accurately presented several quotations by the then-presidential candidate, delivered on the campaign trail in 2015 and 2016.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Were News Stories About the Florida Mass Shooting Posted Days Before It Happened?
Byline: A glitch that affects the time stamps on Google searches has led to bogus "false flag" conspiracy theories — again.
Author: Bethania Palma

Title: Did Tomi Lahren Say That Victims of Mass Shootings Don't 'Believe in God Enough'?
Byline: A meme used a fabricated quote based on Lahren's comments about politicians' offering thoughts and prayers to mass shooting victims.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Is This Maxine Waters #GunControlNow Tweet Real?
Byline: An impostor Twitter account posing as Rep. Maxine Waters posted an inflammatory remark with the hashtag #guncontrolnow.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Is This James Hetfield Standing Near a Bear He Killed?
Byline: The Metallica vocalist was falsely identified in a photograph amid 2014 protests over his involvement with a History Channel show.
Author: Arturo Garcia

Title: Did a Huge Shark Wash Up on a North Carolina Beach?
Byline: An image purportedly showing a large shark on a Kitty Hawk beach is a composite of at least two different photographs.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Presidential Responses to School Shootings?
Byline: A set of images showing President Barack Obama and President Donald Trump in the aftermath of different school shootings are real, but they do not necessarily tell the entire story.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did Make-a-Wish Apologize for Sending the Wrong Drake to Visit a Terminally Ill Boy?
Byline: A parody account tricked Twitter users with a darkly comic video about a fictional mix-up.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Does a Viral Video Show Prince George Reciting the Alphabet in Bible Verses?
Byline: Despite the clickbait caption, the video comes from East Texas, not Kensington Palace.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Did Dwight Eisenhower Reject the Idea of 'Soviet-Style' Military Parades?
Byline: A meme intended to undermine President Trump's call for a military parade quotes general-turned-president Dwight Eisenhower on the subject.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Did BuzzFeed Advocate for Taking Away White People's Guns?
Byline: A fake image suggested that Buzzfeed had published a story headlined "Why We Need To Take Away White People's Guns Now, More Than Ever. "
Author: Bethania Palma

Title: Did the Florida Shooter's Instagram Profile Picture Feature a 'MAGA' Hat?
Byline: A photograph purportedly showing Nikolas Cruz in a red "Make America Great Again" hat was taken from his Instagram account.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Is This an Armed Teacher Protecting Students at an Israeli School?
Byline: An image purportedly showing an teacher with a gun slung across her back while watching over students is often shared with misleading claims about security protocols within the country.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did Migrants Destroy a Car in Italy?
Byline: Anti-Muslim blogger Pamela Geller posted an obvious fake and claimed it was an example of "migrant crime" in Europe.
Author: Bethania Palma

Title: Did Obama's Portraitist Paint an Image of a Black Woman Holding the Severed Head of a White Person?
Byline: Artist Kehinde Wiley is best known for reimagining classical heroic paintings using black men and women as his subjects.
Author: David Emery

Title: Did President Donald Trump Block Jennie Willoughby on Twitter?
Byline: An account posing as an ex-wife of former White House staff secretary Rob Porter, who resigned amid a domestic violence scandal, made the claim.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did an American Teenager Who Killed a 'Muslim Refugee' for Raping His Sister Get 30 Years in Prison?
Byline: A anti-Islam, anti-refugee video widely shared on Facebook was blatant fake news.
Author: Bethania Palma

Title: Did a Texas Teacher Named Heather Holland Die Because She Couldn't Afford Flu Medicine?
Byline: The 38-year-old's death from complications of influenza became an internet cause célèbre after it was rumored that she couldn't afford lifesaving medication.
Author: David Emery

Title: Can Police Legally Rape Women in 35 States?
Byline: A pair of articles about the legality of rape in police custody confused social media readers.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Is This 'Beware of Billionaire' Hunters Sign Real?
Byline: An image was digitally created after a construction tycoon was arrested for hunting in a protected sanctuary.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did Elon Musk Call Donald Trump a 'Dumbass'?
Byline: Contrary to a fabricated tweet, the SpaceX CEO responded graciously to Trump's congratulations on the "American ingenuity" of the Falcon Heavy rocket.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Did a Professor Flunk a Student for Correctly Saying that Australia Is a Country?
Byline: Ashley Arnold attracted media attention after challenging — and triumphing over — her instructor's faulty grasp of geography.
Author: Arturo Garcia

Title: Is This a Hermit Crab Using a Skull for a Shell?
Byline: An image purportedly showing a hermit crab using a human skull is actually a lifelike sculpture.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Does this Frozen River Resemble the 'Scream' Mask?
Byline: Internet users passed around an image that appeared to show river ice frozen in the shape of the mask worn by the Ghostface character in "Scream."
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did Keanu Reeves Help Pay for a Stranger's Kidney Transplant with an Envelope of Cash?
Byline: Two unrelated photographs were circulated on social media along with a story about actor Keanu Reeves' paying for stranger's kidney transplant.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did a Black Lives Matter Leader Get Sued for Embezzling Donations?
Byline: Right-wing web sites republished a fabricated story posted by a notorious purveyor of fake news.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Does the Dow Jones Do Worse Under Republican Presidents?
Byline: A Facebook meme purporting to prove that the Dow suffers under Republican presidencies ignores key data.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Does This Video Show Trump's Hair Blowing in the Wind?
Byline: Much ado was made on social media about the President's hair after a video aired of his boarding Air Force One on a windy day.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did an Explosion at Al Franken's Montana Ranch Kill 6 People?
Byline: The fake news article misuses an image of a New York City building fire.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did a Study Show That Dogs Exhibit Jealousy?
Byline: A popular meme showing a dog looking resentful as his owner poses with a significant other is based on a 2014 study suggesting dogs can behave jealously.
Author: Arturo Garcia

Title: Does a New Facebook Algorithm Only Show You 26 Friends?
Byline: Facebook hasn't limited your feed to only a certain number of people, and sharing a post saying otherwise won't make any difference.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Did the Black Panthers Create the WIC Food Program?
Byline: An Internet meme credited the Black Panther Party with inventing Women, Infants, and Children, a federal program that provides food assistance to impoverished mothers and children.
Author: David Emery

Title: Is This 'Goliath Skeleton' Real?
Byline: Some of the images in a collage purporting to show the discovery of a "Goliath skeleton" date back to a 1993 tabloid article.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did Trump Tweet That If 'Dow Joans' Tanked, the President Should Be Shot Out of a Cannon?
Byline: It's remarkably easy to create fake tweets.
Author: Bethania Palma

Title: Did the Eagles Respond to Trump's Congratulatory Tweet With a Vulgarity?
Byline: An image purportedly showing the official Twitter account for the Philadelphia Eagles telling President Trump to "go f*ck himself" is not real.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did Outback Steakhouse Kick Out a Policeman Because it is a 'Gun Free Zone'?
Byline: An incident that generated outrage on social media does not reflect company policy, according to the restaurant chain.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Has Rep. Joe Kennedy Received $348,000 in Donations from the Pharmaceutical Industry?
Byline: A meme targeting the Democratic lawmaker gets some, but not all, of the facts right.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Was Football Star Brian Banks Wrongfully Convicted of Rape?
Byline: The legal ordeal of a California high school football star was turned into a meme that misrepresented key details of his case.
Author: Arturo Garcia

Title: Did Palestinians Dance at the UN After Nikki Haley Threatened to Cut Aid?
Byline: In the wake of the decision to move the U.S. embassy in Israel to Jerusalem, a viral video has spread with a false claim.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Do Amazon Employees Qualify for Food Stamps?
Byline: Official statistics suggest that some of the online retail giant's workforce receive food stamps, but it only applies to about 12 percent of one state's employees.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Did Nancy Pelosi Scold a Democrat for Standing at the State of the Union Address?
Byline: Images showing Nancy Pelosi pointing a finger at a Linda Sanchez are authentic, but a video of the event told a different story.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Does This Photograph Show Security Escorting Andrew McCabe Out of the FBI Building?
Byline: A photograph showing the former deputy director of the Federal Bureau of Investigation with a group of armed officers is real, but it is not recent and does not show him being thrown or escorted out.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Does a 'Multicultural Beach' Sign in Melbourne Prohibit Pork and Alcohol?
Byline: The city of Melbourne tweeted that they do not endorse the sign, noting in a droll aside that they have no beaches in their municipality.
Author: David Emery

Title: Misspelled Tickets Issued for 'State of the Uniom' Address?
Byline: Sitting senators tweeted images of the misspelled tickets on 29 January 2018.
Author: David Emery

Title: Did NFL Decide Not to Televise National Anthem Before Super Bowl?
Byline: An inaccurate meme claims the national anthem won't be televised before the Super Bowl.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Is This Mountain Cliff Shaped Like an Elephant?
Byline: A digitally edited photograph appears to show a natural wonder: a cliff that looks just like an elephant with a mountain on its back.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did Ronald Reagan Pave the Way for Fox News?
Byline: A Facebook meme gets some facts right about the demise of the Fairness Doctrine but ignores important distinctions between broadcast and cable television.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Was a Pedophile Priest with HIV Who Raped Children Crucified?
Byline: The viral tale of Father Jose Garcia Ataulfo, already questionable to begin with, has been embellished with fabricated fictional elements.
Author: Bethania Palma

Title: Do People in Sweden Have to Sign a 'Consent Form' Before Having Sex?
Byline: A right-wing Facebook page used a prank photograph to misrepresent a Swedish government proposal to change the country's consent laws.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Is This Pope Francis Dancing Merengue?
Byline: A viral video purportedly showing Pope Francis dancing merengue actually shows a lookalike at a Halloween party.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did a Vermont Woman Post a Joke About Trump 'Bringing Back Slavery'?
Byline: Heather Wick faced an online backlash after a racially insensitive Facebook post in 2017, and again in 2018.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Checking the Facts About 'Dreamers'
Byline: An Internet meme cites extremely dubious statistics to convince readers that the young undocumented immigrants known as "Dreamers" are a detriment to society.
Author: David Emery

Title: Is a 'Crocodile Dundee' Sequel Being Released in 2018?
Byline: Teasers posted online are actually promoting an Australian travel campaign.
Author: Arturo Garcia

Title: Did the NFL Admit to Rigging Games?
Byline: A deceptive video about rigged football games created by a "satire" Facebook page spread quickly on social media.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Was This White Fox Skinned Alive for Lady Gaga's Fur Coat?
Byline: Unrelated images of Lady Gaga in a (possibly fake) fur and a baby fox were circulated with messages claiming that this animal was skinned alive for the singer's wardrobe.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Is Tide Discontinuing Their PODS Product Because Consumers Eat Them?
Byline: A viral fake tweet caused some social media users to question whether the Tide Challenge spelled the end of the Tide PODS product.
Author: David Mikkelson

Title: Did Mark Zuckerberg Buy a $150 Million Yacht?
Byline: A Turkish web site published, then deleted, a quickly-debunked story about Facebook's chief executive officer.
Author: Arturo Garcia

Title: Are Women Using Their Menstrual Blood as Face Masks?
Byline: A viral Facebook post is no more than a hoax that plays off the blood-like appearance of a popular skincare product.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Did a Woman Wear This Revealing Dress to a Hollywood Event to Protest Sexual Harassment?
Byline: A photograph showing model Giulia Salemi in a revealing dress is real, but it has little to do with Hollywood or sexual harassment and were taken long before the start of the #MeToo movement.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did Melania Trump Copy Michelle Obama's MLK Day Message?
Byline: Rumors holding that Melania Trump plagiarized her Martin Luther King Day tweet from former First Lady Michelle Obama were not rooted in reality.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did a Congresswoman Tweet that Trump Wanted War with 'North Japan'?
Byline: A fake tweet-generator was used to create the appearance that Sheila Jackson Lee had authored a tweet riddled with historical inaccuracies.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Are Feminists Complaining About 'Telepathic Rape'?
Byline: An Infowars editor highlighted an excerpt from a post from a site that he was apparently unaware was intended to be read as "satire."
Author: Arturo Garcia

Title: What Happens When You Cross the United States Border Illegally?
Byline: A viral Facebook post comparing U.S. immigration policy to that of North Korea and Afghanistan gets most of the facts wrong.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Lottery Winner Shane Missler Giving Away Money for Retweets?
Byline: A Twitter account promising $5000 for retweets doesn't actually belong to the 20-year-old Mega Millions winner.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Does the Psychiatrist Who 'Diagnosed' President Trump Lack a License?
Byline: A number of far-right web sites have posted misleading stories casting doubt on whether Dr. Bandy Lee holds a current  medical license.
Author: Bethania Palma

Title: Did the Media Ignore Obama Calling Libya a 'Shit Show'?
Byline: President Obama used the term "shit show" in private to refer to the escalating violence in Libya following the death of Muammar Gaddafi.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Is Walmart Laying Off 100,000 Employees and Closing 250 Sam's Club Stores?
Byline: Dozens of Sam's Club stores are closing, but a partisan Facebook page vastly exaggerates the numbers involved.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: H&M to Release 'Equally Racist' Collection as Apology to Black People?
Byline: Social media users began posting images of children wearing "Equally Racist" shirts after a satire web site created them.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Does Donald Trump Not Know the Words to the National Anthem?
Byline: A viral video shows the president apparently fumbling for the words as he sings along with the national anthem at a football game.
Author: David Emery

Title: Do These Photographs Show Snowfall in the Sahara Desert?
Byline: The meteorological phenomenon is rare but not unprecedented.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Three Former Presidents Mocked Trump on Twitter?
Byline: A satire site published doctored images that appeared to show former presidents Obama, Bush, and Clinton mocking President Trump's tweet about winning the election on his "first try."
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Were 22 Clinton Foundation Employees Arrested on First Day of FBI Investigation?
Byline: Unreliable partisan web sites reposted a work of satire reporting that an FBI investigation into the Clinton Foundation had yielded 22 criminal arrests.
Author: David Emery

Title: Is This Kim Jong-Un Reading 'Fire and Fury'?
Byline: A doctored image purportedly shows the North Korean leader reading a book that portrays U.S. President Donald Trump and his staff in an unflattering light.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did a Republican Group Post Anti-Trump Billboards in Minnesota?
Byline: The billboards are real, but the so-called Republican group has an interesting donor behind it.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Is This Family Grieving a Soldier Killed in Action?
Byline: President Donald Trump shared the picture intending to criticize NFL players — but it was taken out of context.
Author: Arturo Garcia

Title: That Time Chelsea Clinton Tweeted 'Happy New Year' to the Church of Satan
Byline: How the daughter of a former president wound up in the company of a supermodel and the Church of Satan in a Twitter thread for the ages.
Author: David Emery

Title: Were DACA Recipients Photographed Burning an American Flag?
Byline: A photograph of a protest was shared with unfounded claims and an inaccurate and misleading description.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did Donald Trump Tweet About Daughter Tiffany's 'Skintight' Dress?
Byline: A parody account — not the president himself — tweeted a suggestive remark about Tiffany Trump.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did Melania Trump Wear Shower Curtains?
Byline: Images purportedly showing the First Lady in a dress bearing the same pattern as a shower curtain have been manipulated.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did Nancy Pelosi Tweet That She Is 'Disgusted' with 'President' Trump?
Byline: The long-time House member supposedly didn't like the President Trump's 'allowing people to keep more of the money they earn.'
Author: Dan Evon

Title: How Have the Net Worths of Presidents Changed?
Byline: An image comparing changes in the financial status of former and current United States presidents is not particularly revealing.
Author: David Mikkelson

Title: Did Michele Bachmann Say Banning Mexican Food Would 'End Illegal Border Crossings'?
Byline: A parody Facebook page comes up with yet another fake quote attributed to the former lawmaker.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: The Remarkable Sabrina Pasterski
Byline: A viral meme about a Harvard University graduate student gets most (but not all) of the facts right.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: 2018's 'Amazing' Calendar
Byline: A social media image highlighting a supposedly "amazing" aspect to the 2018 calendar is neither amazing nor accurate.
Author: David Mikkelson

Title: Was Rosie O'Donnell Arrested for Trying to Bribe Lawmakers?
Byline: Reports that the comedian was taken into custody by federal authorities over a controversial political tweet are fake news.
Author: David Mikkelson

Title: Did Rosie O'Donnell Offer Bribes to Senators on Twitter?
Byline: The comedian "offered" two million dollars each to two Republican senators if they voted no on the GOP tax bill, but attendant bribery charges would be unlikely.
Author: Alex Kasprak

Title: Did a Man Sell Chuck E. Cheese Tokens as 'Bitcoins'?
Byline: A story claiming that a man had scammed people by selling "Bitcoins" was just fake news from a repeat offender.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Woman Almost Loses Leg After Cutting Herself Shaving?
Byline: Viral reports of a woman’s harrowing experience with a life-threatening skin infection are mostly true, but omitted some important details.
Author: Alex Kasprak

Title: Was a Real Mermaid Found in India?
Byline: Images purportedly showing a real mermaid are based on an animatronic sculpture.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did 'View' Host Joy Behar Grab Robin Williams by the Crotch?
Byline: A 2006 photograph shows Behar and Williams cutting up with fellow comedians Billy Crystal and Whoopi Goldberg.
Author: Bethania Palma

Title: Did Roy Moore Receive 953 Votes to Doug Jones' 5,327 in a Town of 1,867 Registered Voters?
Byline: A popular Facebook rumor contends that Alabama's December 2017 election showed major voting irregularities — but the claim is "satire."
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Probation for Child Rape Vs. Prison for Stealing Ribs?
Byline: A Facebook meme accurately presents the basic facts of two very different but equally controversial cases.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Did a Dog Defecate on the Steps of 10 Downing Street?
Byline: Brits often post a photograph of a dog purportedly defecating on the steps British government headquarters to express frustration with the government.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Do Eddie Bauer Stores Destroy Leftover Clothes Instead of Donating Them?
Byline: While the company confirmed that photographs taken outside its New York City store are real, there is no indication that cutting up clothes before dumping them is a common practice.
Author: Arturo Garcia

Title: Did Senator Chuck Schumer Have an Affair with a Teenager?
Byline: A routine review of content labeled satire.
Author: David Mikkelson

Title: Is a New Hand Sign Being Used by Teens to Acquire Drugs?
Byline: A Facebook post suggesting that teenagers are using a common hand sign to show they wish to buy drugs was intended to be humorous.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Were 50 Dead Bodies Found on a Beach in Cancun?
Byline: A disreputable web site devoted to "viral" stories turned two Spanish journalists' work into a scare-mongering story.
Author: Arturo Garcia

Title: Does Switching Your Twitter Location to Germany Block Nazi Content?
Byline: Changing your Twitter account's country to Germany does cause some far-right profiles to be withheld from view.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Is a Protester Holding an 'All Holidays Matter' Sign?
Byline: An image purporting to show two men with signs — one reading "We must stop the war on Christmas" and another that says "All holidays matter" — is a hoax.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Are These Images of Tortured Nigerian Slaves in Libya?
Byline: Although gruesome photographs were misrepresented by a Nigerian politician, men from sub-Saharan African countries are being auctioned as slaves in Libya, as witnessed by CNN.
Author: Bethania Palma

Title: Is this a Time-Traveling Hula Hooper?
Byline: The woman hula-hooping in this photograph did not time-travel to the 1930s.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Are People Getting Threatening 'Robocalls' for Criticizing President Trump Online?
Byline: Messages from the "Trump for Office Foundation" were actually designed by a company that allows users to send prerecorded "prank calls" to people they know.
Author: Arturo Garcia

Title: Is Taco Bell Roy Moore's Main Financial Backer?
Byline: A social media rumor calling for a boycott of Taco Bell inaccurately claims that either the chain or its owner is the main financial backer of the embattled politician.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Was Putin Pictured Taking a Lollipop from a Child?
Byline: Photographs of Russian President Vladimir Putin at a Christmas service looked as if he were stealing a sucker from a child.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Do These Photographs Depict the Libyan Slave Trade?
Byline: An emotive Facebook post about the slave trade in Libya used photographs that were either unrelated to the slave trade or whose sources are unknown.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Do Photographs Show a Child Forced to Shoot His Dog?
Byline: A Facebook post purportedly depicting a small child who had to shoot the family dog over barking complaints is a fabrication.
Author: David Mikkelson

Title: Is This Ryan Zinke Posing with a Dead Elephant?
Byline: The Secretary of the Interior is not the man in a widely-circulated photograph.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Does This Photo Show George Orwell and Ernest Hemingway During the Spanish Civil War?
Byline: The image from the Spanish Civil War features one of the famous authors, but not both.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Does This Photograph Show Obama Riding the Subway Next to an Open-Mouthed Sleeping Man?
Byline: Most of us who ride the subway have shared this experience at one time or another.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did Franken Photog Say Groping Image Was Staged?
Byline: A fake quote ostensibly uttered by the photographer who took the infamous image of Senator Al Franken and Leeann Tweeden was circulated in November 2017.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Does an Image Depict the Texas Church Shooter at a Bernie Sanders Rally?
Byline: An image circulating on Facebook purporting to depict the Texas church shooter in Bernie Sanders regalia in fact does not.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Does This Photograph Show a Group of Deported U.S. Veterans?
Byline: A picture of veterans in Mexico who were deported after serving the U.S. military was met with some skepticism.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did a Woman Say the Washington Post Offered Her $1,000 to Accuse Roy Moore of Sexual Abuse?
Byline: A conspiratorial web site shared a story based solely on unsourced tweets claiming the venerable newspaper paid off sources.
Author: Bethania Palma

Title: Does a Video Show Needlessly Wasted Food at an Ohio Walmart?
Byline: A misleading viral video that purports to show wasted food at a store in Celina, Ohio in fact shows the aftermath of a devastating tornado and the ensuing loss of power.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: 'A Little Gun History'
Byline: An internet post purporting to prove that the worst genocides of the twentieth century were the result of gun control laws includes a good deal of erroneous history.
Author: David Emery

Title: Is This a Picture of André the Giant Holding a Beer Can?
Byline: Big hands or small can?  Inquiring minds want to know.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did Hoboken Mayor Ravi Bhalla 'Vow to Glorify Islam In Every Decision'?
Byline: A "satirical" web site regurgitated Islamophobic stereotypes in a post following Bhalla's November 2017 election.
Author: Arturo Garcia

Title: Were Baseball Players Photographed Kneeling to Protest Lynchings in the 1950s?
Byline: A prank web site user used a photograph from 1936 to gin up a "story" spoofing modern player protests.
Author: Arturo Garcia

Title: Is Clothing Retailer Marshalls Still Paying Employees in Puerto Rico?
Byline: A Facebook post brought attention to the retail chain's treatment of workers after Hurricane Maria.
Author: Arturo Garcia

Title: Did Michael Lombardi Kill a Hibernating Bear in New Jersey?
Byline: A photograph showing a hunter with a recently killed bear is frequently shared with a erroneous backstory.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did President Trump Impatiently Dump Fish Food in a Japanese Koi Pond?
Byline: An image showing President Trump dumping fish food into a koi pond was shared with misleading statements about his behavior.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Was the Texas Church Shooter a Muslim Convert Named 'Samir Al-Hajeed'?
Byline: False reports revive a long-running hoax about the comedian Sam Hyde.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Papa John's John Schnatter vs. Little Caesar's Mike Ilitch
Byline: A meme comparing the founders of Papa John's (John Schnatter) and Little Caesar's (Mike Ilitch) pizza chains contains a mixture of facts and factoids.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Did Jared Kushner Scrub His Twitter Account After Manafort Indictment?
Byline: A baseless rumor that Jared Kushner had scrubbed his Twitter account was circulated in the wake of Paul Manafort's indictment.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Was the 'Black Soldier' Killed in Niger a Deserter?
Byline: A "satire" site posted a fake story appearing to report that Sgt. La David Johnson, who was killed in combat in Niger, was a defector.
Author: Bethania Palma

Title: Did a British Pub Chain Ban 'Offensive' Remembrance Poppies?
Byline: A Twitter account posing as JD Wetherspoon falsely claimed the chain banned the flowers due to "multiculturalism".
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Is this Unflattering Image of President Trump Real?
Byline: A doctored image of Trump circulated with a tongue-in-cheek request not to repost it.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Are NFL Players Protesting Against Police Brutality Absentee Parents Putting Their Children at Risk?
Byline: Social media users sought to smear demonstrations against police brutality by insulting the characters of several retired players.
Author: Arturo Garcia

Title: Did a Tattooed Jimi Hendrix Ride a Dune Buggy?
Byline: A doctored image featuring Jimi Hendrix covered in tattoos was circulated on social media in October 2017.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did Charles Krauthammer Write an Op-Ed Called 'The Enemy Among Us?'
Byline: The Washington Post columnist did not write an article alleging that former President Barack Obama was creating a "shadow government" through his nonprofit Organizing for Action.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Was Anibe Alexandra Odoma Kidnapped In Houston?
Byline: Social media posts falsely stated that the 5-year-old Nigerian abduction victim -- who has since been rescued -- lived in the U.S.
Author: Arturo Garcia

Title: Was a Half-Human, Half-Lion Hybrid Creature Found in Indonesia?
Byline: Images purportedly depicting a creepy chimera-like creature actually show a silicone doll.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Lawmaker's Thong Showed During Swearing-In Ceremony?
Byline: Italian lawmaker Maria Elena Boschi was targeted for ridicule in a doctored image.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Is This Melania Trump's Body Double?
Byline: An unfounded online rumor that a Melania-lookalike appeared at an event in the first lady's stead was based on a distorted video.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Does This Photo Show Trump Getting a Spray Tan?
Byline: A popular social media image purportedly depicts President Trump getting a spray tan in the Oval Office.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did a Football Fan Sit on an American Flag While Wearing a Shirt Reading 'I Stand for the National Anthem'?
Byline: A sports news web site published the photograph, which was taken during a game between the New York Jets and the New England Patriots.
Author: Arturo Garcia

Title: Did Sprinklers Save a House from a Massive Wildfire?
Byline: A photograph showing a home with a green lawn surrounded by charred land is real, but the back story accompanying it is incomplete.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Was a Woman Killed by a Frozen Shaft of Urine?
Byline: An image purportedly showing a woman who was pierced by a urine icicle originated on a 1990s-era British television show.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Does This Photograph Show a Little Girl Desperately Clinging to a Screen Door During a Hurricane?
Byline: A video showing a little girl hanging on to a door on a windy day is real, but it was not captured during a hurricane.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Does This Image Show a 1930s Housewife Forced into 'Smile Therapy'?
Byline: A creepy vintage image of dubious provenance purports to illustrate an outdated psychiatric treatment for unhappy housewives.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Is Trump International Hotel Handing Out Anti-CNN Petitions?
Byline: A woman posted an image of a petition that she says an anonymous individual gave her at the hotel bar, prompting a rumor that guests were receiving it upon check-in.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Lebron James Wore a 'We March, Y'all Mad' Protest Shirt?
Byline: An image purportedly showing Lebron James wearing a "We march, y'all mad" shirt was digitally manipulated.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Does 'Cinderella Surgery' Modify Feet to Resemble High Heels?
Byline: A photograph purportedly showing a foot after "Cinderella Surgery" is actually a digital creation.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did Michele Bachmann Say Vegas Victims Would be Alive If They Observed the Sabbath?
Byline: A meme with a fabricated quote painted the U.S. Representative as having been shockingly insensitive to the Las Vegas shooting victims.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Pizza Hut 58th Anniversary Freebie Scam
Byline: Pizza Hut is not giving three pizzas away to contest entrants in celebration of their 58th anniversary.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Did 'Melbourne Antifa' Claim Responsibility for the Vegas Massacre?
Byline: A page falsely posing as part of the anti-fascist movement put up a post claiming that "comrades" were responsible for an October 2017 mass shooting in Las Vegas, Nevada.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Are 871 Convicted Felons Currently Playing for the NFL?
Byline: A meme circulated in an effort to discredit professional athletes protesting racism contained false information.
Author: Bethania Palma

Title: Is This Viral List of U.S. Government Emergency Aid Sent to Puerto Rico Accurate?
Byline: Some social media posts defending the Trump administration's relief efforts in Puerto Rico following Hurricane Maria strayed into fictional territory.
Author: David Emery

Title: Did the Army Football Team Kneel in Protest During the National Anthem?
Byline: A photograph purportedly showing the Army Black Knights team kneeling in protest actually shows the Navy football team kneeling in prayer.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did the NFL Give Donald Trump a Lifetime Ban After a Disastrous Lawsuit?
Byline: A viral meme got some facts right about an infamous 1980s lawsuit involving Donald Trump's football team but missed the mark with others.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Did an NFL Player Burn an American Flag in a Locker Room?
Byline: A doctored photograph purportedly showed a member of the Seattle Seahawks setting a U.S. flag on fire.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Can Some Horses Grow Mustaches?
Byline: Some hirsute equines can indeed grow mustaches; in this case, the dapper pictures do not lie.
Author: Alex Kasprak

Title: Did a Cheesecake Factory Customer Receive Misleading 'Tip Suggestions' on His Receipt?
Byline: A viral Facebook post shows an authentic credit card receipt for a Cheesecake Factory order with misleading and exaggerated tip suggestions, but the discrepancy was caused by an error.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Did Donald Trump Bankrupt a Golf Course, Leaving Puerto Rico with $33 Million in Debt?
Byline: A viral string of tweets got some facts right about a failed business venture involving a Trump company, but it also left out some important context.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Michael Hayden Said of NFL Protest Dispute 'Put Me Down with Kaepernick'?
Byline: A viral quote about recent protests staged by NFL players was correctly attributed to former CIA Director Michael Hayden.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did the Guggenheim Museum Plan to Host Exhibits Criticized by Some as Cruel to Animals?
Byline: An online petition accurately describes the basic facts about three installations that were later removed from a Chinese art exhibition.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Aaron Rodgers Photographed Holding 'Stand For the Flag, Kneel for the Cross' T-Shirt?
Byline: A photograph purportedly showing Green Bay Packers quarterback Aaron Rodgers holding a "Stand for the flag, kneel for the cross" shirt is fake.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did Melania Trump Steal Her United Nations Speech from Michelle Obama?
Byline: A meme claiming that Trump plagiarized a September 2017 speech from a 2014 talk by the former First Lady is false.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did a 1990 Comic Depict Trump Coming to Power and Building a Wall?
Byline: A 27-year-old comic strip by Peter Kuper received renewed interest on social media in 2017.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Were UFOs Spotted Over Oklahoma City?
Byline: Despite claims made in a viral video, purported unidentified flying objects are actually identifiable as United States Navy paratroopers over Salt Lake City, Utah.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did the Red Cross Steal Donations in Texas, Empowered by an Obama-Era Executive Order?
Byline: A viral Facebook video contains false and unproven claims about the humanitarian organization's actions in the aftermath of Hurricane Harvey.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Iowa to Discontinue Soda and Candy for EBT Recipients on 1 October 2017?
Byline: A Facebook prank site published a hoax report that soda and candy would no longer be eligible for electronic benefits transfer purchases.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did Ben Carson Tell Hurricane Victims 'Homelessness Is A Gift From Heaven'?
Byline: An image circulating online attributes an insensitive (and fabricated) quote to the Secretary of Housing and Urban Development.
Author: Arturo Garcia

Title: Hurricane Jose Causes 30-Foot Waves At Jennette's Pier?
Byline: An image purportedly showing a 30-foot wave crashing down on Jennette's Pier in North Carolina is a digital creation.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: 41-Lb. Rat Caught in New York City?
Byline: A photograph of a "41-lb. rat caught in New York City" probably features an ordinary rat made to seem larger through forced perspective.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Are Police in Sweden No Longer Investigating Rapes Since Migrants Arrived?
Byline: Former UKIP leader Nigel Farage cited the conspiracy web site InfoWars in a tweet claiming police in Sweden admitted they are "no longer" investigating rape.
Author: Bethania Palma

Title: Is This a Giant Seahorse Fossil?
Byline: A Photoshop contest entry has resurfaced on social media, where people claim it is evidence of a human-sized seahorse.
Author: Alex Kasprak

Title: Scene from 'Maya the Bee' Features a Phallic Image?
Byline: A scene from the children's show features a hidden risqué drawing on the inside of a log.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did Floodwaters in Southeast Texas Test Positive for Several Diseases After Harvey?
Byline: There is no evidence to support a viral Facebook warning about certain cities, but the public should be very cautious about contact with floodwaters.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Did the Red Cross Serve This Meal to Hurricane Victims?
Byline: A photograph purportedly showing a meal served by the Red Cross to victims of Hurricane Harvey in Texas was actually a picture of a school lunch from 2014.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Is This Heath Ledger Posing with Cillian Murphy?
Byline: A photograph purportedly showing actors Heath Ledger and Cillian Murphy is a digital creation.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did a Criminology Textbook Use Brock Turner to Illustrate an Entry on Rape?
Byline: An image of the man convicted of sexually assaulting a woman on the Stanford University campus was used to illustrate a textbook entry on rape.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Lincoln and Lee's Views on Slavery
Byline: A meme widely circulated in the wake of a controversy over Confederate memorials does not accurately reflect Abraham Lincoln's and Robert E. Lee's views on slavery and the Civil War.
Author: David Mikkelson

Title: Hurricane Irma Floods Miami International Airport?
Byline: The White House's social media director mistook a video showing heavy flooding at the Mexico City International Airport for its Miami counterpart.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did Hurricane Irma Draw the Water Away from Beaches in Florida and the Bahamas?
Byline: Remarkable images appear to show examples of a real meteorological phenomenon called "negative surge."
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Hurricane Irma Rumor FAQ
Byline: Hurricane Irma has prompted the showering of social media with rumors, astonishing photographs, and other questionable claims.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Did a 2005 Movie Feature Hurricanes Named Harvey and Irma?
Byline: An online conspiracy theory about government-created hurricanes gets even the most basic facts wrong.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Are These People Golfing Near a Huge Forest Fire?
Byline: A photograph shows a group of people golfing near a large forest fire, but they aren't in as much danger as they appear.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Does a Viral Video of Mercury and Aluminum Mixing Suggest That Vaccines Are Unsafe?
Byline: A science experiment on YouTube was co-opted by anti-vaccine activists to make scientifically illiterate innuendos about vaccine safety.
Author: Alex Kasprak

Title: Does Hurricane Florence Now Contain Sharks?
Byline: An image of a news ticker reading "Hurricane Florence now contains sharks" is a recycled fake.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Can the 'FireChat' App Send Messages Without an Internet Connection?
Byline: The app works as advertised, but it does have some distance limitations.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did Donald Trump Cut Funding for Obamacare Enrollment Publicity?
Byline: Facebook warnings accurately describe a 90 percent budget cut for publicizing the shortened 2018 enrollment period for Obamacare.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Is This a Doctor Mourning a Woman Who Died During Childbirth?
Byline: A photograph reportedly depicts a crying doctor mourning for a patient who died in childbirth after she had struggled with fertility.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Does the Zello Phone App Work Without the Internet?
Byline: The Zello walkie-talkie cellphone app can be useful in an emergency situation, it still requires the internet to function.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did FEMA Deny Aid to Harvey Victims Unless They Received Vaccinations?
Byline: A false rumor that could discourage hurricane victims from seeking aid spread on social media.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Did the Red Cross Prevent 400 Hamburgers from Getting to Harvey Victims?
Byline: A vague, viral post claiming that Red Cross volunteers refused to serve hamburgers was reprinted by various web sites without verification.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Did CNN Mistake Tim Allen for Joel Osteen?
Byline: CNN did not mistakenly use a picture of actor Tim Allen for a story about pastor Joel Osteen.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did President Trump Assist Rescuers in Pulling Hurricane Victims from Floodwaters?
Byline: A photograph appears to show President Trump on a raft in Texas saving a flood victim after Hurricane Harvey.
Author: Bethania Palma

Title: Only 60 of 1,566 Churches in Houston Opened to Help Hurricane Harvey Victims?
Byline: A meme claiming that only 4 percent of churches in Houston opened their doors to Hurricane Harvey victims appears to have originated on a satirical Facebook page and was not based on any legitimate statistics.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Is There a Link Between Major Hurricanes and 29 August?
Byline: A viral meme falsely states that four hurricanes hit the United States on 29 August in various years, prompting spurious claims about this "pattern."
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Paul Ryan Endorsed Antifa?
Byline: A meme featuring a fake Paul Ryan quote originated with a fake antifa Twitter account.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Is This James Earl Jones Dressed as Darth Vader?
Byline: A photograph taken at a UK 'Star Wars' premiere is often circulated with the false claim that it documents racial segregation laws in 1970s London.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Trump Gets a Spray Tan Before Appearing on Television?
Byline: A photograph purportedly showing President Donald Trump getting a spray tan before a television appearance actually features a wax replica of him.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Shelby Township Meijer 'Human Trafficking' Warning
Byline: One of many human trafficking warnings spread on Facebook in August 2017 involved a purported kidnapping attempt at a Shelby Township, Michigan Meijer store.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Did J.K. Rowling Buy a Twitter User's Home as Revenge for His Criticism?
Byline: A fake article on a comedy web site managed to fool a number of readers into thinking the author had turned the tables on an online troll.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Imminent Changes Introduced to Texas Insurance Law in the Midst of Harvey?
Byline: Viral posts on social media largely accurately describe a change to Texas state law about hurricane insurance — but they lack important context.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Was Barack Obama Serving Meals in Texas During Hurricane Harvey?
Byline: Images of the former president serving food appeared alongside claims that he was in Houston after massive flooding there, but the picture was actually taken during a 2015 charity event.
Author: Arturo Garcia

Title: Fake Photographs: Harvey Edition
Byline: As usual, fake and misleading images were circulated on social media in the wake of a storm that brought catastrophic flooding to the streets of Houston.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Were Enormous Pyramids Just Discovered In Antarctica?
Byline: Viral images attempting to sell pyramid-shaped features as evidence of an ancient civilization in Antarctica show nothing but mountains.
Author: Alex Kasprak

Title: Did NFL Player Isaiah Crowell Post an Image of a Police Officer Being Killed?
Byline: The Cleveland Browns running back posted the artist's rendering to Instagram in July 2016; then quickly deleted it and repeatedly apologized.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Did Bart Simpson Mock Islam During a Chalkboard Gag?
Byline: An image purportedly showing a Simpsons chalkboard gag in which Bart mocked Islam is fake.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Is It Legal in Texas to Use Deadly Force to Protect a Statue from Vandalism?
Byline: A viral Facebook post suggested it is legal in Texas to use deadly force to stop Confederate statues from being vandalized.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Spanish Woman Cut in Half in Fatal Elevator Accident?
Byline: A web site posted an unclear translation of a news account about a grisly incident that killed a Spanish woman in a hospital shortly after she gave birth.
Author: Arturo Garcia

Title: The Post-Civil War Lives of Robert E. Lee and Jefferson Davis
Byline: A Tumblr post mischaracterizes the two Confederate leaders' positions after the Civil War.
Author: Arturo Garcia

Title: Did Sunlight Form a Cross During the Eclipse?
Byline: An image purportedly showing sunlight forming the shape of a cross during the August 2017 eclipse is not a genuine photograph.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Man Looks Like Mountain?
Byline: A photograph purportedly showing a supine man on a beach near a mountain resembling his outline is, hilariously, genuine.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did a Law Professor Assert That a Solar Eclipse Was 'Racist'?
Byline: Two conservative web sites grossly misrepresented the content of a lyric essay in The Atlantic magazine.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Maxine Waters Fears a Trump-led War After Nuclear Attack by North Korea?
Byline: Right-wing Facebook pages created a meme containing a fabricated quote attributed to the Democratic Congresswoman.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Are These Rainbow Mountains Real?
Byline: An image purportedly showing a rainbow-colored mountain range in California was digitally manipulated.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Is This Steve Bannon with a Bloody Lip?
Byline: An image of Steve Bannon with a bloody lip was a creatively edited — but convincing — photograph from a satire site.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Is This a Snapshot of Freddie Mercury Putting on Makeup?
Byline: A photograph purportedly showing Queen singer Freddie Mercury applying intricate maquillage was digitally manipulated.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Is the Accused Charlottesville Killer an 'Anti-Trump Leftist' Supported by Clinton, Soros?
Byline: Various right-leaning sources immediately — and inaccurately — identified the driver of the vehicle that plowed through a crowd of counter-protesters in Charlottesville as a "radical leftist."
Author: David Emery

Title: Did a Hotel Owner in Switzerland Ask Jewish Guests to Shower Before Using the Pool?
Byline: News articles accurately describe real signs posted around a hotel in Arosa, Switzerland that were widely condemned as anti-Semitic.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Did Trump Retweet a Cartoon of a Train Hitting a CNN Reporter?
Byline: President Trump retweeted, then quickly deleted, a cartoon of a train hitting a CNN reporter, leaving some to wonder if the posting was real.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Trump Photographed with Charlottesville White Supremacist?
Byline: A doctored photograph appearing to show Trump posing with a white supremacist garnered attention on social media following a neo-Nazi rally that left one woman dead.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Antifa Member Photographed Beating Police Officer?
Byline: A photograph purportedly showing an Antifa member hitting a police officer has been digitally manipulated.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Racist Protesters Protected by Black Policeman?
Byline: A photograph showing a black police officer protecting participants in a white supremacist protest was widely circulated after violent events in Charlottesville, Virginia.
Author: David Mikkelson

Title: Has NASA Called the Image of the Virgin of Guadalupe 'Living'?
Byline: Scientists from the National Aeronautics and Space Administration have not announced that "Our Lady of Guadalupe", a religious artifact, is alive.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Did Fukushima Officials Warn that Humans Should Never Eat Fish Again?
Byline: The claim comes from a 2013 blog post about preparing for the collapse of civilization, but it is just as wrong now as it was then.
Author: Alex Kasprak

Title: Are Memberships No Longer Necessary to Shop at Costco?
Byline: Clickbait articles on Facebook are misleading users into thinking people no longer need a memberships to shop at the warehouse stores.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Does This Photograph Show a Huge Blue Whale Under a Rowboat?
Byline: An image showing a blue whale dwarfing a rowboat under which it appears to be swimming is actually a piece of digital artwork.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Pope Francis Kisses David Rockefeller's Hand?
Byline: A photograph of Pope Francis greeting Holocaust survivors is part of a meme containing the baseless claim that the spiritual leader is kissing the hand of a purported architect of a New World Order.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did Russian Scientists Discover a 'Cure' for Homosexuality?
Byline: Online reports of the discovery by Russian medical researchers of a "cure" or "vaccine" for homosexuality are fake news.
Author: David Emery

Title: Online Store Selling 'Horse Burkas' for Muslim Customers?
Byline: A satirical web site poked fun at Islamophobia by claiming fly protection gear for horses was religious clothing.
Author: Bethania Palma

Title: Did 62°C Temperatures in Kuwait Cause Trees to Burst into Flames?
Byline: Despite a series of images showing melted street lights and trees on fire, the temperature in Kuwait has not reached 143.6°F.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Were 'Highway Closed in Event of Enemy Attack' Signs Posted During the Cold War?
Byline: Early 1950s efforts to prepare Americans for nuclear war included the erection of signs giving advance notice of highway closures in the event of attack.
Author: David Emery

Title: Is NASA Hiring Someone to Protect Earth from Aliens?
Byline: NASA has announced a job opening for a planetary protection officer, but viral news reports take significant liberties when describing the nature of the job.
Author: Alex Kasprak

Title: Does a Meme Accurately Advise Sexual Assault Victims?
Byline: A meme posted to Reddit made statements of mixed accuracy about the rights of victims of rape and sexual assault.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Was a Giant System of Roots Discovered Below the Devil's Tower Rock Formation?
Byline: A Facebook page reported that Devil's Tower, a large rock formation in Wyoming, was actually the remnants of a giant tree.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did John McCain's Vote Stop the ACA Repeal for the 2017 Fiscal Year?
Byline: A theory spread online overstated the consequences of the Arizona senator's July 2017 vote to repeal the Affordable Care Act.
Author: Arturo Garcia

Title: Does NASA Data Show That Global Warming Isn't Causing a Sea Level Rise?
Byline: Dubious web sites generously provided the Internet with textbook examples of both cherry-picked data and the shameless conflation of weather with climate.
Author: Alex Kasprak

Title: Scaramucci Posts Nude Photos of His Wife as Revenge for Divorce?
Byline: A satire site used news of disarray at the White House to push a false story about the new communications director.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Steven Furtick Signs Six Year, $110 Million Contract with Lakewood Church?
Byline: Elevation Church Pastor Steven Furtick took to Twitter to dispel a satire site's claim about him.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Lion Snuggles With Cat?
Byline: A photograph purportedly showing a house cat cuddling with a lion was digitally altered for an advertising campaign.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Is this a Kayaker Paddling Through a Pod of Orca Whales?
Byline: A painting by a Canadian artist is often mistaken for a photograph.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: John Lennon Played Guitar with Che Guevara?
Byline: A photograph purportedly showing the English musician and the Argentinian-Cuban revolutionary playing music together was digitally altered.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Is Snapchat Building a Facial Recognition Database for the Feds?
Byline: Online conspiracy theorists claim Snapchat's image filter feature called "Lenses" is covertly amassing a database of users' faces to share with law enforcement agencies.
Author: David Emery

Title: Tom Hanks Wears Political T-Shirt?
Byline: A July 2017 Facebook post is the latest to digitally add political slogans to a photograph of the actor.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Did CNN Bury the Justine Damond Story Because She Was a White Woman Killed By a 'Black Islamic Immigrant From Somalia'?
Byline: CNN, along with many other major media outlets all across the world, has covered the Damond shooting in great detail.
Author: Bethania Palma

Title: Did Wendy's Replace Workers With Machines?
Byline: A meme made the demonstrably false claim that Wendy's had replaced workers with machines at thousands of its restaurants, thanks to a minimum wage increase.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did Anthony Scaramucci Post a Sexually Explicit Tweet in 2009?
Byline: An image purportedly showing a missive from White House communications director Anthony Scaramucci was digitally manipulated.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did a Student Break Both Arms Jumping Off a Building for a Science Project?
Byline: A photograph appears to show a student who literally researched the question "jumping off buildings -- how high is too high?"
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Is This a Whale in a Venice Canal?
Byline: A photograph purportedly showing a large whale swimming through a canal in Venice was digitally manipulated.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Does This Photograph Show a Scarecrow Made from a Corpse?
Byline: "This poor fellow trespassed on the wrong farmer's property."
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Is This the 1898 Oklahoma Tornado?
Byline: A centuries-old photograph purportedly showing a tornado in Oklahoma is actually an early example of composite photography.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Donald Trump Wrote that Being an Atheist Gives Him a Business Edge?
Byline: A fake Art of the Deal quote was shared as meme in mid-2017.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did Chelsea Clinton Say Female Genital Mutilation Has 'Health Benefits'?
Byline: An April 2017 tweet in which Chelsea Clinton supposedly defended the cultural practice of "genital cutting" was a hoax.
Author: David Emery

Title: Is This President Trump With a Controversial Russian Lawyer?
Byline: A photograph of the president posing with a brunette woman doesn't depict Kremlin-linked attorney Natalia Veselnitskaya.
Author: Bethania Palma

Title: Dead Bigfoot Confirmed at Elephant Butte Lake, New Mexico?
Byline: A "prank" Facebook post claimed that Bigfoot was found dead on a lakeshore.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Is This a Real Photograph of Donald Trump's Older Sons?
Byline: A cartoonish photograph purportedly showing presidential sons Eric and Donald Trump, Jr. was digitally manipulated.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Peer-Reviewed Study Proves All Recent Global Warming Fabricated by Climatologists?
Byline: A blog post, even if you like it and it is presented in downloadable PDF form, is not a peer-reviewed study.
Author: Alex Kasprak

Title: Does This Photograph Document the Ancient Stump of a Giant Tree?
Byline: Jugurtha Tableland in Tunisia is a rock formation, not a vestige of forests that stretched miles into the sky.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Was an American Flag Displayed on the White House?
Byline: A meme comparing White House light displays under the Trump and Obama administration used a digitally altered image.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Was Vladimir Putin Surrounded by Other World Leaders at the G20 Summit?
Byline: A photograph purportedly showing the Russian president surrounded by political counterparts is not real.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Was a Home Depot Employee Fired for Helping Police Stop a Kidnapping?
Byline: The company offered Dillon Reagan his job back after his case garnered widespread attention online.
Author: Arturo Garcia

Title: Is this Really an Electric Car From 1905?
Byline: A photograph of the vehicle is real, but misdated.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Is This Muhammad Ali with All of His Winnings in 1964?
Byline: A photograph of Muhammad Ali standing near piles of cash in a bank vault is often shared with inaccurate or misleading information.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did Poland's First Lady Refuse to Shake President Trump's Hand?
Byline: A short viral video clip was cut off before showing that Agata Kornhauser-Duda did indeed greet the United States president.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Social Security 'Fun Facts'
Byline: In which we check into some "fun facts" about Social Security from a Facebook meme saying the government should stop "messing" with retirement benefits.
Author: David Emery

Title: Is China's 'Panda Bear Solar Farm' Real?
Byline: Although a panda bear-shaped solar farm was designed and built in China, an image that appears with the story is not a photograph but rather an artist's conceptual rendering.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Is This Muhammad Ali with a Young Michael Jackson?
Byline: A photograph purporting to show Ali with Jackson actually shows the boxer with Tiger Smalls.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Was a 'Masturbating Man' Found in the Ruins of Pompeii?
Byline: A miscaptioned photograph led to many jokes but little understanding.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Kid Rock Death Hoax
Byline: A Facebook "prank" claimed that musician Kid Rock had passed away in July 2017.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Investigation Proves Starbucks Beverages Contain Feces?
Byline: An imprecise test that appeared to show Starbucks drinks were contaminated prompted internet hysteria and widespread baseless claims.
Author: Alex Kasprak

Title: Is This What Police Uniforms in Norway Look Like?
Byline: A photograph purportedly showing a group of Norwegian police officers in skintight uniforms was digitally manipulated.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did Germany's Black Forest Cause 15,000 Missing Person Cases Last Year?
Byline: An inaccurate meme claimed that 15,000 people went missing in the forest that is thought to be the inspiration for many Grimm Brothers tales.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Does a KFC in Dearborn, Michigan Abide by 'Sharia Law'?
Byline: A photograph purporting to show a fast food restaurant in an American city was actually taken in Saudi Arabia.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Does a New Tattoo Ink Allow People With Diabetes to Monitor Their Blood Sugar Levels?
Byline: A viral meme describes a promising research project at MIT and Harvard, but so far it has only been tested on the skin of a dead pig.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Whataburger Closing Its Doors?
Byline: A "prank" Facebook post fooled many into thinking the restaurant chain was closing down.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Does This Photograph Show a Seal Hugging a Beluga Whale?
Byline: Are these mortal enemies in the food chain really making nice with each other?
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Do Women Retain DNA From Every Man They Have Ever Slept With?
Byline: This claim, like the microchimerism the viral article responsible for it purports to describe, is an incongruous mixture of information whose ultimate purpose remains unclear.
Author: Alex Kasprak

Title: Saltwater Crocodile Captured in Long Island Sound Near Bridgeport?
Byline: A Facebook "prank" fooled many people into believing that a saltwater crocodile was captured in Connecticut.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Is This a Real London Underground Sign?
Byline: An image purportedly showing an sign in the London Underground asking people to wear deodorant because the tube smelled like an old ham was just a joke.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Is This Tennis Champion Julie Richardson — in 1898?
Byline: An 1898 photograph of a woman named Julia Richardson was mistaken for a photograph of a 1980s tennis player with a similar name.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Is This Beyonce and Jay-Z Holding Their Twin Babies?
Byline: A photograph purportedly showing the couple holding their new twin babies was digitally altered.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Is This a Picture of Children Giving a Meerkat a Bath?
Byline: Sometimes even pets uncomplainingly go along with children's play.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Does Jon Ossoff Live Outside Georgia's Sixth Congressional District?
Byline: The Democratic candidate has drawn criticism online from President Donald Trump for living just outside the district boundary, but he is not legally required to live within the region he represents.
Author: Arturo Garcia

Title: Is This a Road Rage Incident in Russia?
Byline: What was mistaken by some for a snippet from a real video was actually a viral promotion for television show "Mafiosa".
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did Alexandria Shooter James Hodgkinson Hold a Sign With a Rand Paul Tweet?
Byline: A doctored image appears to show Hodgkinson holding a sign with a tweet about the Second Amendment.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Crystal Griner and Steve Scalise
Byline: A post lauding an officer for her role in saving Rep. Steve Scalise correctly described her sexuality but left out important context.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Rand Paul Tweeted That Purpose of Second Amendment Is to Shoot at Tyrannical Government?
Byline: A genuine tweet posted by the Kentucky senator was circulated out of context after lawmaker Steve Scalise was shot in Virginia.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Is This Picture of the Sun and Full Moon Between Two Trees Real?
Byline: An image showing a full moon above a setting sun and framed between two trees is not a genuine photograph.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Is the Common Household Plant 'Dieffenbachia' Deadly?
Byline: Viral web sites massively exaggerate the risk posed by these plants, even if that risk is rooted in a modicum of reality.
Author: Alex Kasprak

Title: Did President Trump Ride in a Penis-Shaped Motorcade?
Byline: A photograph purportedly shows vehicles in President Trump's motorcade positioned in an unusual formation.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did a UFO Disappear Into a 'Portal' Above Colorado?
Byline: A video of a UFO that has been viewed millions of times on social media did not coincide with any alien visitation.
Author: Bethania Palma

Title: Did President Trump Send Letters Lauding Middle Schoolers on Their 'Succuess'?
Byline: A viral Facebook photograph purportedly showed a major spelling error in a congratulatory letter to students.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Is the 'Liar in Chief' Time Magazine Cover Real?
Byline: A supposed TIME magazine cover pictures President Trump with the headline "Liar in Chief."
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did a German Woman Get Fined for Sharing a Meme on Facebook?
Byline: A Breitbart article accurately reports the fining of a Berlin woman under Germany's strict hate speech laws.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Is This Marilyn Monroe Posing With a Cat?
Byline: A doctored image appears to show Monroe holding a cat to her face.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did Sean Spicer Claim Trump Has the Authority to Change Spellings Like 'Covfefe'?
Byline: Although Spicer's actual reaction to the tweet drew widespread media attention, he did not claim that the President has the authority to change words.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Did President Trump Tour a Chemtrail Plane?
Byline: A photograph showing the chief executive on an airplane had nothing to do with chemtrails.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did 'The Simpsons' Predict That President Trump Would Touch a Glowing Orb?
Byline: Memes represented that the animated series showed Trump touching a glowing orb fifteen years before the actual incident took place.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Has Facebook Reversed Their 'Nipple Ban'?
Byline: Several Facebook users posted claims that the social network had reversed their ban on images of bare-chested women, but these were simply rumors.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Did Whoopi Goldberg Wear a Violent Anti-Trump Shirt?
Byline: Doctored images of Goldberg purportedly wearing a shirt depicting violence against the President resurfaced after a controversy involving comedian Kathy Griffin.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Is this President Trump with a Scantily Clad Woman?
Byline: An image purportedly showing President Trump with a stripper has been doctored.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Is this Donald Trump Sitting with Liberace?
Byline: An image purportedly showing Trump with flamboyant performer Liberace was faked.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did Maxine Waters Blame the London Attack on Climate and Healthcare 'Inaction'?
Byline: A parody Twitter account succeeds again in tricking users into taking a fake tweet seriously.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Man Mowed Lawn During Tornado?
Byline: A photograph showing a man mowing his lawn while a funnel cloud rages behind him appears to be completely genuine.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Is This Donald Trump in a Diaper?
Byline: A photograph purportedly showing Trump nearly nude and surrounded by bondage accoutrements is not real.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Are You Exempt from Paying Sold-Off Debt?
Byline: A popular social media item wrongly claims that consumers are not obligated to pay back debt that creditors have written off and sold to debt collectors.
Author: David Mikkelson

Title: Did Maxine Waters Use a Picture of the Tide Receding as Proof of Climate Change?
Byline: An account parodying the Congresswoman sent the tweet in response to President Donald Trump's decision to pull out of the Paris climate accord.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Will Texting 'FOOD' Help Provide Free Summer Meals for Children?
Byline: A viral message on social media contained accurate information about how to access food for kids this summer.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Was Kathy Griffin Shot and Killed Trying to Escape Custody?
Byline: Griffin's controversial photo shoot featuring a likeness of Donald Trump's severed head prompted a web site to falsely claim that the comedian had died.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Was 'Covfefe' A Secret Nuclear Code?
Byline: The confusion surrounding President Donald Trump's infamous tweet was fodder for a satirical news site.
Author: Arturo Garcia

Title: Was a Singaporean Woman Injured While Photocopying Her Breasts?
Byline: A dubious new web site published a fabricated story that lacked proper sourcing.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Did a Bombing Take Place in Vatican City?
Byline: A fear-mongering article falsely claiming a bombing had taken place in Vatican City used images of smoke caused by a junkyard fire.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Does Donald Trump Sit Through Meetings of World Leaders Without Notes?
Byline: A meme cherry-picked one snapshot from a longer meeting where the United States president did use notes.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Did a Valedictorian Drop Out Just Before Graduating to Become a CEO?
Byline: Gio Managadze wrote a viral Facebook post claiming he was valedictorian at the University of Maryland, but dropped out just before graduating to pursue his dreams.
Author: Bethania Palma

Title: Did President Trump's Twitter Account Gain Five Million New Bot Followers in Three Days?
Byline: According to archived images of Trump's Twitter page, rumors of a surge in followers were greatly exaggerated.
Author: Bethania Palma

Title: Did Rep. Darrell Issa 'Hide' on a Rooftop to Avoid Protesters?
Byline: The Republican from California says he was simply taking pictures, but his political opponent says he was avoiding constituents.
Author: Bethania Palma

Title: Do 'Angel Flights' Release Flare Salutes for Fallen Soldiers?
Byline: A photograph purportedly showing a plane releasing a flare salute to soldiers killed in battle is often shared with misleading information.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Was a Child Named Chloe Jones Abducted by a 'Creepy School Bus'?
Byline: A YouTube channel posts weekly horror stories, one of which was mistaken for a real event.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did Hillary Clinton Meet With the Manchester Bomber's Father?
Byline: A real picture with a false caption is being used to spread misinformation about the former Secretary of State on social media.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: President Trump Left Online Reviews for the Middle East?
Byline: An article appearing to report that Trump wrote reviews after a brief trip to the region was intended as satire.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did New Year's Fireworks 'Compete' with a Volcanic Eruption in Naples, Italy?
Byline: An animated image appears to show a volcano erupting during a New Year's firework celebration in Naples, Italy.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Is This 'Monster Bullfrog' Real?
Byline: A photograph of a "monster bullfrog" is real, but forced perspective makes it look larger than it actually is.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did President Trump's Lawyers Send Berkeley Breathed a Cease and Desist Letter?
Byline: A satirical letter shared on the cartoonist's Facebook page was widely believed to be legitimate on social media.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Bill Murray and Hunter S. Thompson Wore Vulgar T-Shirts?
Byline: An image showing Bill Murray and Hunter S. Thompson on a boat was doctored for a viral marketing campaign.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did Presidents Obama and Trump Write Wildly Different Entries in the Yad Yashem Guestbook?
Byline: An image showing what President Trump and former President Obama wrote in the Yad Yashem guest book is accurate.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Pope Francis Smiled with President Obama, Frowned with President Trump?
Byline: An image comparing Pope Francis's mood during President Obama and President Trump's visits doesn't tell the entire story.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Were These Women Found Guilty of Witchcraft in Early 20th Century China?
Byline: A photograph showing three women in a "cangue" is often shared with a backstory about witchcraft.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Everything Donald Trump Has Accomplished in Just Four Months?
Byline: We looked into the accuracy of a viral list touting President Trump's accomplishments during his first four months in office.
Author: David Emery

Title: Famous Baby Giraffe Passes Away Only a Month After Birth?
Byline: A Facebook post created using a "prank" web site fooled many into believing that internet star April the Giraffe's calf had died.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did Trump Offer Asylum to 'Lord Nazi Ruso'?
Byline: A Mexican news site posted a satirical story saying that the U.S. President had offered asylum to a Russian white supremacist living in Cancún.
Author: Arturo Garcia

Title: Did Ariana Grande Defile the American Flag?
Byline: Following a 22 May 2017 tragedy in Manchester, a photoshopped image of Ariana Grande defiling an American flag circulated.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Seth Rich's Parents 'Thank' Internet for Spreading Rumor He Leaked Thousands of E-Mails to WikiLeaks?
Byline: The murdered DNC staffer's parents posted a video to the family's GoFundMe page a month ago thanking people who donated — not those who spread the baseless rumor.
Author: Bethania Palma

Title: Trump Touches Glowing Orb in Saudi Arabia?
Byline: The real significance of a photograph of President Trump and Saudi leaders touching a glowing orb was lost on Internet jokesters.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: George Soros Indicted for Election Hacking?
Byline: A doctored image was used to spread the false claim that George Soros was indicted for election tampering.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: 'Leaked Image' Depicts President Obama in Handcuffs?
Byline: An image of President Obama handcuffed before a judge and charged with wiretapping President Trump is fake.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Amy Schumer to Star in an All-Female Remake of Saving Private Ryan?
Byline: A joke on Twitter has been fleshed out into a full-fledged hoax by two satirical web sites.
Author: Dan MacGuill

Title: Did a 1977 'Time' Story Offer Tips on 'How to Survive the Coming Ice Age'?
