Byline: While a number of media outlets reported on some briefly-lived scientific fears over global cooling in the 1970s, viral images purporting to show a cover story on the topic are doctored.
Author: Alex Kasprak

Title: Bruce Lee and Elvis Presley in a Dojo?
Byline: A photograph purportedly showing the martial artist and singer together is actually a composite of at least two different images.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did a Biplane Buzz a Los Angeles Beach in 1911?
Byline: An image purportedly showing a biplane flying low over a California beach is actually an early example of photographic manipulation.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Was a Pregnant Woman Raped by a Muslim Refugee in Michigan?
Byline: A false story used photographs of an Argentinian domestic abuse survivor to advance a claim with no basis in fact.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Are the 'Rainbow Mountains of Peru' Real?
Byline: Although a photograph does show a real location in Peru, the colors of the mountains appear to have been digitally enhanced.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did J.D. Salinger Write in the Nude?
Byline: A photograph purportedly showing the famously reclusive author wearing nothing but a pair of sandals actually shows a different writer, Jayson Loam.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Is Chick-fil-A Offering Free Food for Mother's Day?
Byline: An image spread online promoting a Mother Day's lunch special from the restaurant chain is a hoax.
Author: Arturo Garcia

Title: Did the U.S. Government Purposely Poison 10,000 Americans During Prohibition?
Byline: An Internet meme claims that government agencies tried to curb consumption of illegal liquor by adding poison.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Does Japan Have a '7D' Hologram Animal Park?
Byline: A viral video appearing to show a park in which visitors can touch, feel, and even smell virtual animals is a hoax.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Was a Giant Squid Carcass Found in Indonesia?
Byline: Photographs that purportedly show a giant squid carcass that washed up on an Indonesia beach actually show a dead whale.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did a Muslim Man Rape a 13-Year-Old Girl and Get Beaten by Trump Supporters?
Byline: A fake news web site stole an image from a 2013 incident in Egypt, then used it to claim that it showed a Muslim man who had raped a girl in Ohio.
Author: Bethania Palma

Title: Did a KGB Agent Confirm That the Sex Pistols Were Backed by the USSR to Destabilize the West?
Byline: A Facebook page for punk fans recirculated an old (and fake) story that the Sex Pistols were a KGB plot to foment dissent in the West.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Did Pastor Scarborough Blame Women's Impure Thoughts for Breast Cancer?
Byline: The Witty Liberal Facebook page resurrected a fake news story from early 2016 about the pastor.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Did James Comey Tweet About 'the Pee Tape' After Getting Fired?
Byline: A purported screenshot of a tweet sent by former FBI director James Comey is fake.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did a Trump Campaign Web Site URL Reveal a Contempt for the Poor?
Byline: Online users exploited a bug on the President's campaign website to create fake URLs.
Author: Arturo Garcia

Title: Was an Atlanta Man Assaulted and Raped by Gay Gang the 'Sweet Bloods'?
Byline: A number of sketchy sites posted an item about a "gay gang" called the "Sweet Bloods" and a purported attack in Atlanta.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Can You Have Your Ashes Mailed to Congress?
Byline: A Washington, D.C., college student created a web site for people planning a posthumous protest of the American Health Care Act.
Author: Arturo Garcia

Title: Did Sarah Palin Say People with Lyme Disease Should Stop Eating Limes?
Byline: Proposed changes to health care laws revived an old meme attributing a phony quote about Lyme disease to Sarah Palin.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Do Leaked Photographs Show 'Muslim Symbols' in Obama's White House?
Byline: A series of images purportedly showing Islamic writing, a sink, and a prayer room in President Obama's White House actually come from different and unrelated locations.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Malia Obama Busted Buying 6 Pounds of Marijuana in Chicago?
Byline: A fake news site photoshopped Malia Obama into an image from a 2013 news report about dogfighting to falsely claim she was arrested in Chicago.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Did Martin Luther King Jr. 'Flip the Bird' at a Photographer?
Byline: A photograph appearing to show the civil rights leader eloquently gesturing at a camera is a hoax.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did Native Americans Shoot Down an Airplane with Arrows?
Byline: Social media posts claim this plane was shot down by "natives" protesting an oil pipeline in North Dakota.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Was Angela Merkel's Hair Censored on Saudi Arabia State Television?
Byline: An image purporting to be a screenshot of a news story showing Germany's leader with pixelated hair is a hoax.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Was a Baby Born Holding an IUD?
Byline: A newborn was photographed holding his mother's failed birth control device, but he was not born clutching it in his hand.
Author: Bethania Palma

Title: Did a Canadian Woman Wear a 'My Legs Are Open for Refugees' Sign?
Byline: An image of a woman at a march welcoming refugees was doctored.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did Melania Trump 'Like' a Tweet Lampooning Her Relationship With President Trump?
Byline: The personal Twitter account for Melania Trump "liked" (then quickly "unliked") a post speculating about her relationship with her husband.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Does Dolph Lundgren Have Multiple Scientific Degrees?
Byline: A meme compares the educational backgrounds of 'Science Guy' Bill Nye and actor Dolph Lundgren.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: $75 Bed Bath & Beyond Coupon?
Byline: Another Facebook coupon scam has appeared, this time using phony Bed Bath & Beyond coupons to lure users into participating.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Did a Cornell Student Cut 37 Pounds Using Apple Cider Vinegar and Supplements?
Byline: Stories promoting a "diet hack" involving apple cider vinegar are based on unrelated photographs and false claims.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Is the 'Water Bending' Squirrel Real?
Byline: An image purportedly showing a squirrel appearing to magically avoid a stream of water is a composite of at least two different images.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Trump Caught Tweeting at Mar-a-Lago?
Byline: An unflattering image purportedly showing President Donald Trump sending a tweet from his Florida estate is a hoax.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Have Researchers Discovered a New 'Superfuel' 1,693 Times More Powerful Than Gasoline?
Byline: A viral marketing campaign called a resource used in lithium batteries a secret superfuel — all with the intent of selling investment tips in an expensive e-book.
Author: Alex Kasprak

Title: Did Michelle Obama File for Divorce Over Barack Obama's Pregnant Mistress?
Byline: A hoax news site used an  British tabloid's old photograph to claim that the former First Lady of the United States filed for divorce because her husband impregnated his mistress.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Was a Search Warrant Just Executed at the Obama Residence?
Byline: A fake news site used an unrelated picture to claim a search warrant was executed at the home of former U.S. President Barack Obama.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Was Pot Planted in Potholes in Portland?
Byline: An image purportedly showing marijuana plants growing in potholes is fake.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did a New York Restaurant Refuse to Serve a United States Soldier?
Byline: Social media posts claimed Villaggio's in Massapequa, New York, shunned a military member because he visited the restaurant with a service dog.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Was Paul Walker's Ghost Spotted on a 'Fast and Furious' Movie Set?
Byline: An image purportedly showing the ghost of Paul Walker is actually an altered photograph of the actor's brother.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did a Teen Boy Die After Pleasuring Himself 46 Times?
Byline: Images from a fatal shooting in Detroit were used to accompany a report that a teenaged boy died of "orgasmic shock."
Author: Snopes Staff

Title: Free Dunkin' Donuts Coupon Scam
Byline: An online Dunkin' coupon offering that promises a free box of donuts is part of an anniversary giveaway scam.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Did Marilyn Monroe and Elizabeth Taylor Pose Together?
Byline: Two long-buried photographs were doctored to show the two icons leaning against a tree together.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Are United Airlines Passengers Wearing Crash Helmets?
Byline: A photograph used to spur heckling of the embattled airline actually chronicles a training course hosted by a German airline.
Author: Arturo Garcia

Title: Did Canadian Fishermen Catch a 320-Pound Shrimp?
Byline: A doctored photograph replaced a giant catfish with an image of a "record-breaking" shrimp.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did Southwest Airlines Change Their Slogan After United Airlines Controversy?
Byline: An image purportedly showing a new Southwest Airlines slogan was created as a convincing joke.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did Jeff Sessions Refer to Immigrants as 'Filth'?
Byline: Prepared remarks by the Attorney General during an appearance in Arizona were misinterpreted online.
Author: Arturo Garcia

Title: Does United Airlines Have an Armed 'Seating and Apparel' Division?
Byline: A doctored photo mocked the airline's recent public relations disasters.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Is President Trump Making a White House Reality Show?
Byline: A satirical post about the First Family had readers doing a double-take.
Author: Arturo Garcia

Title: Did President Trump Experience Diarrhea on a Golf Course?
Byline: A widely circulated photograph was a stain on the presidential image.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Are Blue Strawberries Real?
Byline: Images that purport to show "blue strawberries" were digitally manipulated.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: You Should Never Put Toilet Paper on a Toilet Seat?
Byline: Viral posts suggesting an increased risks of bathroom-borne pathogens by putting toilet paper on a toilet seat ignore both conventional logic and published scientific research.
Author: Alex Kasprak

Title: Did South Africa's President Purchase the World's Most Expensive Aircraft?
Byline: A series of photographs purportedly showing a luxurious aircraft purchased by South African president Jacob Zuma are pictures of an unrelated airplane.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did This Man Shoot and Kill a Hibernating Bear?
Byline: A photograph showing a man posing with a bear carcass has been shared with an unfounded backstory.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Three Reasons You Should Stop Eating Peanut Butter Cups
Byline: A viral post misrepresents the science behind three additives in the popular peanut butter and chocolate treat.
Author: Alex Kasprak

Title: Is a 'Do Not Cross This Field' Bull Warning Sign Real?
Byline: Although a photograph showing a bull warning sign is frequently shared with a claim that it was digitally altered, the sign is actually real.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Does This Picture Show a Pregnant Melania Trump Posing on a Jet?
Byline: "The Donald's very pregnant wife is trumping the slew of expecting stars who've been photographed before her ..."
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did Democrats Tweet an Altered Version of a Socialist Party Poster?
Byline: A DNC tweet celebrating a Republican setback featured an altered version of a message from the Party for Socialism and Liberation.
Author: Arturo Garcia

Title: Does Roger Stone Have a Tattoo of Richard Nixon on His Back?
Byline: A photograph seemingly shows American political consultant and conspiracy theory spreader Roger Stone with an unusual tattoo on his back.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: European Parental Leave Benefits
Byline: Senator Bernie Sanders' office released an image showing how the U.S. 'lags' behind Canada, Norway, and Germany on the issue of parental leave.
Author: Arturo Garcia

Title: Ohio's Cedar Point Amusement Park Won't Reopen in 2017?
Byline: A Facebook prank spread a rumor holding that the Cedar Point amusement park would not open in 2017 due to safety concerns.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Do the Confederate Battle Flag's Colors Have Religious Significance?
Byline: An image circulated online claims, among other things, that the use of red represents "the blood of Christ."
Author: Arturo Garcia

Title: Is Sean Spicer Wearing Mismatched Shoes?
Byline: A photograph showing the White House press secretary wearing two different types of footwear is real, but the oddity appears to serve a medical purpose rather than an avant-garde fashion choice.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did Mark Zuckerberg Announce His Resignation from Facebook?
Byline: Reports that the social media maven is stepping down were fiction created to sell a skin care product -- or an April Fool's Day joke.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Was This Man Mugged While Delivering Comic Books to His Sick Daughter?
Byline: A photograph of actor Hugh Jackman from a film set was shared online with a joking explanation of what it depicted.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Is it Illegal to Take Photographs of the Eiffel Tower at Night?
Byline: As is often the case, a little bit of factual information is spun into something much more sensational.
Author: Stephanie Larsen

Title: Is This a Giant Insect Called a 'Georgian Speekle'?
Byline: An image of a giant isopod is frequently shared along with the claim that it shows an insect first discovered in a garage in Georgia.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Was Megyn Kelly Fired from NBC?
Byline: The claim that the former Fox News host was fired before even starting at her new post was just another round of completely fake news.
Author: Bethania Palma

Title: Did the New York Times Contradict Their 20 January 2017 Report About Wiretapping?
Byline: An image showing a New York Times front page was circulated on social media along with statements accusing the publication of contradictory reporting about wiretaps.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did Barack Obama Meet with Malcolm X and Martin Luther King, Jr.?
Byline: A photograph showing an adult Barack Obama with Malcolm X and Martin Luther King, Jr. is chronologically impossible.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Does a Photograph Show a Dementor-Like Figure in the Sky?
Byline: An image purportedly shows a gliding, wraith-like dark creature photographed in the skies over Zambia.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Signs Designate Lots Reserved for Future Internment Camps?
Byline: Photographs of an artist's "Future Internment Camp" sign at various sites appeared on social media without context, unnerving some viewers.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Does a Disney Cartoon Feature the Studio's First Gay Kiss?
Byline: A meme urging a boycott of Disney after the studio featured a same-sex kiss in a cartoon does not display the actual moment of animated affection.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Liberal Hero Amy Schumer Goes from Red Carpet to Jail After Threatening Trump on Live TV?
Byline: Comedian Amy Schumer did not threaten President Trump on live television at the Academy Awards ceremony, nor was she arrested at that event.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Did Target's Stock 'Crash' Due to Their Transgender Bathroom Policy?
Byline: The big box retailer gave investors lower-than-expected forecasts due to increasing online sales, news that affected the company's stock price.
Author: Bethania Palma

Title: Is This a Red Blood Cell on the Tip of a Needle?
Byline: A photograph purportedly showing a red blood cell on the tip of a needle is actually a composite of two (or more) images.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did Democrats Refuse to Stand for a Navy SEAL's Widow?
Byline: An unrelated image of Keith Ellison and Debbie Wasserman Schultz was apparently used to claim Democrats refused to honor a Navy SEAL's widow during a presidential speech.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Did 179 Children Go Missing  in Indiana in the First 47 Days of 2017?
Byline: Many Facebook users misinterpreted a post about missing children in Indiana as suggestive of a wave of abductions occurring in that state.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: 'Media Silence' on $12B Reduction to the National Debt During Trump's First Month?
Byline: Although President Trump cited accurate national debt figures in a  tweet, the newsworthiness of that information was questionable.
Author: Alex Kasprak

Title: Finger Chop Challenge
Byline: A gory-sounding protest against President Donald Trump is not a real social media trend.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Did Thousands of Marines Apply for White House Detail After Trump Became President?
Byline: An oddly specific image claimed that 13,506 Marines had applied to work the White House detail in a single week.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did Bill Murray Recommend Eating Children's Ice Cream to Teach About Taxes?
Byline: A quote attributed to the actor shared on social media originated with a parody Twitter account.
Author: Bethania Palma

Title: Andrew Lincoln Death Hoax
Byline: A prank news site tricked social media users into believing "Walking Dead" actor Andrew Lincoln had died.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Did Trump Golf Six Times After Complaining About Obama's Golfing Habits?
Byline: Images assert that President Trump went golfing six times during his first month in office despite frequently criticizing President Obama for golfing while in office.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did Stephen Miller Throw a White Power Sign?
Byline: A photograph showing Stephen Miller with his hands in an odd configuration is real, but is not proof that the White House advisor was using a "white power" hand symbol.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Does a Photograph Show Ivanka Trump with Vladimir Putin and Wendi Murdoch?
Byline: A picture showing First Daughter Ivanka Trump posing with Vladimir Putin and Wendi Murdoch was digitally manipulated.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: 'Violin Island' in Costa Rica?
Byline: An image purportedly showing a 'Violin Island' off Costa Rica is actually a digitally created optical illusion.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Is This Magic Johnson's Celebrity Crew Arriving at NBA Playoffs?
Byline: A photograph showing a star-studded group arriving at the NBA playoffs is a composite of several photographs.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did President Lyndon B. Johnson Applaud the Smothers Brothers for Mocking Him?
Byline: An image shows a kind letter supposedly sent to the Smothers Brothers by LBJ about their repeated mocking of him.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Did Starbucks Place Trump's Photo on the Floor So Every Customer Has to Step on It?
Byline: An image showing a President Trump welcome mat on the floor of a Starbucks was doctored.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did President Nixon Say Watergate Details Were 'Illegally' Leaked by Deep Throat?
Byline: A meme hinting at parallels between President Donald Trump and the Watergate scandal was based on a quote that does not appear to be real.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Reginald VelJohnson Death Hoax
Byline: 'Family Matters' star Reginald VelJohnson is alive and tweeting.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Nordstrom Files for Chapter 11 After Scott Baio Boycott?
Byline: A piece in the Huffington Post that reports that the retail chain is filing for bankruptcy protection is satire.
Author: Bethania Palma

Title: Did Donald Trump Insult Minorities, Students with Disabilities on Twitter?
Byline: A rude tweet attributed to President Trump that appeared to disparage minority students and disabled schoolchildren was fabricated.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Do Facebook 'Copy and Paste, Don't Share' Posts Make Your Account Hackable?
Byline: A popular video claims that sharing "copy and paste" Facebook status updates leaves social media users vulnerable to hacking.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Did Trump Just End Obama's 'Vacation Scam'?
Byline: President Donald Trump supposedly sent former President Barack Obama a bill for all the vacations the latter took before leaving office.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did President Donald Trump Ban 'Full Face' Veils?
Byline: An online clickbait "poll" asked readers if they supported President Trump's non-existent ban on "full face" veils.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Is Burger King Distributing 'Adult Meals' and Toys for Valentine's Day?
Byline: Confusing media coverage led many social media users to believe Burger King was distributing "adult meals" with grown-up "toys."
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Did President Trump Ban 'Sharia Law' in the U.S.?
Byline: Web sites reposted and misinterpreted a television report about one of the president's early campaign promises.
Author: Arturo Garcia

Title: Did Betsy DeVos Demand That Classroom Globes Be Flattened?
Byline: Huffington Post's satire channel confused some readers by appearing to report that newly-confirmed Education Secretary Betsy DeVos has a flat-earth agenda.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Did 'The Simpsons' Predict President Trump's Death?
Byline: An image showing a cartoon Donald Trump in a coffin was purportedly featured on 'The Simpsons' animated TV series.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did Patriots QB Tom Brady Flip Off the NFL Commissioner?
Byline: A photograph of 2017 Super Bowl MVP Tom Brady subtly "flipping the bird" at NFL commissioner Roger Goodell is fake.
Author: Arturo Garcia

Title: National Prayer Breakfast Remarks: President Trump vs. President Obama
Byline: An image comparing remarks made by President Trump and former President Obama at National Prayer Breakfasts used genuine quotes, but the implied claim was misleading.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Are Non-Citizens Being Registered to Vote Without Their Knowledge?
Byline: A popular Facebook post asserted green card holders were being registered to vote without their knowing about it, creating grounds for their deportation.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Are Evolution Fresh Drinks 'Poison'?
Byline: A hoax shared on Facebook claimed that Evolution Fresh brand cold-pressed juices and smoothies were 'poison.'
Author: Bethania Palma

Title: Is 'The Rock' Running for President?
Byline: A pop culture web site posted a fake announcement by the film and WWE star, touted as 'the only way' to escape the current political situation.
Author: Arturo Garcia

Title: Was a Large Disc-Shaped UFO Spotted in Malaysia?
Byline: Video of a supposed UFO sighting in Malaysia in 2016 was actually taken from a CGI creation posted to YouTube in 2007.
Author: Bethania Palma

Title: Did Neil Gorsuch Push for the 'Separation of the White and Black Races'?
Byline: A Twitter account falsely attributed an ex-Ku Klux Klan leader's remarks to the Supreme Court nominee.
Author: Arturo Garcia

Title: Did Mitch McConnell Say One of His Proudest Moments Was Telling Obama 'You Will Not Fill This Supreme Court Vacancy'?
Byline: A meme contrasted disparate statements by GOP Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell on the Senate's duty to confirm Supreme Court nominees.
Author: David Emery

Title: Does a Photograph Depict a 5-Year-Old Syrian Girl Handcuffed at Dulles Airport?
Byline: What's true and what's false about a widely shared and infrequently explained image taken of foreign visitors at Dulles Airport.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Did President Trump Replace Washington Portrait with Vigo the Carpathian?
Byline: Reports that the president was swapping out portraits on the White House walls with images of "Ghostbusters II" characters come from a relatively obscure purveyor of satire and hoax news.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Was a Small Child Handcuffed at Dulles Airport Due to Entry Restrictions?
Byline: A photograph from a separate viral outrage was recaptioned with the claim that it shows a small child in handcuffs at Dulles Airport in January 2017.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Is Facebook Forwarding Standing Rock Protester Profiles to DHS, FBI?
Byline: According to rumors, a Facebook popup window is warning Standing Rock protesters that their account histories are being intercepted by the federal government.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Did History Professor Heather Richardson Posit the Immigration Ban Was a 'Shock Event'?
Byline: A viral Facebook post holding that President Trump's controversial immigration ban was a "shock event" was an editorial item by a Boston College history professor.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Starbucks #WelcomeRefugees Promotion
Byline: An image showing a promotion at Starbucks that exhorts customers to provide the name "Aloha Snackbar" is not genuine.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Melania Trump's Grandmother was a Soviet Soldier?
Byline: A photograph purportedly showing Melania Trump's grandmother is actually actress Janet Leigh in the 1957 movie "Jet Pilot".
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did President Trump Criticize Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau's Social Media Use?
Byline: Reports of an international dispute over social media usage among world leaders are complete fabrications.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Did Sean Spicer Retweet a Satirical Onion Video About Himself?
Byline: White House Press Secretary Sean Spicer retweeted The Onion's satirical video about him, leaving some social media users confused.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Mike Pence Said Calls to Ban Muslims Are 'Offensive and Unconstitutional'?
Byline: In a December 2015 tweet, then-Indiana Governor Mike Pence rejected presidential candidate Donald Trump's call to ban Muslims from entering the United States.
Author: David Emery

Title: Trump Photoshopped His Hands to Look Bigger in White House Photograph?
Byline: Despite some convincing photographs on the internet, Donald Trump did not doctor a White House photograph to make his hands look bigger.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did Trump Hang a Photograph of the Women's March at the White House?
Byline: A photograph of Donald Trump's inauguration featuring the wrong date was hung at the White House, but the image did not show the Women's March on Washington
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Women Carry Anti-Baby Signs at the Women's March on Washington?
Byline: The photographs have been on the Internet since before the 21 January 2017 march.
Author: Bethania Palma

Title: Did Rachel Maddow Tweet That Donald Trump Needs to be 'Taken Out?'
Byline: An image purportedly showing a threatening tweet from MSNBC commentator Rachel Maddow is fake.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did Kellyanne Conway's Inaugural Dress Copy a 1970s Simplicity Pattern?
Byline: An image suggesting Trump counselor Kellyanne Conway's inaugural ensemble resembled a 1970's 'Simplicity' pattern was doctored.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Did President Trump Insult Navajos on Twitter?
Byline: President Trump neither made nor deleted disparaging remarks about Navajo native Americans via Twitter.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Was a Saturday Night Live Writer Suspended Over a Tweet About Barron Trump?
Byline: SNL Weekend Update writer Katie Rich has been disciplined for tweeting what critics called a distasteful joke about the president's 10-year-old child.
Author: Bethania Palma

Title: Did Mike Pence Say Trump Supporters Made Up 'More Than Half' of Womens' March?
Byline: A fake Facebook account overstated the amount of conservatives who attended demonstrations worldwide on 21 January 2017.
Author: Arturo Garcia

Title: Did Trump Tweet That Drug Testing Will Be Mandatory for Public Benefit Recipients?
Byline: A fake tweet attributed to President Trump suggested mandatory drug testing would be imposed on recipients of public assistance.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: 'Slutwalk' Image Repurposed as Women's March Photograph
Byline: An image from Chicago's 2013 'Slutwalk' was circulated with false claims that it was taken at a 2017 Women's March event.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Did Dr. Phil's 'Cash Me Outside' Girl Commit Suicide?
Byline: A fake news site leveraged the "Cash Me Outside" meme to fabricate a story about a young teen's suicide.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Did Barack Obama Put His Hand on Melania Trump's Backside?
Byline: A photograph purportedly showing the former president touching First Lady Melania Trump's buttocks is fake.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: National Park Service Twitter Account Shut Down After Anti-Trump Retweets
Byline: The Department of Interior took action after a tweet was shared via the National Park Service account unfavorably comparing the attendance at Trump's inauguration with that at Obama's.
Author: David Emery

Title: Did Trump Remove a MLK Bust from the Oval Office?
Byline: A Time magazine reporter erroneously tweeted that a bust of civil rights icon Martin Luther King, Jr. was removed from display in the Oval Office by Donald Trump.
Author: David Emery

Title: Does a Photograph Show Joe Biden Putting a Gun in a Woman's Mouth?
Byline: An old photograph of Joe Biden chatting with a woman at a town hall meeting was digitally manipulated to look sinister.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Highway Sign Urged Drivers to 'Consider Canada' Due to Inauguration Traffic?
Byline: A photograph purportedly showing a Maryland highway sign exhorting motorists to avoid Inauguration Day traffic and "Consider Canada" was fabricated.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Do These Twitter Images Depict Trump Inauguration Crowds?
Byline: Early on Inauguration Day 2017, some older unrelated images of crowds were passed off as depictions of the Trump inauguration.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Does This Photograph Show Donald Trump at a KKK Cross Burning?
Byline: Yet another of the multiple images posted online surrounding the 2016 election in an attempt to portray a connection between Donald Trump and the KKK.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did Two Men Cut off a Dog's Ears?
Byline: A photograph showing two men standing next to a dog whose ears they had apparently cut off went viral in January 2017.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did Donald Trump Use a Receptionist's Desk and Notepad to Stage a Speechwriting Picture?
Byline: No, Donald Trump didn't visit an auction house to stage an inaugural speechwriting photograph at a receptionist's desk.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Homeless Woman Holds Frozen Baby on Bench
Byline: A homeless woman was found holding a dead baby at a Portland, Oregon bus stop, but this photograph does not show them.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did Hampton United Methodist Church Mock Trump on its Sign?
Byline: A photograph that purportedly shows a church sign bearing a joke calling Donald Trump a "pervert" and a "fascist" is a fake.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Is Paul Ryan Blocking All Calls and Faxes?
Byline: According to social media rumors, House Speaker Paul Ryan is not allowing any calls or faxes to reach his offices.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Large Motorcycle Group Heading to Trump Inauguration?
Byline: A photograph showing a large group of motorcyclists riding on a highway is not related to Donald Trump's inauguration.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Does This Photograph Show a Palestinian Boy Shot by Israeli Soldiers?
Byline: A gripping photograph purportedly shows a Palestinian boy after he was shot in the heart by an Israeli soldier.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Does a Picture Depict Groomsmen Supporting a Paralyzed Man at His Wedding?
Byline: After attaining Instagram popularity, a wedding photograph developed a fabricated backstory about a paralyzed groom and his loyal groomsmen.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Did Twitter Delete Donald Trump's Account over 'Racism'?
Byline: Twitter hasn't announced they are deleting the account of President-elect Donald Trump over allegations of 'racist rhetoric' (or for any other reason).
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Did Meryl Streep Mock a Disabled Person on a Late Night Talk Show?
Byline: An animated image purportedly showing Meryl Streep mocking a disabled person during an appearance on a late night talk show is not what it seems.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Can TV Viewers Protest Donald Trump's Inauguration by Changing the Channel?
Byline: A Facebook message urges viewers not to watch Donald Trump's inauguration, but that form of protest likely won't affect the event's ratings.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Meryl Streep Fired from Major Project for Lying About Trump?
Byline: A fake news article posted on several unreliable web sites claimed actress Meryl Streep was fired from a major television project for lying about Donald Trump.
Author: David Emery

Title: Celebrity Death Hoax: Sherri Shepherd
Byline: A fake news web site falsely claimed that actress-comedian Sherri Shepherd passed away of a heart attack at age 49.
Author: David Emery

Title: Did Hillary Clinton Trash Michelle Obama in a Leaked E-Mail?
Byline: An online image falsely claimed Hillary Clinton insulted the First Lady in an e-mail message purportedly published by WikiLeaks.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Did Twitter and Facebook Ban a Norwegian Cartoon About Trump?
Byline: Rumors that a political cartoon featuring Donald Trump was banned from social media sites were likely started in an attempt to spread the image to a wider audience.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did CNN Alter Esteban Santiago's Photograph?
Byline: A disreputable web site accused the network of lightening the skin of the suspected shooter in a photograph.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Does Donald Trump Have Klinefelter Syndrome?
Byline: Based on a 'YXX' notation on his Selective Service record, the Internet has theorized that Donald Trump suffers from Klinefelter Syndrome — a genetic condition in which a male is born with an extra X chromosome.
Author: David Emery

Title: Canada Gives Polygamist Immigrants Thousands in 'Start-Up Money'?
Byline: An anti-immigrant image makes a host of false accusations about benefits available to Muslim refugees in Canada.
Author: Arturo Garcia

Title: Bob Denver Dead (Again)
Byline: The Gilligan's Island actor passed away in 2005, but a widely shared image macro claims that he died in January 2017.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Jesse Owens and Hitler Shook Hands at the 1936 Summer Olympics?
Byline: An image purportedly showing Olympic track and field champion Jesse Owens shaking hands with Adolf Hitler is a hoax.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did DeRay Mckesson Tweet and Delete Disregard for 'Facebook Live' Incident in Chicago?
Byline: A less than credible Twitter account spread a fake tweet attributed to  civil rights activist DeRay Mckesson, suggesting he said he had "no problem" with a violent act in Chicago.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Did 'Express' Use the Male Gender Symbol for a Women's Rights Cover?
Byline: The Washington Post's free daily newspaper mistakenly used a male gender symbol to illustrate a cover story about women's rights.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Are Facebook Users Secretly Following You?
Byline: Instructions for blocking Facebook users who are supposedly furtively following you are spurious.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Did Joel Osteen Offer to Reveal God's Plan in Exchange for $5,000?
Byline: A fake tweet attributed to the televangelist says anyone who gives his ministry $5,000 will receive a personal message from on high.
Author: Bethania Palma

Title: Did Donald Trump Tweet and Delete New Year's Eve Regrets Over Winning?
Byline: An image of a supposed deleted tweet from Donald Trump expressed feelings of regret and inadequacy over winning the presidency.
Author: Snopes Staff

Title: Was a Vermont Power Grid Infiltrated by Russian Hackers?
Byline: The Washington Post was heavily criticized for jumping the gun and suggesting a Vermont power company had been targeted for disruption by Russian hackers.
Author: Snopes Staff

Title: President Obama Pardoned Rapper C-Murder?
Byline: An article from "Gummy Post" incorrectly stated that convicted rapper C-Murder was pardoned by President Obama on 7 December 2016.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Are Oprah Winfrey and Tyler Perry Holding Giveaways?
Byline: Despite the insistence of numerous scams on social media, Oprah Winfrey and Tyler Perry are not giving away cars, houses, money, or anything else on Facebook.
Author: Snopes Staff

Title: Is This a Trump Tower Billboard in Mumbai?
Byline: A photograph purportedly shows a billboard for Trump Tower in Mumbai with homeless people sleeping in the street beneath it.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Warning Issued by Thailand About HIV in Canned Food?
Byline: Age-old rumors about viral contamination of food evolved into a claim that HIV is present in canned food from Thailand.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Photograph Shows Young Carrie Fisher Watching Debbie Reynolds Perform
Byline: The image was shared widely on social media after the mother and daughter died within one day of each other.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did Carrie Fisher Do Her Own Rewrites for 'The Empire Strikes Back'?
Byline: An image circulating online falsely attributed some dialogue changes to the Hollywood icon.
Author: Arturo Garcia

Title: Did Obama Sign a Bill Making Alternative Media Illegal?
Byline: Numerous small web outlets inaccurately asserted that President Obama signed a "Christmas bill" criminalizing alternative media in December 2016.
Author: Snopes Staff

Title: Is Amazon Gathering Donations for Goodwill?
Byline: The online retailer is one of several businesses encouraging buyers to use their boxes for charitable donations.
Author: Arturo Garcia

Title: Trump Threatened Military Action Against Mexico?
Byline: An image purportedly showing a tweet in which Donald Trump threatened military action against Mexico is a hoax.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did CNN Use the Same Girl in Three Different Refugee Crisis Pictures?
Byline: A variation on the 'crisis actor' conspiracy theory holds that CNN used photographs of the same girl to represent three different refugee crises.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Joan Miro Painting Sold for $37 Million
Byline: An image of a "child-like" Joan Miro painting was circulated on Facebook along with the claim that it was worth $37 million.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Man Found Decapitated and Castrated Behind Walmart Store
Byline: Albuquerque police said a 42-year-old man was found mutilated on a parking lot median, but not on Walmart's property.
Author: Bethania Palma

Title: Nickelback to Play at Inauguration
Byline: A message allegedly sent by Donald Trump on Twitter stating that Nickelback would play at his inauguration was fake.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Snowfall in the Sahara
Byline: Pictures posted by an Algerian photographer showing snow in the hills above the Sahara desert are real.
Author: Alex Kasprak

Title: Prayers for Dakota
Byline: A viral message requesting prayers for a young boy named Dakota is several months old and has frequently been shared without any context.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Obama-Led U.N. Has Just Made It Official, U.S. to Immediately Pay Blacks 'Reparations'
Byline: Untrustworthy web sites reported that at President Obama's behest, the United Nations ordered the U.S. to pay reparations to African Americans for slavery.
Author: David Emery

Title: Trump's Budget Director Pick Asked “Do We Really Need Government-Funded Research at All?”
Byline: Though it has since been deleted, Mick Mulvaney did pose this question in a Facebook post in response to a scientific study casting doubts on the role of the Zika virus in causing infant microcephaly.
Author: Alex Kasprak

Title: Did Donald Trump Threaten to Arrest Alec Baldwin?
Byline: A tweet in which the U.S. President threatened to arrest the actor who has famously portrayed him on 'Saturday Night Live' is a fake.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: 'Rudy Giuliani' Banned From Twitter for Pizzagate Tweets
Byline: The @RudolphGiuliani Twitter account (not affiliated with the former New York City mayor) was suspended after sending messages about the #Pizzagate conspiracy theory.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Russian Flag at Texas State Capitol
Byline: A photograph showing a Russian flag on display at the Texas State Capitol has been shared widely without proper context.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Bandits Posing as Gas Company Workers
Byline: Some social media users may have been too young to get a somewhat obvious joke about "bandits" attempting home entries by posing as gas company workers.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: White Supremacist Web Site Calls for Online Attacks Against Jews in Whitefish, Montana
Byline: A call to action by the anti-Semitic 'The Daily Stormer' revealed the names and personal contact information of Jewish people they claimed had 'harassed and extorted' the parents of white supremacist Richard Spencer.
Author: David Emery

Title: Trump Sends 'Unpresidented' Tweet
Byline: An 'unpresidented' spelling error in a tweet sent by President-elect Donald Trump on 17 December 2016 quickly went viral.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Is a Photograph of a Salvation Army Bellringer's Sign About 'the Gays' Real?
Byline: A photograph of an unknown individual protesting near a Salvation Army sign was miscaptioned as an image of an actual volunteer.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Do Women Need More Sleep Than Men Because Their Brains Work Harder?
Byline: This zombie of a viral news story does not accurately reflect either science or the views of the scientist the authors allegedly quote.
Author: Alex Kasprak

Title: Plane Crash Video 'Disappearing From the Internet'?
Byline: A 2013 video shows a cargo plane crashing in Afghanistan.
Author: Bethania Palma

Title: The Tragic Life of Keanu Reeves
Byline: You'll need a hanky to make it all the way through this sad viral video recounting the tragic life story of "Matrix" actor Keanu Reeves.
Author: David Emery

Title: Did McDonald's 2016 Holiday Cups Include a Risqué Image?
Byline: A McDonald's holiday cup featuring a picture of two mittens was altered to make a risqué image that did not appear on the original packaging.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Is This Santa's Phone Number?
Byline: A Facebook page advertising a phone number to supposedly allow children to talk to "Santa Claus" actually leads unsuspecting callers somewhere unexpected.
Author: Arturo Garcia

Title: Secret Pancakes On $5 Bill
Byline: An image that purports to show a stack of pancakes revealed by a properly folded bill is a hoax.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Buzz Aldrin Tweeted 'We are all in Danger, it is Evil Itself'?
Byline: A conspiracy site claimed that the astronaut tweeted — then deleted — a dire warning that humanity was in "danger" from "evil itself" in Antarctica.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Is This a Real Boston Bruins Fan Sign?
Byline: A photograph purportedly shows two female fans holding up a risqué  sign at a hockey game.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Was an Alien Caught on the Kerala, Karnataka Border?
Byline: A video of a sick sun bear (Helarctos malayanus) was shared on social media along with the claim that it showed an alien caught in southern India.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did the Southern Baptist Convention Buy Chick fil-A?
Byline: A story claiming that the Southern Baptist Convention purchased the fast food chain was posted by a satire site.
Author: Bethania Palma

Title: 'Cheapskate' Brags About Pressuring Waiter for $5 Tip
Byline: A meme promoting an alleged "experiment" was strikingly similar to a scene from some NBC sitcoms.
Author: Arturo Garcia

Title: Did a 'Star Wars' Film Include an Anti-Trump Scene?
Byline: Writers for the film "Star Wars: Rogue One" posted tweets about Donald Trump, but claims that the movie was altered to add an anti-Trump scene were unfounded.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Topiary Cats
Byline: Images of "real" topiary cat sculptures are actually digital artworks created by Richard Saunders.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Bacon Sandwich Reported as Offensive on Facebook
Byline: A social media post claimed that a bacon sandwich image was deemed "offensive" by Facebook in an attempt to farm engagement.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Harry & David Says Company is 'Neutral' on Racism, Neo-Nazis?
Byline: Social media users claimed that representatives told them it the company has no opinion about racism, but the company says otherwise.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Fisher Price Happy Hour Playset
Byline: Despite social media outrage, the "Fisher Price Happy Hour Playset" is not real.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Morton County Sheriff Kyle Kirchmeier's Twitter Account
Byline: A parody Twitter account attributed to Morton County Sheriff Kyle Kirchmeier contained a number of satirical (and outrageous) tweets about the Dakota Access pipeline protests.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Man Punches Kangaroo to Save Dog
Byline: A viral video showing a man hitting the marsupial has sparked calls for him to be fired from his position as a zookeeper.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Is This an Image of 'Child Organ Trafficking Victims' in Thailand?
Byline: Images of the Ghouta chemical attack of 2013 were repurposed alongside a tale of child organ trafficking in Thailand.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Your Christmas Tree Is (Probably) Not Full of Lyme Disease Bearing Ticks
Byline: Viral warnings about disease-carrying ticks in Christmas trees ignore much of the scientific literature on how ticks and Lyme disease actually operate.
Author: Alex Kasprak

Title: Did the Obama White House Ban Nativity Scenes?
Byline: According to social media chatter, the "War on Christmas" extended all the way to the White House.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Father Mourns Wife, Children Killed in Car Crash?
Byline: A genuine image of three murder victims has been reappropriated for a "type amen" scam.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Is This National Geographic's 'Photograph of the Year'?
Byline: An image of a shark leaping out of the water was digitally manipulated and did not win an award from National Geographic.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Emboldened by Election, Texas Republicans Kill Medicaid Funding for Children with Disabilities?
Byline: A viral article inaccurately reported that Medicaid spending cuts in Texas affecting disabled children were thanks to "emboldened" state Republicans.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Are Feds Tracking Support for an Audit of Donald Trump?
Byline: According to social media claims, Sen. Elizabeth Warren made the request from a non-partisan government agency.
Author: Arturo Garcia

Title: Melania Trump, Ivanka Trump Wearing Transparent Shirts
Byline: Photographs purporting to show the wife and daughter of President-elect Donald Trump wearing shirts exposing their breasts have been digitally altered.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did Senate Dems Vote En Masse to Cut Veterans' Pensions?
Byline: A conservative meme omits Republican support for a $6 billion cut that affected some military retirees.
Author: Arturo Garcia

Title: Christian-Owned Airlines Change Wing Light Colors to Celebrate Christmas?
Byline: A meme about "Christian-owned airlines" changing wing lights to red and green is just a spoof.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Tim Kaine Blamed 'Gun Violence' for Ohio State Knife Attack?
Byline: Sen. Tim Kaine's initial tweet about the Ohio State University attack was based on erroneous early news reports that the attacker had used a gun; he tweeted a correction after seeing updated stories.
Author: David Emery

Title: Can the 25th Amendment Prevent a Trump Presidency?
Byline: A viral video promoted the idea that Congress could declare him unfit for office.
Author: Arturo Garcia

Title: Hillary Clinton Sponsored a Bill to Punish Flag Burning?
Byline: Yet another controversial tweet from Donald Trump prompted claims that Hillary Clinton once favored punishment for the act.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Lord of the Rings Donut
Byline: An image purportedly showing a donut with "Muslim writing" on it actually depicts a pastry with Orkish writing in frosting.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Colorado Birth Control Facts
Byline: A meme about Colorado's "free birth control" program is mostly accurate, but lacks some important context.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Is Michigan About to Sell 100 Million Gallons of Groundwater to Nestlé for $200?
Byline: A viral petition about the proposed sale of groundwater to Nestlé in Michigan lacked some context.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Millions of Muslims March Against the Islamic State?
Byline: Reports that millions of Muslims protested against ISIS and that the news media ignored the event are misleading.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Jill Stein Caught Embezzling Recount Funds for Marijuana Dinner Party
Byline: An old photograph of Jill Stein was used to claim that the Green Party presidential candidate had been arrested for using "recount funds" to host a "marijuana dinner party."
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Trump Promises to Pardon Dylann Roof
Byline: An image purporting to show a tweet sent by Donald Trump, in which he promised to pardon accused mass shooter Dylann Roof, was a hoax.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Backless Booster Seats Banned in United States?
Byline: A social media meme shared outdated information about the use of backless booster seats (also known as booster cushions).
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Beef Tallow In New £5 Notes?
Byline: According to rumors on social media, trace amounts of tallow are present in the UK's new polymer bank notes — making them unsuitable for vegans.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Did Germany 'Fold' to Sharia Law and Allow Child Marriages?
Byline: There is no proof an image showing a white-clad little girl is a "child bride," or that Germany is allowing children to marry in accordance with supposed Sharia law.
Author: Bethania Palma

Title: Ben Carson Thinks the Earth Would Have Exploded During Big Bang
Byline: While Carson does not buy into the theory of the Big Bang origin of our cosmos, a viral meme misrepresents Carson’s view on the topic.
Author: Alex Kasprak

Title: Did the Corona Founder Make Every Person in His Village a Millionaire?
Byline: An erroneous report about the death of Antonino Fernandez was shared by several media outlets.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Meet Betsy DeVos, Trump's Secretary of Education Nominee
Byline: The nomination of Betsy DeVos as secretary of education inspired an Internet meme detailing her alleged lack of qualifications for the job.
Author: David Emery

Title: Did CNN Air Half an Hour of Pornographic Content?
Byline: Reports that the news network accidentally aired thirty minutes of porn originated with a single image from an unverified Twitter user.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: 'Student Loan Forgiveness' Scam
Byline: We called "EDU Loan Servicing" after it was featured on a "consumer watchdog" page; it appears to be one of many scams.
Author: Arturo Garcia

Title: 'Hamilton' Actor Brandon Victor Dixon Tweets About St. Patrick's Day
Byline: After Mike Pence was drawn into a controversy related to the musical 'Hamilton,' social media users found and shared an old tweet from actor Brandon Victor Dixon.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Kid Rock Wears 'Dumbf*ckistan' T-Shirt
Byline: We are obliged to report that the photo of Kid Rock wearing a profanity-laced electoral map T-shirt is fake, though apparel resembling this does exist.
Author: David Emery

Title: Russian Billboard Features Trump and Putin
Byline: A photograph shows Donald Trump and Vladimir Putin on a billboard above the words "Let's make the world great again — together."
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Mexican Supermarket Taking 'Donations' for Trump Border Wall
Byline: A faked photograph led to accusations that Soriana markets were making customers foot the bill for one of Donald Trump's campaign promises.
Author: Arturo Garcia

Title: New York Police Take Rutgers Professor for Psychological Evaluation Over Political Tweet?
Byline: Kevin Allred, who teaches women's and gender studies at Rutgers, said his First Amendment rights were violated when police detained him for a rhetorical tweet about shooting white people.
Author: Bethania Palma

Title: Is Monsanto Suppressing Evidence of a Cancerous Herbicide in Food?
Byline: A laboratory test performed by food activists went viral, but its results and the allegations drawn from them were not reliable.
Author: Alex Kasprak

Title: Lady Gaga Arrested for Twitter Attack on Melania Trump
Byline: A report that Lady Gaga was arrested for tweeting a negative comment about Melania Trump is a hoax.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Is This Really Bill Clinton in the Nude?
Byline: An image purporting to show Bill Clinton sitting naked on a bed while a woman rubs his back doesn't actually feature the former president.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Military Absentee Ballots Delivered One Day Late Would Have Swung Election for Clinton
Byline: Social media users were confused by a satirical site's claim that delayed military absentee ballots would have swung the election to Hillary Clinton.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Did a Woman Set Her Husband on Fire for Raping Her 7-Year-Old Daughter?
Byline: A genuine news story from 2014 is often shared along with a series of unrelated images.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: BLM 'Thug' Shoots Himself Taking Selfie with Gun in Protest of Trump
Byline: The picture of a man holding a gun to his face while taking a selfie has been around much longer than Donald Trump's election to the presidency.
Author: Bethania Palma

Title: Anti-Trump Protesters Bused Into Austin, Chicago
Byline: Photographs showing long lines of buses were shared with the untrue claim that they were used to ship paid anti-Trump protesters to various cities.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Anti-Trump Protesters Destroy America
Byline: A photograph purportedly showing a violent anti-Trump protest in the U.S. was actually taken in Greece in 2012.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Republicans Last Controlled U.S. Government in 1928 and Depression Followed?
Byline: Popular post-election image holds that Republicans last controlled the White House and Congress in 1928, causing the Great Depression.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Muslim Woman Told to 'Hang Herself' with Hijab at Walmart
Byline: A woman's uncorroborated Facebook post describing the alleged incident was shared thousands of times.
Author: Arturo Garcia

Title: Donald Trump Described the Electoral College as a 'Disaster' in 2012
Byline: In 2012,  Donald Trump tweeted that the electoral college system was a 'disaster for a democracy.'
Author: Bethania Palma

Title: Obamaphones to Be Cut Off
Byline: Viral election night jokes about "Obama phones" immediately getting "cut off" confused social media users in the wake of the 2016 presidential election outcome.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: 'We Hate Muslims, We Hate Blacks' Chanted at Trump Rally
Byline: Unsubstantiated post-election rumor claimed that supporters chanted "We hate Muslims, we hate Blacks, we want our great country back" during a Trump victory rally.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Klan Marches in North Carolina to Celebrate Trump Victory
Byline: A misleading picture circulating on social media claims to depict the KKK marching on a bridge to celebrate Trump's victory, but those depicted never claimed to be the Klan.
Author: Bethania Palma

Title: Baltimore Prosecutor Deletes Election Day Ballot Picture
Byline: Baltimore State's Attorney Marilyn Mosby tweeted, and then deleted, a picture indicating she was voting for Hillary Clinton.
Author: Arturo Garcia

Title: Jay Z Rapped the Words 'Middle Finger to the Lord' at Hillary Clinton Rally
Byline: An election eve social media rumor held that guest artist Jay Z rapped the words "Middle finger to the Lord, n***a grip, I'm a boss" at a Hillary Clinton rally.
Author: David Emery

Title: Eric Trump Tweets (Illegal) Ballot Selfie
Byline: Donald Trump's son, Eric, posted -- and then deleted -- a possibly illegal photograph of his ballot on Twitter.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Don't Selfie Your Ballot?
Byline: Is taking a photograph of your ballot and posting it online illegal? It depends on where you live and how you do it.
Author: David Mikkelson

Title: 'Madam President' Hillary Clinton Newsweek Cover
Byline: An image showing Hillary Clinton on the cover of a Newsweek publication under the title "Madam President" is real but is not proof that the news outlet colluded with the Clinton campaign prior to the 2016 presidential election.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Hillary Caught on Hot Mic Trashing Beyoncé with Racial Slurs
Byline: A viral article purporting to quote Hillary Clinton describing Beyonce's music using racial slurs is a work of fiction.
Author: David Emery

Title: NBC Accidentally Posts Election Results a Week Early
Byline: In what is becoming a common pre-election conspiracy-driving glitch, an NBC affiliate's software test was interpreted as evidence election results were rigged.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: 'Facebook Analytics' Electoral Map Shows Trump Sweep
Byline: An image purportedly showing an electoral map based on "Facebook analytics" is not supported by data.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Clinton: Russians Hacked My Crowd!
Byline: An image purporting to show Hillary Clinton addressing a sparsely attended campaign rally actually doesn't picture Clinton at all.
Author: David Emery

Title: The Chicago Cubs and the Significance of '108'
Byline: A list of facts connected to the number 108 went viral shortly after the Chicago Cubs won their first World Series in 108 years.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did a Study Confirm Humans Can Literally Feed Off Each Other's Energy?
Byline: Viral claims about humans’ ability to sense and feed off of one another’s emotional energy are the result of a comically tortured reading of a groundbreaking study about algae.
Author: Alex Kasprak

Title: Clinton Cancels Rally Due to 'Lock Her Up' Chants
Byline: A Facebook post claiming that Hillary Clinton had cancelled a campaign event due to chants of "lock her up" was shared as genuine news.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: New York Police Raid Hillary Clinton's Property
Byline: Clickbait web sites posted misleading headlines claiming Hillary Clinton's property had been raided by the NYPD.
Author: Bethania Palma

Title: Michelle Obama Scrubbed Hillary Clinton from Her Twitter Accounts
Byline: A disreputable web site falsely accused First Lady Michelle Obama of "scrubbing" her Twitter accounts of all mentions of Hillary Clinton.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: 'Donald Trump Arrested' Virus Warning
Byline: A warning about a computer virus being spread via social media with pictures of Donald Trump being arrested appears to be a hoax.
Author: David Mikkelson

Title: Is Clinton Paying Halfway House Residents $300 Per Vote?
Byline: Conservatives pointed to a brief online video as "proof" that Clinton was paying California residents to vote for her.
Author: Arturo Garcia

Title: Manipulated Photograph of Bill Clinton Crowd
Byline: A photograph showing the size of a crowd during Bill Clinton's appearance at Cleveland State University was manipulated, but it didn't originate with the Clinton campaign.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: North Carolina Hillary Supporter Votes Multiple Times
Byline: Claims of voter fraud in North Carolina turned out to be merely a Facebook joke.
Author: David Mikkelson

Title: 'Spooked' Clinton Campaign Manager Deleted Tweets
Byline: A disreputable web site spread a baseless rumor holding that Hillary Clinton's campaign manager Robby Mook deleted all of of his tweets because he was "spooked" by an FBI investigation.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Hillary Clinton and #DraftOurDaughters
Byline: Fabricated tweets suggested Hillary Clinton praised wars, using the hashtag #DraftOurDaughters.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Dad Posted Picture of Baby Holding Gun on Facebook Just Before She Shot Herself?
Byline: An image floating around the Internet purportedly depicting the moments before a baby killed herself (followed by a photograph of a funeral) is a hoax.
Author: Bethania Palma

Title: Hillary Clinton Went Topless in the 1960s?
Byline: A photograph purportedly showing Hillary Clinton and her college roommate is actually of two unidentified women in San Francisco.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Bill Murray or Tom Hanks?
Byline: A photograph of actor Bill Murray and a crying child has sparked an internet debate over whether or not it actually shows actor Tom Hanks.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Fake Anti-Marijuana Picture Rips Off 'Walking Dead' Producer
Byline: A picture circulating online uses a picture of actor Steven Yeun while advising, "Say no to drugs, people."
Author: Arturo Garcia

Title: Did Doctors Warn Never Clean Your Child with Baby Wipes?
Byline: A viral blog post warning about the dangers of baby wipes contained several inaccurate — and potentially dangerous — pieces of misinformation.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Risqué Anderson Cooper Photograph
Byline: An image purporting to show Anderson Cooper posing on a bench in a pair of briefs was digitally manipulated.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Great White Sharks Spotted in Mississippi River?
Byline: A photograph purporting to show two great white sharks swimming in the Mississippi River depicts bull sharks, not great whites, and was taken in Costa Rica.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Kremlin in Turmoil After Clinton Foundation CEO Requests 'Urgent and Immediate' Asylum
Byline: Claims former Clinton Foundation CEO Eric Braverman sought asylum in Russia originated with a fake news conspiracy site, he is not "missing."
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Is 'Trump' Tattooed on This Man's Forehead?
Byline: A photograph of a man with the word "Trump" tattooed on his forehead was hard to believe.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Supreme Court Confirms 20-Year Prison Sentence for Ex-VP Dick Cheney?
Byline: The Huffington Post published a satirical item set in the future about Dick Cheney's being sentenced to 20 years in prison for war crimes, confusing some readers.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Bill O'Reilly Telephone Poll of 25,000 Voters Shows Trump with a Huge Lead?
Byline: A tweet about an online survey on the Fox News host's website misrepresented the nature of that poll.
Author: Arturo Garcia

Title: Statue of Liberty Made from Aleppo Rubble
Byline: A photograph purportedly showing a recreation of the Statue of Liberty made from the rubble of war-torn Aleppo is a digital creation.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Reporter Displays Trump/Pence Sticker at Al Smith Dinner
Byline: An image of reporter Maria Bartiromo holding a phone decorated with a "Trump/Pence" sticker at the Alfred E. Smith Memorial Foundation Dinner is fake.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Seal with Unusual Stripe-Pattern Markings Spotted in Washington
Byline: A photograph of a ribbon seal spotted in Washington state was snapped by the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Association in August 2016.
Author: Bethania Palma

Title: Oregon Ballot Omits Donald Trump
Byline: An image of an Oregon ballot listing Democratic presidential candidates twice but no Republican candidates is a hoax.
Author: Snopes Staff

Title: Do Women's Brains Shrink During Pregnancy?
Byline: Online images tout the sparsely researched claim that a woman’s brain shrinks during pregnancy, but the science behind it is more complicated.
Author: Alex Kasprak

Title: Did Billy Graham Issue a Stunning Statement on Donald Trump?
Byline: A viral rumor misattributed commentary about choosing between Hillary Clinton and Donald Trump from Franklin Graham to his father, Billy Graham.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Mark Zuckerberg Promises $1,000 to Facebook Users If They Don't Share Hoaxes
Byline: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg's offering money to Facebook users who don't share social media hoaxes is itself a parody of social media  hoaxes.
Author: Bethania Palma

Title: Bernie Sanders Suggests Election Is Rigged, Unendorses Hillary Clinton
Byline: A post on Bernie Sanders' Facebook page did not suggest he believes the presidential election is "rigged" or indicate he was "unendorsing" Hillary Clinton.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Postal Worker Caught Destroying Absentee Trump Ballots in Major Swing State
Byline: A Twitter user claimed to be a postal worker who regularly destroys mailed-in Trump votes in Ohio, but the issue appeared to be a joke taken taken too seriously.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Can You Vote Online with a Hashtag?
Byline: Social media users claimed Trump supporters attempted to suppress the vote in Pennsylvania by falsely telling Clinton supporters they could vote online via a hashtag.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Did Scientists Recreate a Tyrannosaurus Rex Embryo from Chicken DNA?
Byline: The purported cloning of dinosaurs has been a popular online topic in recent years.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: WikiLeaks Releases Candid Photos of Hillary Clinton Grabbing a Man's Crotch
Byline: A photograph purportedly capturing Hillary Clinton grabbing a man's crotch  actually shows actress Florence Henderson.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Hillary Clinton Has Run No Positive Political Ads?
Byline: A Facebook image incorrectly claims that Hillary Clinton has never issued a political ad touting her own accomplishments.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: 'Clown Purge' on Halloween?
Byline: The social media clown panic has inevitably merged with "purge" rumors, just in time for Halloween.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Huge Crowd at Trump Rally in Panama City, Florida
Byline: A conservative web site used a  photograph from a 2013 jazz festival claiming it pictured the audience at a recent Donald Trump rally.
Author: Bethania Palma

Title: Melania Trump Copied Statement from Hillary Clinton
Byline: A Facebook image falsely suggested that Melania Trump had copied her statement regarding her husband's offensive statements about women from Hillary Clinton.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did an Alabama Man Create a 'Real-Life Human Centipede'?
Byline: In keeping with the fake news trend of regional newspaper impostors, once such site falsely reported that a fugitive had created a 'real life human centipede.'
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Did a European Scientific Journal Conclude 9/11 Was a Controlled Demolition?
Byline: Viral news stories misattributed an article written by "9/11 Truth" advocates as one published in the European Scientific Journal; it was actually published in Europhysics News, which is not peer-reviewed.
Author: Alex Kasprak

Title: Ben and Jerry's 'Hate Cops'?
Byline: An image showing the founders of Ben & Jerry's Ice Cream holding a "We Hate Cops" sign has been photoshopped.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Is This a Dolphin Caught in Hurricane Winds?
Byline: A photograph purportedly documents a dolphin caught in strong winds from Hurricane Matthew.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Does This Picture Show Daytona International Speedway Flooded?
Byline: If you've seen one hurricane picture online, you've seen them all.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Kanye West Wanted for Jewelry Insurance Scam
Byline: A misleading article claimed that Kanye West was wanted by police in connection to the robbery of his wife Kim Kardashian.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: African Union Issues 'Travel Advisory' for U.S.
Byline: A political cartoon was misreported online as being a real warning for African travelers regarding "continued instability" in the U.S.
Author: Arturo Garcia

Title: Has SpongeBob SquarePants Been Cancelled?
Byline: An inaccurate viral image led to rampant rumors that the popular animated TV show 'SpongeBob SquarePants' had been canceled.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Australia Becomes First Country to Begin Microchipping Its Public?
Byline: A misleading Internet report spread the false impression that Australia has instituted a policy of microchipping its citizens.
Author: David Emery

Title: Veterans' Corpses Found Rotting in Chicago VA's Morgue?
Byline: A clickbait web site used a misleading picture to advance a rumor about unclaimed veterans' corpses in a VA hospital.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Cancer-Causing Children's Snacks Made from Petroleum-Based Products
Byline: A viral post suggests that your kid’s snacks are laced with cancer-causing petroleum products, but scientific evidence to support these claims is lacking.
Author: Alex Kasprak

Title: Leonardo DiCaprio Endorses Trump?
Byline: A tweet purportedly showing Leonardo DiCaprio pledging his vote to Donald Trump was yet another hoax.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Muslim Woman Buys Soda with Food Stamps to Resell?
Byline: A viral video depicts a man who followed a purportedly Muslim woman to her vehicle at night and accused her of using food stamps to buy soda to sell in her store.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Man Sees Dead People, Speaks to God After Being Deprived of His Senses
Byline: A piece of horror fiction about a government experiment is frequently shared on social media as a true story.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Mark Zuckerberg Removing Clinton, Trump Pages for Facebook Likes
Byline: A like-farming scam claims that Facebook founder Mark Zuckerberg will delete Donald Trump's and Hillary Clinton's Facebook pages in exchange for 500,000 likes.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Are German Police Wearing Chainmail to Defend Against Refugee Attacks?
Byline: Photographs show members of German special forces wearing chainmail-like protective gear, but not because of an increase in refugee stabbing attacks.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Bruce Springsteen Attacks Donald Trump on Twitter
Byline: Bruce Springsteen did not insult Donald Trump on Twitter, then sign off with the pro-Clinton hashtag #ImWithHer.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Michael Savage Removed from the Airwaves for Discussing Clinton's Health
Byline: Cryptic tweets sent by radio host Michael Savage led to rumors he was fired or replaced with a "liberal host" after discussing the topic of Hillary Clinton's health.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Hillary Clinton Wore Secret Earpiece During First Presidential Debate?
Byline: Images purportedly showing a wire running down Hillary Clinton's back were offered as proof that the Democratic nominee wore a secret earpiece during the first presidential debate.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did Tiffany Chokers Originate as Slave Collars?
Byline: Tiffany & Co. never made or sold slave collars, and a viral image of a slave collar is not from an exhibit at the National Museum of African American History and Culture in Washington, D.C.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Canned Pumpkin Isn't Actually Pumpkin?
Byline: Just ahead of the fall holidays, a viral social media rumor suggested the pumpkin in pumpkin pie is secretly produced from other squash.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: The Origins of Policing in the United States
Byline: Memes claim that modern law enforcement evolved out of slave patrols.
Author: Brooke Binkowski

Title: Are Police Allowed to 'Pop Hoods' to Block Dash Cams?
Byline: Two images of three Danville, Virginia, police vehicles with their hoods raised led to incorrect claims the practice was sanctioned to obstruct dash cams.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Ford Motors Funds Black Lives Matter
Byline: Multiple online outlets falsely reported that the Ford Motor Company had donated $100 million to the Black Lives Matter movement.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Donald Trump's Parents Wore Ku Klux Klan Attire?
Byline: A photograph that purports to show Donald Trump's parents wearing Klan robes is a hoax.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Obama and Trump Use Umbrellas
Byline: Two photographs from September 2016 appear to show marked differences in Donald Trump's and Barack Obama's umbrella etiquette.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: African 'Reconnection' Ritual
Byline: A photograph showing a group of young men in Ghana is frequently shared with misinformation about its background.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Spider Bursts Out of Overripe Banana?
Byline: A viral video of a spider breaking out of a banana skin is an animation created by a talented CGI artist.
Author: Bethania Palma

Title: 'Rivers of Blood' Flow in Bangladesh After Muslim Festival of Sacrifice
Byline: Viral images show streets running red with bloody water in parts of Dhaka, Bangladesh, after heavy rains coincided with ritual animal sacrifices on the Muslim holy day of Eid al-Adha.
Author: David Emery

Title: All Living Ex-Presidents Warn Against Donald Trump
Byline: An image reporting that all living ex-presidents have warned Americans to not vote for Donald Trump is not quite accurate.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Jeff Foxworthy Gets Attacked by Liberals After Publicly SLAMMING Hillary Clinton
Byline: Popular comedian Jeff Foxworthy was not "attacked by liberals," nor did he "publicly slam Hillary Clinton."
Author: Snopes Staff

Title: Chevy Suburban Merges in Front of 18-Wheeler, Kills Baby?
Byline: Images of a fatal collision in Georgia were misrepresented on social media to scold drivers about sharing the road with large trucks.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Suppressed North Dakota Pipeline Protest Photo
Byline: A photograph purportedly showing a pipeline protest in North Dakota is actually a picture of the crowd at the 1969 Woodstock Festival.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: WhatsApp Will Share Personal User Information with Facebook and Make It Public?
Byline: Facebook purchased the texting app in 2014, but WhatsApp says personal user information won't be shared on that platform, and users can opt out of other data sharing.
Author: Bethania Palma

Title: Michigan Farmers Forced to Destroy Edible Cherries to Prop Up Imports?
Byline: A viral Facebook post about surplus U.S. cherry crops destroyed to "make room for imports" appeals to locavores but contains some inaccuracies.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Young Protester Stares Down Police
Byline: A photograph purportedly showing a young woman protesting pipeline construction in North Dakota was actually taken in Chile.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Does Iceland Pay $5,000 Per Month to Immigrants Who Marry Icelandic Women?
Byline: Unreliable online sources claimed that that due to a shortage of men, Iceland was offering to pay immigrants to take Icelandic women as their brides.
Author: David Emery

Title: China's Jinhua Zoo Names Baby Gorilla Harambe McHarambeface?
Byline: A hoax news article blended several memes when it reported that a zoo named a baby gorilla Harambe McHarambeface.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Will Alaska Pay You $2,000 Not to Leave the State?
Byline: A partially accurate meme claimed that Alaska will pay you more than $2,000 not to move away, provided you live there 190 days a year and aren't a felon.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Did the Steelers' James Harrison Threaten His Teammates?
Byline: Pittsburgh Steelers linebacker James Harrison didn't issue a tweet threatening teammates who were considering kneeling during the national anthem.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Is This a Photograph of a Playground from 1900?
Byline: A grainy historical image shows children climbing on and playing on a frighteningly dangerous (by modern standards) playground of high bars and ladders at a Dallas park.
Author: Bethania Palma

Title: 'Haters and Losers'
Byline: In 2013, Donald Trump extended his best wishes to 'haters and losers' via Twitter on the anniversary of 9/11.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Hillary 'Body Double' Teresa Barnwell Appeared in NYC After Clinton's 9/11 Medical Incident?
Byline: #HillarysBodyDouble took over Twitter with claims that lookalike Teresa Barnwell had appeared in New York to impersonate Hillary Clinton after the candidate left a 9/11 event following a medical incident.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Did Facebook Ban All Christian-Themed Content?
Byline: A report claimed that Facebook was banning the posting of Christian-themed content while allowing all other religions free rein on the social network.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Hillary Clinton Diagnosed with Vascular Dementia, Has One Year to Live?
Byline: A viral video uses forged and misrepresented evidence in an attempt to prove that Hillary Clinton is suffering from subcortical vascular dementia and has  only  a year to live.
Author: David Emery

Title: Hillary Clinton Told 'Seventeen' Magazine She Didn't Want Her Daughter Marrying a Black Man?
Byline: There's no evidence (beyond a meme) that Hillary Clinton said she would be disappointed if her daughter married a black man during an interview with "Seventeen" magazine.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Ohio Police Post Graphic Photograph of Adults Passed Out from Heroin with Child in Car
Byline: East Liverpool, Ohio, police posted a photograph of two adults who were  passed out in their car, reportedly from overdosing on heroin, with a child in the back seat.
Author: Bethania Palma

Title: Did a Physician Confirm Hillary Clinton Has Parkinson's Disease?
Byline: A montage of photos and video clips of Democratic presidential candidate Hillary Clinton purportedly demonstrates she has symptoms of Parkinson's disease.
Author: David Emery

Title: Ivanka Trump's 'Lap Dance' with Donald
Byline: A photograph showing Ivanka Trump seemingly sitting on her famous father's lap documents less than is salaciously claimed.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Video Shows Baby Delivered Inside Intact Amniotic Sac
Byline: A video boasting millions of views on Facebook shows a newborn baby delivered by C-section still inside an intact amniotic sac.
Author: David Emery

Title: Hurricane Hermine Waterspout in North Carolina
Byline: A photograph purportedly showing a waterspout produced in North Carolina by Hurricane Hermine is actually a composite of multiple images.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Half-Eaten Shark Washes Up in Daytona
Byline: Forced perspective made a photograph of a "half-eaten shark" appear more mysterious than it was in real life.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Tiny House Giveaway Scam
Byline: Multiple like-farming Facebook pages have lured users with the false promise of tiny house giveaways.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Red Cross Served 'Unacceptable' Meals to Louisiana Flood Victims?
Byline: Viral photographs showed meager, unappetizing meals served to flood victims in Louisiana by the American Red Cross in 2016. They weren't the only images of Red Cross rations out there, however.
Author: David Emery

Title: Tweet Claims Clinton to Drop Out of Presidential Race
Byline: A tweet purporting to be from a CBS reporter claiming that Hillary Clinton was dropping out of the presidential race is a poorly executed hoax.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Fisherman Survives Inside Whale for Three Days
Byline: The faux-spirituality web site Spirit Science posted a spoof story of a Spanish fisherman supposedly swallowed by a whale, who lived to tell the story.
Author: Bethania Palma

Title: Two Editions of 'Wall Street Journal' Bear Opposite Headlines About Trump
Byline: An image showing two editions of The Wall Street Journal with opposing headlines on the front page is real, but the wording wasn't part of an effort to sway voters.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Does a Toaster Dial Set Minutes Rather Than 'Level of Toasty-ness'?
Byline: A long-circulating image claims that toaster owners are misinformed about the purpose of a dial that sets minutes, not darkness.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Sylvester Stallone Death Hoax
Byline: A Facebook message falsely reported that the 'Rocky' actor had passed away from prostate cancer.
Author: Snopes Staff

Title: Was a Snake Dropped on a Family Barbecue By a Hawk?
Byline: A viral video purportedly shows a hawk dropping a snake on a family barbecue.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did Bill Maher and Michael Moore Snatch Donald Trump's Tax Returns?
Byline: Joking tweets sent by comedian Bill Maher and filmmaker Michael Moore about a heist involving Donald Trump's tax returns confused some social media users.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: John Kerry Suggests Media Cover Terrorism Less
Byline: Two sentences of John Kerry's remarks in Dhaka on terrorism were highlighted in American media coverage of his comments, but didn't tell the entire story.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Is This a Picture of Congressmembers Sitting During the Pledge of Allegiance?
Byline: "Y'all are mad at an athlete? This is your government!"
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Hillary Clinton Wore 'Secret Earpiece' During Commander-in-Chief Forum
