Byline: A photograph purportedly showing Hillary Clinton wearing a 'secret earpiece' during NBC's 'Commander-In-Chief' candidate forum reveals nothing unusual.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Trump Deletes 'Global Warning' Claim?
Byline: The Republican presidential nominee tweeted in 2012 that China invented the concept of global warming, but he didn't delete the statement during the debate.
Author: Brooke Binkowski

Title: Does This Photograph Show a Praying Mantis Attacking a Hummingbird?
Byline: An image of a hummingbird killed by a praying mantis is real, although what the picture captures is a relatively rare event.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: CNN Took 'Crooked' Out of Trump Tweet About Clinton
Byline: CNN dropped the word "crooked" from a graphic quoting a Donald Trump tweet about his rival's health.
Author: Bethania Palma

Title: Food Lion $90 Coupon
Byline: The Food Lion grocery chain is not offering $90 coupons to Facebook users who click and share links.
Author: Bethania Palma

Title: Is This 'Smiling' Sun with 'Smiling' Birds Photo Real?
Byline: A photograph seemingly captured three birds flying in a 'smile' formation in the sky with a 'smiling' sun.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did Neil deGrasse Tyson Address Gender Inequality in Science on Twitter?
Byline: A rant on Twitter attributed to the astrophysicist actually came from a parody account.
Author: Brooke Binkowski

Title: Mike Pence Calls for a Ban on Condoms Because 'They Lead to Abortions'
Byline: A fake news article claiming Mike Pence called for a condom ban led to images decoupling the falsehood from its source.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Is This a Photograph of a Rare Marbled Fuark?
Byline: This elusive creature is said to inhabit the sparse woodlands of Eastern Cambodia.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Does Kinking a Live Electrical Wire Stop Electricity and Make it Safe?
Byline: An image represents that you can safely work on live electrical wires by simply kinking them "like a garden hose."
Author: Bethania Palma

Title: Motorcyclists Protest Burkini Ban
Byline: A photograph purportedly showing two motorcyclists protesting a 2016 burkini ban incident in France was actually taken several years earlier.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: What Rosie O'Donnell Really Said She'd Like to Do with Her Period Blood
Byline: Comedian Rosie O'Donnell stands accused of saying 'I'd like to take my period blood and smear it all over Christians' faces' -- but it's not an accurate quote.
Author: David Emery

Title: Were Tennessee Schoolchildren Forced to Bow Down to Allah?
Byline: A photograph of children kneeling  has been attributed to many locations and does not capture Tennessee public school students being forced to pray in a mosque.
Author: Bethania Palma

Title: State Cuts Off Water to  Dakota Access Pipeline Protesters?
Byline: Social media rumors inaccurately reported water was cut off to Native Americans protesting against the Dakota Access Pipeline.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Bill and Melinda Gates Are Giving Away Free College Textbooks?
Byline: An image suggesting that Bill and Melinda Gates are giving away free college textbooks is somewhat misleading.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Trump Attacks God in Tweetstorm
Byline: No, Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump did not really lash out at God in a series of blasphemous tweets. It's a satire.
Author: David Emery

Title: Hillary Clinton Listed As Threat in Army Training Slide
Byline: A photograph showing an Army training slide labeling Hillary Clinton as an insider threat is real but was used only by a single unit and not approved by leadership.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: 'My Daddy's Life Matters'
Byline: A photograph showing a police officer's daughter holding a 'My Daddy's Life Matters' sign has been altered into something more politically controversial.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Clouds Over Geneva Show CERN Opening a Portal to a New Dimension?
Byline: Conspiracy theorists speculated that pictures of a storm over Switzerland were proof that the Large Hadron Collider had opened a portal to another dimension.
Author: Bethania Palma

Title: Trump Family Photograph
Byline: A family portrait of Donald Trump, his wife Melania, and son Barron appeared in August 2016, but some viewers were skeptical of its authenticity.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Is Mark Zuckerberg David Rockefeller's Grandson?
Byline: We look into the conspiracy theory that Facebook founder Mark Zuckerberg's real name is Jacob Greenberg and he's the grandson of billionaire banker David Rockefeller.
Author: David Emery

Title: Did Iranian Olympic Coverage Censor Images of Female Athletes?
Byline: Censorship in Iran was purportedly demonstrated by footage from a state-run sports network.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did J.K. Rowling Drop Off Forbes Billionaires List Due to Charitable Donations?
Byline: A popular Internet meme says 'Harry Potter' author J.K. Rowling dropped off the Forbes billionaires list because she gave so much money to charity.
Author: David Emery

Title: Old Reginald Denny Beating Picture Circulates Urging Drivers to Run Over Protesters
Byline: The post uses a 24-year-old picture from the Los Angeles riots to deride modern-day Black Lives Matter protests.
Author: Bethania Palma

Title: Mysterious Creature Filmed in Portuguese Desert
Byline: A viral video supposedly shot in Portugal seemingly shows a strange alien entity that looks like a cross between Bigfoot and a chupacabra.
Author: David Emery

Title: Donald Trump's Harvard Rejection Letter
Byline: An image purportedly showing the rejection letter Donald Trump received from Harvard University is not real.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Mike Pence Blames Media for Trump Controversies?
Byline: Republican VP candidate Mike Pence didn't proclaim that "the things Donald Trump says wouldn't hurt our campaign half as much if the press didn't report it."
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Ben Carson: Muslims Worship 'the Moon God of Arabia'?
Byline: An essay denigrating American Muslims has been a viral e-mail forward for at least a decade and did not originate with former Republican president candidate Dr. Ben Carson.
Author: Bethania Palma

Title: Fear the Grim Arabic Tote Bag
Byline: A viral image of a tote bag with an Arabic inscription is correctly translated, poking fun at non-speakers frightened of the language.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: 'Perfect Timing' Gymnastics Shot
Byline: A GIF shows a photographer's 'perfect timing,' setting off a camera's flash just as a gymnast performed a midair split.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Lunar Footprint Mystery
Byline: Does a photograph of Neil Armstrong's spacesuit show that the tread of his boots didn't match the "footprints" he supposedly left on the moon?
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Hillary Clinton Wears a Defibrillator?
Byline: A photograph of Hillary Clinton speaking at a campaign event was circulated as proof that the presidential nominee wears a defibrillator.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Media Ignore Kim Rhode's Sixth Olympic Medal
Byline: After U.S. shooter Kim Rhode won her 6th medal in as many Olympiads, a rumor asserted that the media were ignoring her accomplishments due to her politics.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Forever 21 Swastika Rings
Byline: A photograph of purported Forever 21 swastika rings has gone viral, but the company denies they sell any such product.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Donald Trump: Utah Is a 'Boring, Small State' with 'Strange People'
Byline: A tweet purportedly issued by Donald Trump making disparaging comments about Utah is a fake.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Hiroshima vs. Detroit
Byline: Circulating images purport to compare the effects of urban decay in Detroit with the destruction of Hiroshima, Japan by an atomic bomb during World War II.
Author: David Emery

Title: Trump Blasts Media for Reporting Things He Says?
Byline: Satire positing that Donald Trump claimed the news media are biased for accurately reporting his statements sailed over the heads of many social media users.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Angelina Jolie Death Hoax
Byline: A scammy web site has perpetrated a false rumor that Actress Angelina Jolie committed suicide.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: #SaveTwitter? Social Media Network Not Shutting Down in 2017
Byline: A spurious rumor holds that the Twitter social media platform will be shutting down in 2017 due to cyberbullying.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Gary Sinise Tweets Hillary Clinton About Guns
Byline: An image showing a Twitter conversation between Hillary Clinton and Gary Sinise about guns is fake.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Jesus Statue 'Miraculously' Opens Eyes
Byline: A viral video showing a statue of Jesus Christ in a Mexican church 'miraculously' opening and closing its eyes also shows signs of tampering.
Author: David Emery

Title: Iran Blurs Photograph Showing Olympics Volleyball Player
Byline: A photograph showing a blurred-out woman's volleyball player did not originate from an Iranian news agency.
Author: Brooke Binkowski

Title: Is This a Live Panda Flown from China to U.S. in Business Class?
Byline: A viral image purportedly shows a live panda cub seated next to a human being on a China Airlines.
Author: David Emery

Title: Tim Kaine Admits to Open Marriage on Twitter
Byline: A tweet ostensibly posted by vice presidential candidate Tim Kaine allegedly acknowledges that he has an open marriage.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: 'Superman Is Coming in Supergirl' Poster
Byline: A promotional poster with what looked like an unfortunate typo was actually a joke made from a piece of fan art.
Author: Brooke Binkowski

Title: Does a Viral Photo Show a Real Baby Platypus?
Byline: Don't you just hate it when people post your embarrassing baby pictures on the internet?
Author: Dan Evon

Title: The Narilatha Flower
Byline: Viral images purport to show examples of a 'Narilatha Flower' or 'Nareepol Tree' with blossoms in the shape of a woman's body.
Author: David Emery

Title: Is it Impossible to Cancel Recurring Donations to the Trump Campaign?
Byline: A CNN reporter tweeted out a former Donald Trump supporter's claim that it was impossible to cancel recurring donations to the campaign once initiated, but it wasn't clear that was always the case.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Vaping Causes 'Popcorn Lung'?
Byline: Disreputable viral web sites matched an unrelated photograph with claims that a study had linked e-cigarettes with popcorn lung.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Did Trump Say 'Laziness Is a Trait in Blacks; No Black President Again Any Time Soon'?
Byline: A meme created the impression that Donald Trump claimed that there wouldn't be a black president again any time soon because 'laziness is a trait in blacks.'
Author: David Emery

Title: Photograph of Hillary Clinton Slipping on Stairs Circulated as Proof of Poor Health
Byline: Several right-wing web sites circulated a months-old photograph of Hillary Clinton slipping on some stairs as the 'latest evidence' that she is in poor health.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Loretta Lynch: 'Confederate Flag Tattoos Must All Be Removed IMMEDIATELY'
Byline: Attorney General Loretta Lynch hasn't demanded that all Confederate flag tattoos be "removed" -- nor could she.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Khizr Khan Received $375,000 from the Clinton Foundation
Byline: Dubious images purport to show a bank statement proving that Khizr Khan was paid $375,000 by the Clinton Foundation after speaking at the Democratic National Convention.
Author: David Emery

Title: Is Photo of WWII-Era German Tank That Shot Down UFOs Real?
Byline: A photograph purportedly showing kill markings that indicate flying saucers on a WWII-era anti-aircraft gun has been digitally manipulated.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Wisconsin Girl Dies as a Result of Receiving Gardasil HPV Vaccine
Byline: An online article claiming that a 12-year-old girl in Waukesha, Wisconsin, died as a result of receiving the Gardasil HPV vaccine is based on misinformation.
Author: David Emery

Title: Obama Cuts Military Pay 3rd Year in a Row?
Byline: An online article claims President Obama has used a loophole in federal statutes to cut military pay for three years in a row. That's half-true.
Author: David Emery

Title: Black Lives Matter Co-Founder Poops on Ice Rink
Byline: Multiple blog posts falsely claimed purported Black Lives Matter activist Kayla McKelvey defecated on an ice rink because "only white people" ice skate.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: For All Jews Voting for Hillary
Byline: A photograph shows the Clintons posing with Palestinian leader Yasser Arafat.  But what's the point?
Author: David Mikkelson

Title: Ghazala Khan's Hijab Was a Political Stunt
Byline: A viral photograph of a Gold Star Mother without a hijab does not depict Ghazala Khan.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Did Kurt Cobain Predict a Donald Trump Presidency in 1993?
Byline: A viral image suggests that the late Nirvana singer Kurt Cobain hinted at a future Donald Trump presidency over 20 years before it happened.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Captain Khan's Epitaph: 'Beware of Dying as an Apostate'
Byline: Rumors claiming the epitaph on Capt. Humayun Khan's  headstone refers to him as an "apostate" are rooted in ISIS propaganda.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Hillary Clinton Touts Sharia Law as 'Powerful New Direction' for Women
Byline: A viral quote attributing pro-Sharia sentiments to Democratic presidential nominee Hillary Clinton is a fabrication.
Author: David Emery

Title: Sarah Silverman: Killing Jesus
Byline: After Sarah Silverman appeared at the July 2016 Democratic National Convention, images popped up claiming she made offensive statements about Jews killing Jesus.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Trump Leaks Classified Info After Intelligence Briefing
Byline: The Internet uproar about Donald Trump's supposed leak of classified information after receiving a national security intelligence briefing is baseless.
Author: David Emery

Title: Hillary Clinton: 'Marriage Is Always Between a Man and a Woman'
Byline: An image about Hillary Clinton's stance on marriage equality reflects that she didn't publicly support same-sex marriage until 2013.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Trump Claims America Should Never Have Given Canada Its Independence
Byline: A satirical site reported that Donald Trump had tweeted about America's giving Canada their independence, and many viewers believed the report was accurate.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Tom Hanks Backs Donald Trump for President
Byline: Online reports that actor Tom Hanks said in a television interview that he backs Donald Trump for president are false.
Author: David Emery

Title: So Long and Thanks for All the Fish
Byline: A photograph of an orca jumping several feet out of the water is often viewed with skepticism, but it's real.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Elijah Cummings Said Democrats Gave Black People the Right to Vote?
Byline: A meme claiming Rep. Elijah Cummings misattributed responsibility for the 15th Amendment during his 2016 DNC speech was mostly inaccurate itself.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: 'When You Need to Get Her Drunk'
Byline: An image showing a "vintage" Budweiser beer ad bearing the tagline "when you need to get her drunk" is just a Photoshop contest entry.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did Hillary Clinton Steal $200,000 in White House Furnishings?
Byline: An Internet meme claiming that Hillary Clinton was forced to return $200,000 worth of furniture, china and art she "stole" from the White House is based on a grain of truth.
Author: David Emery

Title: Ted Cruz Plots on Air Force One
Byline: Ted Cruz was photographed leaving Air Force One with Democratic plotters who supposedly convinced him not to endorse Donald Trump at the RNC.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: SCAM: Luxury RV Giveaway
Byline: A Facebook page that promises to give away luxury RVs to users who like and share it is a scam.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Protester Screams in NYPD Cop's Face
Byline: Award-winning photograph captures a protester right up against an NYPD officer, but whether she was actually screaming in his face is uncertain.
Author: David Mikkelson

Title: Were Islamic Symbols Added to the White House Fence?
Byline: Viral rumors of 'Islamic symbolism' added to the White House fence during a 2015 security upgrade are baseless.
Author: David Emery

Title: Melania Trump Wore Seinfeld's 'Pirate Shirt' to the RNC
Byline: A photograph showing Melania Trump wearing the 'pirate shirt' featured in a memorable episode of the TV sitcom 'Seinfeld' at the RNC is not real.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did Trump Tweet About 'Boring Mike Pence'?
Byline: Amidst Republican Convention chatter on social media, an item from 'The Onion' claiming Donald Trump tweeted about "boring Mike Pence" got mixed in with the real stuff.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Diversity Among Democratic and Republic Interns
Byline: An image comparing the diversity (or lack thereof) of Republican and Democratic interns is somewhat misleading.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Obama to Ban Trucks After Nice Attack
Byline: A satirical blog post suggesting President Obama planned to ban trucks following the terror attack in Nice quickly crossed over from humor to rumor.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Hillary Clinton Supporter Stands on American Flag
Byline: A clearly doctored image does not depict a woman standing on an American flag while waving a "Hillary for President 2016" banner.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Trump Copies Obama's Congratulatory Tweet
Byline: Donald Trump's tweet congratulating his wife Melania on her speech at the Republican Convention wasn't stolen from Barack Obama.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: FBI Warning to 'All Americans' About Poisoned Produce
Byline: An online article misleadingly suggested that the Federal Bureau of Investigation had warned Americans to be alert of grocery store produce possibly sprayed with poison.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Pokemon Go Uploads Your Data to Google Maps
Byline: Just as Pokemon Go's popularity spread like wildfire on social media, so too did a rumor the app collects data for Google Maps and the NSA.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Is Disney/Pixar's 'Monsters, Inc.' Sequel Set for a July 2020 Release?
Byline: A fan-made poster quickly crossed from Instagram to Facebook and led fans to believe Pixar was releasing the 'Monsters, Inc.' sequel 'Boo' in 2020.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Officer Who Shot Alton Sterling Pictured at KKK Rally
Byline: A photograph showing a police officer at a KKK rally is frequently shared with misinformation identifying him as the officer who shot and killed Alton Sterling.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Is This a Real Photo of Trump with No Wig or Makeup?
Byline: Who knows what GOP presidential candidate Donald Trump's head looks like in its unprepped state?
Author: David Mikkelson

Title: You Had a Hunch the News System Was Rigged?
Byline: A list documenting purported familial ties between news media personnel and the Obama administration was often shared as evidence that the news system was rigged in the President's favor.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Rowan Atkinson Death Hoax
Byline: A frequently recirculated Facebook hoax has convinced many people that actor Rowan Atkinson ("Mr. Bean") either committed suicide or died in a car accident, but he is alive and well.
Author: David Emery

Title: 'Chilling' Photograph of Fatal Crash Shows Spirit Leaving Victim's Body
Byline: The 'spirit' seen in a photograph of a fatal crash scene bears a startling resemblance to a fleck of dust.
Author: Brooke Binkowski

Title: Brandenn Bremmer Suicide
Byline: A viral image about late prodigy Brandenn Bremmer got some facts right but also included mere speculation.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Photograph of Elijah Wood with Identical Twin Brother
Byline: An image purportedly showing Elijah Wood and his identical twin brother is actually a composite of two photographs of Elijah Wood.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Obama Accomplishments
Byline: An Internet meme touts the economic achievements of United States President Barack Obama.
Author: David Emery

Title: Seahawks' Richard Sherman Condemns 'Black Lives Matter' Movement
Byline: A post condemning the Black Lives Matter Movement is frequently attributed to Richard Sherman, but the NFL player denied authoring it.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Australian Police Targeting Pokemon Go Players
Byline: A fake photograph purportedly shows a warning sign in Australia indicating that Pokemon Go players are being targeted by police.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Donald Trump Congratulates Serena Williams
Byline: A fake Twitter conversation between Donald Trump and Serena Williams circulated after the tennis star won her 7th Wimbledon title.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: President Obama: Americans Are Better Off Under Martial Law
Byline: President Obama did not give an interview to the Washington Post during which he opined that Americans would be better off under martial law.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Pandora Endorses Black Lives Matter?
Byline: The streaming music service Pandora caused controversy by posting a message using the hashtag #BlackLivesMatter on social media.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: White House Lighting
Byline: Inaccurate image claims the White House was illuminated purple the night Prince died but made no display for five police officers killed in Dallas.
Author: David Mikkelson

Title: John Cena Death Hoax
Byline: A Facebook-driven celebrity death hoax held that wrestler John Cena had died in a car accident.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Einstein Bicycles as A-Bomb Explodes?
Byline: An altered image purports to show Albert Einstein racing away from an atomic bomb explosion on a bicycle.
Author: David Emery

Title: Steven Hildreth Jr.'s Traffic Stop
Byline: A viral Facebook posting by Steven Hildreth Jr. tells a true story about an uneventful interaction with police during a traffic stop.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Was Officer Nakia Jones Fired After Posting a Viral Police Brutality Video?
Byline: Nakia Jones said the Warrensville Heights Police Department fired her after she made a video in July 2016 following the shooting death of Alton Sterling in Baton Rouge, Louisiana.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: DeRay Mckesson and the Summer of Chaos
Byline: Fabricated Twitter messages claiming activist DeRay Mckesson was plotting a "summer of chaos" with Attorney General Loretta Lynch resurfaced after the Dallas police shootings.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Dallas Shooter Not Identified as Neo-Nazi Jeffrey Harris
Byline: A troll Twitter account started a false rumor that a neo-Nazi named Jeffrey Harris was responsible for the protest shooting of police in Dallas.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: 'The Simpsons' Predicted Pokemon Go
Byline: A photograph purportedly showing that 'The Simpsons' animated television series predicted the advent of the Pokemon Go app is a fake.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Monsanto Buys Whole Foods
Byline: A number of blog posts objecting to the Whole Foods CEO's comments about GMO labeling rejuvenated an old rumor that Monsanto bought the grocery chain.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Alton Sterling Killed by Trump Supporter Robert Kinnison
Byline: Shortly after Alton Sterling was killed by Baton Rouge police, a rumor appeared on social media that the officer responsible was a Donald Trump supporter whose name is circulated after every high-profile shooting.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did the Last Surviving WWII Veteran March Alone in Memorial Day Parade?
Byline: A photograph of the "last surviving veteran" of a WWII battle group marching in a Memorial Day parade was taken in Russia in 2007.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: 'Welcome to Mingo County'
Byline: A fake photograph shows a 'Welcome Sign' outside of Mingo County, West Virginia, warning visitors that armed citizens will "kill you back."
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Bow Hunting Wild Horses
Byline: A photograph showing a man posing with a wild horse he killed in Australia using a bow and arrow is real, but the pictured activity is legal.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Pride Parade Fire Hydrant Mishap
Byline: An image depicts a man stabbed at an altercation between KKK members and opponents, not a Pride attendee injured attempting to stimulate himself with a fire hydrant.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Photographs Show Carcass of Loch Ness Monster
Byline: Images purportedly showing the skeletal remains of the Loch Ness Monster were actually taken from the set-up of a television show.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Muslim TSA Agent Screens a Nun
Byline: An old photograph showing a Muslim TSA agent screening a nun at an airport has nothing to do with Barack Obama.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Mexican Family Names Newborn After 'Brexit'
Byline: A viral story in Spanish-language media about a family naming their daughter "Breksit," after the UK's decision to leave the EU, is a hoax.
Author: Brooke Binkowski

Title: Hillary Clinton Demanded This Photo Be Removed
Byline: A long-circulating photograph of a haggard-looking Hillary Clinton is an altered version of the original, and Clinton has not demanded it be erased from the Internet.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Hillary Clinton Hijab Campaign Ad
Byline: A one-second segment of an October 2015 video tweeted by Hillary Clinton was screencapped to suggest the candidate had donned a hijab for a new campaign ad.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Cormac McCarthy Death Hoax
Byline: A hoax Twitter account propagated a false rumor that acclaimed author Cormac McCarthy had died of a stroke.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Chemotherapy Doesn't Work, Doctor Blows the Whistle
Byline: A compendium of misrepresentations led to a Facebook rumor claiming a long-dead doctor had recently revealed that chemotherapy doesn't work.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: President Obama is Giving $1,000 per Month to Food Stamp Recipients
Byline: A baseless Facebook rumor held that President Obama was giving food stamp recipients an extra $1,000 per month for three months.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Muslims Rally Around Image of Jesus' Decapitated Head
Byline: A misleading and fear-mongering video purportedly showing 'radical' Muslims rallying around an image of Jesus' decapitated head was shared on Facebook by preacher Michael Chitwood.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: 'British Refugees Welcome' Sign on Madrid Building
Byline: An image showing a "British Refugees Welcome" sign on the Palacio Cibeles in Spain was digitally manipulated for satirical purposes.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: European Union Flag to Lose a Star After Brexit Vote
Byline: Many social media users incorrectly claimed that the European Union flag was going to lose a star after the Brexit vote.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Bomb-Sniffing Dogs Killed in Kuwait?
Byline: A disturbing set of images purportedly shows a pile of dead bomb-sniffing dogs that were put down after their contract with a security company was cancelled.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Is This a Cheetah at a Dog Race?
Byline: An image purportedly showing a cheetah at a greyhound race was created for an automobile advertisement.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Donald Trump Called Canadians 'Snow Mexicans'
Byline: A satirical image led many Twitter users to believe Donald Trump had referred to Canadians as "snow Mexicans."
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Ticketmaster Class Action Free Ticket Giveaway
Byline: Social media rumors about free tickets from Ticketmaster were largely true, but with some important caveats.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Does This Photograph Show Whales Breaching Near a Small Boat?
Byline: A whale of a picture, impressive at any scale.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Baby Moose Holds Rainbow Flag
Byline: A photograph purportedly showing a baby moose holding a gay pride flag is a digital creation.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Is Orlando Shooting Hero Imran Yousuf a Muslim?
Byline: A popular meme incorrectly states that former U.S. Marine and heroic Pulse bouncer Imran Yousuf is Muslim.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Does This Photograph Show John McCain Meeting Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi?
Byline: A photograph taken in Syria in 2013 purportedly captured Senator John McCain posing with ISIS leader Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi.
Author: David Mikkelson

Title: Steph Curry Suspended from NBA Finals
Byline: Fake tweets and bad reporting left many NBA fans worried that Golden State Warriors star Steph Curry had been suspended from Game 7 of the NBA Finals.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Facebook to Ban 'Amen Posts'
Byline: There's no truth to a rumor that Facebook is banning "amen posts" (in which social media users are exhorted to type "amen").
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Uniformed Veteran Kicked Out of Child's School
Byline: A misleading social media page claimed a uniformed veteran was kicked out of his daughter's school because his attire was offensive.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Fresno and Tulare Serial Killer Warning
Byline: Police say that viral warnings about a serial killer in Fresno and Tulare counties are not credible.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: World's Largest Tortoise?
Byline: A prop from a Japanese monster movie is frequently shared as a photograph of the "world's largest tortoise."
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Canadian Prime Minister and Opposition Leader Share Kiss to Denounce Orlando Massacre
Byline: A fake news web site published a fabricated photograph of Canadian prime minister Justin Trudeau and opposition leader Thomas Mulcair kissing to denounce the Orlando nightclub mass shooting.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Pablo Reyes' Facebook Prediction
Byline: Facebook user Pablo Reyes' eerily accurate predictions for 2016 were a hoax.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Orlando Mass Shooting Math Doesn't Add Up
Byline: A viral social media post about perceived inconsistencies in the "math" of the June 2016 Orlando nightclub shooting uses all the wrong numbers.
Author: David Mikkelson

Title: Futuristic Audi Truck
Byline: A purported photograph of a futuristic Audi truck is just a conceptual illustration.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did London's Mayor Ban Sexy Images Because They're Offensive to Islam?
Byline: London's Mayor Sadiq Khan sought removal of "body shaming" images from advertisements on public transit, but not because of Islam.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Kevin Hart Beaten at Miami Club
Byline: A photograph purportedly showing actor Kevin Hart with facial injuries suffered during a mugging at a Miami nightclub was actually taken on the set of a television show.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: 'Multiple Shooters' at Orlando Nightclub
Byline: An irresponsible Facebook post claimed that multiple gunmen were involved in the mass shooting at Orlando Pulse, and that two of them were still at large.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Trump Tweets That He 'Appreciates the Congrats' on Being Right About Terrorism
Byline: Donald Trump tweeted that he appreciated "the congrats for being right on radical Islamic terrorism" after a mass shooting in Orlando, but that wasn't his full message.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Does This Video Document Google Manipulating Searches for Hillary Clinton?
Byline: A viral video accused the search engine of manipulating results in favor of Hillary Clinton.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: 'Terrifying Warning' About Ice Cream Trucks and Chloroform
Byline: A viral social media post claimed that young girls were being drugged with chloroform by ice cream trucks, but the rumor appeared to be baseless.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Victoria Woodhull Was the First Female Presidential Candidate, Not Hillary Clinton
Byline: Social media debate erupted over whether Hillary Clinton was the first female presumptive nominee for President, or if that honor went to Victoria Woodhull.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Senator Robert Byrd in Ku Klux Klan Garb?
Byline: A photograph purportedly showing former Senator Robert Byrd in Klan robes has been digitally manipulated.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Dick Smith Statement About Halal Certifications as 'Extortion'
Byline: A viral email purportedly relaying Australian grocer Dick Smith's views on halal certification contains mostly misinformation.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Photograph of 'Incontinent' Hillary Clinton
Byline: An image purportedly proving that the Democratic presidential candidate is incontinent was digitally manipulated.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Spy Cameras in Hotel Room Coat Hooks?
Byline: A clickbait Facebook post claimed that cameras in hotel hooks were a risk to guests, but it cited a warning issued by police in Key West that was unrelated to hotels.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Sea Lice Invading Florida Beaches
Byline: While warnings on Facebook about "sea lice" garnered skepticism, news reports have confirmed that small stinging jellyfish are present at some beaches.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Trump Retweets Fake Photograph of Black Supporters
Byline: Donald Trump retweeted a purported photograph of black supporters of his campaign, but the depicted people weren't Trump fans.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Is This a Photograph of a Woman Beaten for Supporting Donald Trump?
Byline: After a contentious Donald Trump rally in California, images of purportedly injured supporters circulated on Facebook, one of which was swiped from a TV show.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: NFL Banning the National Anthem in 2017
Byline: A false social media rumor holds that the NFL will be  banning the playing of the U.S. national anthem in 2017.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Teenager Beaten by Anti-Trump Protester
Byline: An image purporting to show a young woman who was beaten by people protesting a Donald Trump rally is actually a still from a Mexican telenovela.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Jack Black Death Hoax
Byline: A rumor circulated that Jack Black had suddenly died in June 2016 after the actor's Twitter account was hacked.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Is This a Photograph of an Orphan Lying in Her Mother's Chalk Outline?
Byline: A photograph purportedly showing an orphan lying in a chalk outline of her absent mother has a very different backstory.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: UCLA Students Rally Behind Isis
Byline: A photograph supposedly showing 5,000 UCLA students holding "a candlelight vigil for fallen ISIS soldiers" depicts nothing of the sort.
Author: David Mikkelson

Title: Lithium Mine vs. Oil Sands Extraction
Byline: An image purportedly showing the environmental differences between a lithium mine and an oil sands extraction facility is misleading.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Does This Photograph Show a Condor Killed in America?
Byline: Photographs of humans hunting endangered species for sport always provoke outrage among viewers.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Swedish Girl Refugee Assault
Byline: A meme claimed that a 14-year-old Swedish girl was raped by refugees, but the story didn't check out.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Do Male Penguins Make 'Pebble Proposals' to Their Mates?
Byline: A social media factoid about penguin courtship and the "perfect pebble" does not quite reflect the birds' actual mating habits.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Does This Photograph Show a Misaligned Bridge?
Byline: 'Survey-scale inaccuracy or positioning errors can lead to costly construction mistakes such as bridge misalignment.'
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Was Yosemite Sam Banned
Byline: A meme falsely claimed the Looney Tunes character Yosemite Sam had been banned from television due to his use of guns and violence.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Taco Bell Announcing Bankruptcy, All Stores Closing by 2018?
Byline: A prank news article generator tricked many social media users into believing the Taco Bell chain was closing their doors forever.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Photograph Shows 100,000 Bikers at Rally with Donald Trump
Byline: A years-old photograph was used to illustrate claims that thousands of bikers attended a rally with Donald Trump in 2016.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Racial Slur on Huck Finn's Receipt?
Byline: An image of a racist epithet on a receipt from Huck Finn's in New Orleans is real and unaltered, and the employee involved was immediately fired.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Michigan Right to Farm Act Repealed
Byline: A misleading blog post recycled inaccurate claims from 2014 about changes to Michigan's "Right to Farm" Act.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Hillary Clinton to Be Indicted on Federal Racketeering Charges
Byline: A broken Huffington Post link circulated on social media suggested that Hillary Clinton would soon face an indictment, but the article was unvetted and did not list any credible sources.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Trump Haters and Trump Supporters
Byline: Photographs that purportedly show the difference between "Trump haters" and "Trump supporters" are misleading.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Does This Photograph Show Eight Rainbows?
Byline: Those searching for eight pots of gold here are bound to be octo-disappointed.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Anonymous Hacks IRS Database – Publishes Trump's Tax Returns
Byline: A fake news article reported that Donald Trump's tax returns were posted online after Anonymous hacked the IRS database.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Donald Trump Just Admitted He Was a Hillary Clinton Plant the Whole Time
Byline: A fake Donald Trump tweet claiming that he's been a plant for Hillary Clinton all along wasn't actually sent by the Republican presidential candidate.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did Donald Trump Take $150K from the 9/11 Small Business Fund?
Byline: A 2006 New York Daily News article about Donald Trump's receipt of $150,000 in federal aid post-9/11 was inaccurately revisited in 2016.
Author: Snopes Staff

Title: Little-Known Norman Rockwell Painting: 'Cat Prevents House Fire'
Byline: An image purportedly showing a little-known Norman Rockwell painting entitled "Cat Prevents House Fire" wasn't created by the famed American illustrator.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Anti-Trump Protesters Break Horse's Leg
Byline: Rumors swept social media that a police mount was pushed over during anti-Trump demonstrations, fracturing its leg.
Author: Brooke Binkowski

Title: L'Oreal Beagle Testing
Byline: A viral Facebook image purportedly depicts a beagle blinded by L'Oreal cosmetics testing, but the image was previously linked with a separate and unrelated controversy in Brazil.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Size of the Indianapolis Motor Speedway
Byline: An image shows how eight famous landmarks could all comfortably fit inside the Indianapolis Motor Speedway.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Photograph 'Taken Without a Telescope' Shows Andromeda Galaxy Next to the Moon
Byline: A purported photograph that shows the galaxy next to (and much larger than) the moon is actually a composite of two separate images.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: QuikTrip Safe Place
Byline: A viral Facebook post regarding QuikTrip's partnership with the Safe Place initiative contains some dangerously inaccurate information about the scope of services provided.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Hidden Sex Drawing in 'Monsters, Inc.' Scene
Byline: A viral video purports to show a sexual act depicted in a scene from the popular children's movie "Monsters, Inc."
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Melania Trump vs. Michelle Obama
Byline: An old photoshoot features then-model Melania Trump posing provocatively for GQ magazine.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Is This a Picture of a Leatherback Turtle's Mouth?
Byline: An image showing the inside of a leatherback turtle's mouth is gruesome and terrifying ... but is it real?
Author: Dan Evon

Title: That's One Way to Stop Road Rage
Byline: An animated image purportedly showing a road rage incident was actually taken from an episode of a Russian television series.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Barbara Boxer Gave Bernie Sanders Supporters the Finger?
Byline: A grainy photograph doesn't show Barbara Boxer giving Bernie Sanders supporters the finger, and it hasn't been "scrubbed" from social media.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Sunny Oaks Elementary Forces Kids to Cross Dress for LGBT Week
Byline: A social media rumor about forced cross-dressing at Sunny Oaks Elementary School appears to have been created from whole cloth.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Does This Photo Show 'Four Horsemen of the Apocalypse' in the Clouds?
Byline: The events that follow the Four Horsemen of the Apocalypse are described as the Great Tribulation.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Does This Photo Show the 'Lightest and Darkest Skin Colors'?
Byline: Many different effects are achievable in the world of photography.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Donald Trump 'Portuguese People' Quote
Byline: A fake quote from Donald Trump about Portuguese people was started by a Facebook "prank" web site.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Fake CHI Products at T.J. Maxx and Marshall's
Byline: A number of images circulating on social media accompanied rumors that retailers T.J. Maxx and Marshall's carried inauthentic salon products.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Police Warn Using 'Facebook Reactions' Is Dangerous
Byline: Belgian police issued commentary about "Facebook reactions," but their remarks fell short of a warning and didn't involve danger to users.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: 27,000 People Came to a Bernie Sanders Rally in California
Byline: A circulating photograph depicted a Bernie Sanders rally in Los Angeles in August 2015, not a May 2016 event in Sacramento.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Is This a Photograph of a 'Hammerhead Salamander'?
Byline: The diplocaulus was indeed a real animal that lived during the Permian period 250 million years ago.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Do Clinton and Sanders Support Late-Term Abortions?
Byline: A viral Facebook post claimed Bernie Sanders and Hillary Clinton sought to make "the cutoff date" for abortion 36 weeks, but we were unable to substantiate that.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Image Shows President Obama with "Bernie 2016" Sign
Byline: A photograph purportedly showing President Obama posing with a "Bernie 2016" sign has been digitally doctored.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Big Lots Closing?
Byline: A prank-generating web site led many social media users to falsely believe Big Lots was closing all its stores.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Sanders vs. Clinton: Delegate Count
Byline: A popular meme detailing the actual delegate count between Bernie Sanders and Hillary Clinton in May 2016 is mostly accurate.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: 'You Might be a Moron' Quote
Byline: Comedian Jeff Foxworthy did not write a "you might be a moron" joke about the United States taking in Syrian refugees.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Is China Producing Corned Beef from Dead Bodies?
Byline: Unverified, unvetted postings on social media used photographs from video game promotions to advance tropes about China's food industry.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: 'Bernie Sanders Glowstick' Instructions Make Bombs, Not Glow Sticks
Byline: A meme offering instructions on how to make "Bernie Sanders glow sticks" actually provides a recipe for a chlorine bomb.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Huge Bernie Sanders Rally in California
Byline: A photograph does not show a massive Bernie Sanders rally in California, but rather a May Day march in Havana.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Is This a Photograph of Goldie Hawn and Kurt Russell in Donald Trump Campaign Shirts?
Byline: Two of the least likely celebrities to be spotted sporting Donald Trump campaign shirts.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Apple Music is Deleting Files from Personal Computers
Byline: A blog post entitled "Apple Stole My Music. No, Seriously" led many to believe that Apple was purposefully deleting files from personal computers.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Ted Cruz Blames God for Defeat in Epic Twitter Meltdown
Byline: A fake news article claimed that Ted Cruz blamed God for his failed presidential campaign, and had a "meltdown" on social media.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Elsa to Have Female Love Interest in 'Frozen' Sequel
Byline: A cropped screenshot from a news item led social media users to believe 'Frozen' character Elsa would have a "female love interest" in the sequel.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Teen Dies After 60 Minute Challenge?
Byline: A fake news item falsely claimed a teen boy died during a risqué 60-minute social media challenge.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Clinton Impeachment House Speakers' Sex Scandals
Byline: A tweet claiming that all Republican Speakers of the House involved with Bill Clinton's impeachment experienced sex scandals was mostly accurate.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Image of 'Vietnam Vets' Is a Still From a Movie
Byline: A photograph purportedly showing a group of underappreciated Vietnam veterans is actually a frame from the comedy "Tropic Thunder."
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Kings Island Closing Down Due to Dangerous Rides
Byline: A prank generator site led many social media users to believe Kings Island was closing due to "dangerous rides."
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Hepatitis C Treatment Highlights Disparity in Worldwide Drug Prices
Byline: A meme suggests that a course of treatment costing $900 in India carried a far heftier price tag in the United States.
Author: Brooke Binkowski

Title: Image of 'Spiral Sky' is a Digital Creation
Byline: An image showing an impressive spiral cloud formation encircling a tower was rendered by an artist, not photographed.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did Hillary Clinton Free a Child Rapist?
Byline: Hillary Clinton's role in a 40-year-old rape case became the focal point of a viral meme in 2016, but the claims made about it were mostly inaccurate.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Does This Video Capture a Time Traveler at a 1995 Mike Tyson Fight?
Byline: A viral video purportedly shows a spectator using a not-yet-available camera phone to take photographs of a Mike Tyson fight back in 1995.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Nike Doesn't Make Elephant Skin Shoes
Byline: An unsourced meme on Facebook accused Nike of making their sneakers with the hides of elephants.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Young Harriet Tubman Photograph
Byline: A viral image is not a photograph of African-American abolitionist Harriet Tubman as a young woman.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Is This a Jewish Mother Hugging Her Child Before Nazis Kill Them?
Byline: It's unlikely a memorable and striking photograph such as one of a mother giving her child one last hug before both were shot to death by Nazis would have remained obscure until now.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Lesbian Kicked out of North Carolina Bathroom?
Byline: A viral video of a young woman purportedly getting removed from a women's bathroom for not appearing feminine enough was not related to HB2.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Fake Target Customer Service Account Responds to People Angry About Transgender Bathroom Policy
Byline: An image purportedly showing a curt response from a Target customer service representative on Twitter originated with a parody account.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Saturn 'Close to Earth' Meme
Byline: A meme played on social media's fascination with astronomy by claiming that Saturn would appear to be impossibly close to Earth in May 2016.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Transgender Woman Arrested for Taking Pictures of Underage Girls at Target
Byline: A fake news article reported that a transgender woman was arrested for taking pictures of underage girls in a Target bathroom.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Landmarks Went Purple in Honor of Prince?
Byline: Several landmarks went purple after Prince died, but not all of the images circulating are authentic.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Prince Was Not Haywood Nelson's Brother
Byline: A viral meme claimed that musician Prince and actor Haywood Nelson were half-brothers, but that misinformation was based on a misunderstanding.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Target Puts Urinals in Women's Bathrooms
Byline: A photograph of urinals was not taken in the women's bathroom of a Target store, nor has the chain announced plans for such installations.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Was Prince Integral in the Development of Air Jordan Sneakers?
Byline: An online item suggested that Prince played a vital role in basketball star Michael Jordan's commercial success with Nike.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Man Takes Photographs in Women's Bathroom Because of New Laws?
Byline: A Pennsylvania man was arrested for alleged invasion of a women's bathroom, but he was not transgender or legally allowed to film there.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Was Harriet Tubman a Gun-Toting Republican?
Byline: A macro presenting Harriet Tubman as a "gun-toting Republican" features a photograph of Mary Fields, not Harriet Tubman.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: KKK Members Commit Mass Suicide Over New Currency
Byline: A story that Klan members committed suicide after announcements that Harriet Tubman's image would be placed on $20 bills came from a hoax news site.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Prince on Politics
Byline: A meme asserts that musician Prince said he voted Republican because that political party knows the value of hard work.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Do 643,000 Bankruptcies Occur in the U.S. Every Year Due to Medical Bills?
Byline: A popular meme holds that 643,000 Americans go bankrupt every year over medical bills, but the underlying math is elusive.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Target Transgender Bathroom Policy
Byline: A social media controversy erupted when Target announced a chain-wide policy inviting transgender customers to use the bathroom that matched their gender identity.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Costco Lying About Cage-Free Eggs?
Byline: A viral Facebook post claimed Costco lied about the sale of cage-free eggs, but the retailer openly disclosed their stances on ethical sourcing and cage-free numbers.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Does This Photograph Show Nigerian Christians Burned Alive by Muslims?
Byline: DISTURBING IMAGE WARNING
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Moose Enjoy Wading Pool, Watch Car Fire
Byline: A photograph showing moose sitting in a kiddie pool watching as a car burns is a composite of multiple images.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did Sgt. Gregory Hayes Kill Two Syrian Refugees for Raping His Daughter?
Byline: A popular meme describes a purported act of vengeance for which we found no evidence whatsoever.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: The Fix Is In: Sanders Supporters in New York See Votes Switched to Hillary
Byline: A Huffington Post impostor site falsely reported that New York primary voters witnessed their votes changing from Bernie Sanders to Hillary Clinton.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Is This a Picture of Gay Lions Mating?
Byline: A photograph of mating male lions that raced around social and news media may not be exactly what it appears to be at first blush.
Author: Brooke Binkowski

Title: The Farm Below the Mountain
Byline: A photograph purportedly showing a lush green farm in the shadow of a snow-covered mountain is a digital creation.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: 'Welcome to Australia'
Byline: A photograph purportedly showing a "Welcome to Australia" sign was digitally altered.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Man Deletes Entire Company with One Line of Code
Byline: The original story, says its creator, was a viral marketing scheme to promote his server management company.
Author: Brooke Binkowski

Title: Dr Pepper Bought by Coca-Cola, to Be Discontinued
Byline: An online hoax held that Coca-Cola had bought up rival soda brand Dr Pepper and would be shutting down production of the popular soft drink.
Author: David Mikkelson

Title: World's First 'Modular Life Form'
Byline: A viral video showing a fleshy, lab-grown "modular body" is part of a science fiction web series.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: NC Bathroom Bill Opposition Leader a Sex Offender?
Byline: A number of memes somewhat misleadingly reported that the "leader" of opposition to a controversial bathroom bill in North Carolina was a registered sex offender.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Fat Cat
Byline: A photograph showing an obese tiger is actually an entry from a Photoshop "Obeastity" contest.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: 'As the World Berned'
Byline: A photograph that purportedly showed massive crowds near Washington Square Park for a Bernie Sanders rally was actually taken in Paris in January 2015.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Texas Voter ID
Byline: A meme claimed that a 92-year-old Texas woman named Pam Nelson was unable to vote in her state's primary due to voter ID laws, but that wasn't the case.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Photograph of Paul McCartney Wearing 'Adopt' Shirt
Byline: A photograph showing the former Beatle wearing a shirt that reads "Adopt" with an image of a dog on it was digitally altered.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did Ted Cruz Oppose Self-Pleasuring Activities and Devices?
Byline: Several online items have misleadingly claimed that Ted Cruz tried to ban dildos in Texas.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Mebane Travel Center Ladies' Room Urinals?
Byline: A Facebook user incorrectly claimed that urinals were installed in the ladies' restroom at a Pilot Travel Center in Mebane, North Carolina.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Is This the Space Shuttle Leaving Earth's Atmosphere?
Byline: A photograph of the Space Shuttle Endeavour blasting off from Earth is real, but it has been subjected to photographic effects.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Obama Encouraging Schools to Teach Quran for Extra Credit
Byline: A number of social media posters claimed President Obama was "encouraging" schools to teach the Quran for "extra credit," but further information was rarely included.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Did Socrates Say Slander Is 'The Tool of the Losers”?
Byline: Some quotes are documented in history and textbooks, while others appear nowhere but the internet.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: 'Scarcity' Image of Woman in Shopping Aisle Not Taken in Venezuela
Byline: A photograph purportedly showing a woman walking down a deserted shopping aisle in Venezuela was actually taken in New York in 2011.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Sajid Muhammed Sets Woman on Fire
Byline: A satirical meme mocking anti-Muslim Facebook content was mistaken as factual by some social media users.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Mother Admits to Affair, Pregnancy by 15-Year-Old Son
Byline: Several fake news articles reported on a fabricated Facebook confession from a mother purportedly pregnant by her teenaged son.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Bernie Sanders Won Nevada?
Byline: According to social media rumors, Bernie Sanders claimed a win in Nevada in a surprise post-caucus upset, but the reality was far more complex and less definitive.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Is Chick-fil-A Offering a Free Meal Promotion for Mothers?
Byline: A social media rumor held that new mothers or pregnant women were eligible for a free meal from Chick-fil-A, but we could only trace the promotion to one restaurant in Texas.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Facebook's Hidden Other Inbox
Byline: Yes, it's true: Facebook's "other" inbox isn't the only place your filtered messages are hiding.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Are U.S. Schools Buying Prayer Rugs for Muslim Students?
Byline: A popular article on social media incorrectly claimed that St. Cloud schools bought prayer rugs for Muslim students at taxpayer expense.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Photograph Doesn't Show Texas Students Protesting College Debt
Byline: A photo purportedly showing a group of college students with the amount of debt they're in written on their graduation caps is fake.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: 'Wolf' on Horse's Coat
Byline: A photograph purportedly showing a horse with wolf-like markings on its coat is a digital creation.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Is This William Harley and Arthur Davidson Unveiling Their First Motorcycle?
Byline: A vintage photograph of two men sitting on Harley-Davidson motorcycles is said to picture the company's founders.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Drug Law Lobbying by Corrections Corporation of America
Byline: The quote used by a popular meme about cannabis legalization and for-profit prisons is accurate, but its context is not.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Was a 736-Pound Catfish Caught in the Mississippi River?
Byline: A photograph purportedly showing a 736-pound catch adds to the collection of urban legends about monstrously large catfish.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did Disney Ban Tattoos in Their Theme Parks?
Byline: "We don’t think that tattoos fit into the image of a wholesome Disney family."
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Bernie Sanders Plans to Tax Churches?
Byline: A fake news piece led some social media users to believe that Bernie Sanders planned to tax churches at a rate of 90 percent.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Kroger Unisex Bathroom Sign
Byline: A photograph of a sign on a unisex Kroger bathroom is real.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Veal Crates
Byline: A photograph supposedly showing inhumane "veal crates" is actually a picture of hutches used for the protection of newborn dairy calves.
Author: David Mikkelson

Title: Facebook 'Bernie Blackout'?
Byline: Facebook is not censoring content about Bernie Sanders or the hashtag #FeelTheBern.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Did a 101-Year-Old Woman Give Birth After an Ovarian Transplant?
Byline: A Reddit user's personal photo was used in a fabricated claim about a 101-year-old mother who gave birth at an advanced age thanks to an ovarian transplant.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Did Bernie Sanders Buy a $172,000 Car with Campaign Donations?
Byline: A set of photographs accompanied a suggestion that the Vermont senator had purchased an Audi R8 luxury automobile with campaign funds.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Are Refugees Overwhelmingly Young and Male?
Byline: Images claiming that waves of migrants and refugees asking for asylum are "mostly young men" are based on faulty or misleading statistics.
Author: Brooke Binkowski

Title: Whataburger 'Dollar Burger Day' Promotion
Byline: An image purportedly showing a coupon for a Whataburger "Dollar Burger Day" promotion is a hoax.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Chobani CEO Importing 300 Muslim Refugees per Month
Byline: A misleading image macro claimed Chobani's CEO vowed to "drown the United States in Muslims" and was "importing them to Idaho 300 at a time to work in his factory."
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Gabourey Sidibe Death Hoax
Byline: Gabourey Sidibe took to Twitter to refute a fake news site's celebrity death hoax about her.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Sanders Campaign Busing Youths to Caucuses and Primaries
Byline: Social media rumors claimed Bernie Sanders bused youthful disruptors to rallies, caucuses, and primaries in order to crowd out  rival "legitimate" voters and participants.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Solar Eclipse in the South Pacific
Byline: A photograph purportedly showing a solar eclipse over the South Pacific is a composite image.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Protests Seek to #EndFathersDay?
Byline: A photograph that shows two women protesting the observance of Father's Day is a digitally manipulated image.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Milk-Bone Facebook Warning
Byline: A viral video made unsubstantiated claims that Milk-Bone could cause cancer in dogs due to the presence of BHA.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Ronald Reagan Went Golfing After 1983 Beirut Attack
Byline: A meme falsely claims that Ronald Reagan continued his vacation after the 1983 terrorist attack on a U.S. Marines barrack in Beirut.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Road Runner Tunnel Crash
Byline: A viral story about a car crashing into a Road Runner cartoon-style painted tunnel seemed too humorous to ruin with fact-checking.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Is Nutella Toxic?
Byline: Social media users have spread articles claiming Nutella is "toxic" due to its use of vanillin and MSG.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Pantene Hair Products Causing Highlight Foils to Catch Fire?
Byline: A Facebook post claims Pantene shampoo and conditioner caused highlight foils to heat up and melt due to a unique waxy buildup.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Photograph Shows President Obama Holding Che Guevara T-Shirt
Byline: An image showing President Obama in Havana holding a t-shirt picturing Cuban revolutionary Che Guevara is a digital fabrication.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: The Claw of Troodon
Byline: A photograph of a moa foot has been misrepresented as depicting a dinosaur claw.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Misidentified Footage Circulated as 'Brussels Attack Video'
Byline: A video from the 2011 Minsk Metro bombing was shared on Twitter as legitimate footage of the March 2016 terrorist attack on Brussels.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: No Nudes Is Good Nudes
Byline: An image of President Obama pointing at a nude portrait of Donald Trump was faked on multiple levels.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Do Opossums Kill Ticks, Inhibit the Spread of Lyme Disease?
Byline: A popular meme asserted opossums kill most deer ticks they encounter and thus inhibit the spread of Lyme disease to humans.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Purple Ladybugs
Byline: A viral photograph of purple ladybugs native to Hawaii is just a creative digital coloring fabrication.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Alien Mummy Found, Scientists Baffled
Byline: A mysterious alien mummy hasn't baffled scientists: the image of a human child mummy was embellished with Photoshop.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Cell Phone Use at Night Causes Eye Cancer
Byline: A photograph purportedly showing a man with eye cancer caused by using his cell phone at night actually captures a case of pinkeye.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Does This Photograph Show a Pilot Taking a Selfie Out a Plane Window?
Byline: A photograph purportedly showing a pilot taking a selfie out his cockpit window is actually a composite of multiple images.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Cruz and Rubio Tweet That They Will Not Support Donald Trump
Byline: A screenshot purportedly showing anti-Trump tweets from Republicans Marco Rubio and Ted Cruz is fake.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Supreme Court Flip-Flops
Byline: Images reproduce contradictory statements from U.S. senators Mitch McConnell and Harry Reid about the President's prerogative in appointing Supreme Court justices.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: 'Walking Dead' Star Andrew Lincoln's Father Wasn't a Survivor of the 1972 Andes Flight Disaster
Byline: A meme falsely claims that "The Walking Dead" star's father was in a 1972 plane crash in the Andes mountains, and survived by eating the other passengers.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Harrison Ford Holding a Trump Sign?
Byline: That photograph of Harrison Ford holding a Trump sign is fake.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Viral Video: Pouring Molten Copper Over a Big Mac
Byline: A viral video showing molten copper being poured over a Big Mac does not demonstrate the "indestructible" properties of McDonald's food.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Donald Trump Supporters Seen Wearing Nazi-Style Armbands
Byline: Yes, two men were photographed wearing Nazi-style armbands in conjunction with  a Donald Trump political event, but they were well-known political pranksters.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: El Paso Gun Battle
Byline: Photographs purporting to be the scene of a shootout on the US-Mexico border were actually taken in Brazil in 2008.
Author: Brooke Binkowski

Title: (Takes) Forever Stamps
Byline: Letters using USPS "Forever Stamps" are not processed more slowly than mail with "regular" postage.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Donald Trump 'Protester' Quote/Kent State Comparison
Byline: An image juxtaposes a quote from Donald Trump about protesters with an archival image of the 1970 Kent State shootings.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Bernie Sanders Responds to Critical Trump Tweet
Byline: Bernie Sanders didn't tweet a scathing retort to Donald Trump after Trump insinuated Sanders' supporters were responsible for violence at Trump's rallies.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Vladimir Putin Did Not Endorse Bernie Sanders
Byline: An old fake news item claiming Vladimir Putin endorsed Bernie Sanders circulated on social media.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Code for Pedophiles on Toys?
Byline: Parents on social media were warned about pedophiles' symbols after a little-known heart design appeared on a popular local event souvenir.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Is This Ronald Reagan Meeting with Taliban Leaders at the White House?
Byline: A photograph showing President Reagan with a group of men at the White House is frequently miscaptioned.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: 'Make America White Again'
Byline: A photograph of Donald Trump supporters wearing  "Make America White Again" shirts at a rally is an altered version of a less controversial picture.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Photo Doesn't Show Crowd Giving Obama the Nazi Salute
Byline: A photograph of a crowd with their hands raised in front of Obama was circulated with misleading information.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Donald Trump Nazi Salute Controversy
Byline: Donald Trump asked rally attendees to pledge their support to him, and photos of the event compared the scene to Nazi Germany.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Promo for New Netflix Series 'Home Improvementer' Is Fake
Byline: A fake promotional image for a new Netflix original series called "Home Improvementer" was circulated online, but there are no plans to reboot the show.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Donald Trump Tweets a Photo of His Private Parts?
Byline: Despite rumors, Trump did not tweet out a photo of his genitals.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Donald Trump Isn't Hiring a Latina Actress to Play His Assistant
Byline: A casting call for "Donald Trump Executive Assistant Supporter" probably wasn't posted by the Republican candidate's Presidential campaign.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Media Blackout of Video Showing Muslims Chanting 'Death to America'?
Byline: The footage in question comes from a 2014 protest in Chicago and  at no point includes the phrase "death to America."
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Fairfax County Third-Grade Racism Posting
Byline: A popular anecdote about the influence of Donald Trump on Fairfax County schoolchildren was confirmed by the district.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Photo Shows Ted Cruz With Fidel Castro?
Byline: A photograph supposedly showing Ted Cruz hugging  former Cuban leader Fidel Castro was digitally manipulated.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Fake Brady Campaign Ad Goes Viral on Facebook
Byline: A fake ad purportedly from The Brady Campaign — a group working to end gun violence — was widely circulated on Facebook.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: That Super-Famous Celebrity Isn't Moving to Your Town
Byline: A number of hoax posts on Facebook claimed renowned celebrities were moving to various small towns across America.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Hitler and Trump: Common Slogans?
Byline: Various images attempted to connect Donald Trump and Adolf Hitler through slogans promising to make their respective countries "great again."
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Does This Photograph Show Bernie Sanders at a 1962 Civil Rights Sit-In?
Byline: A photograph said to show Bernie Sanders at a 1962 sit-in was the subject of considerable dispute over whom it really pictured.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: No, Copperhead Snakes Aren't Living Inside Fish Mouths
Byline: An old photo showing a snake inside the mouth of a fish is being recirculated, this time with a fake message about copperhead snakes biting anglers.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: FALSE: Photos of a 'Trampoline Bridge' Don't Show a Real Structure
Byline: Photos of a "trampoline bridge" in Paris show a concept, not a real architectural structure.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Coca-Cola Isn't Selling a 'Share a Coke with the KKK' Bottle
Byline: Artwork from an online protest asking Coca-Cola not to sponsor the 2016 Republican National Convention led some to believe that the company actually sold a "KKK" bottle.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Cellular Companies Charging for Emojis?
Byline: Viral warnings about unexpected emoji charges on cell phone bills were based largely on outdated or partially correct information.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: No, Donald Trump Didn't Tell Phil Donahue He Was an Atheist in 1989
Byline: A meme that Trump told Phil Donahue that his high IQ makes it impossible for him to believe in God is based on a fake quote.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Is Discarding Your Boarding Pass Dangerous?
Byline: Facebook posts claim airline boarding passes are encoded with sensitive personal information, but the risks involved in discarding them are vastly overstated.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Hillary Clinton Kissed by Former Klan Member
Byline: A photograph of Hillary Clinton being kissed by Senator Robert Byrd has been widely circulated as a political statement.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Mark Cuban on Donald Trump?
Byline: A now-viral Mark Cuban quote is accurate, but it's from July 2015.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: No, Leonardo DiCaprio Isn't Moving to Woodstock, Illinois
Byline: A viral article that claimed that Oscar winner Leonardo DiCaprio was moving to a suburban community in Illinois actually came from a fake news site.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: 'First They Ignore You, Then They Laugh at You' Quote Isn't Gandhi's
Byline: A quote misattributed to Mahatma Gandhi started recirculating after it was tweeted by presidential candidate Donald Trump.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Donald Trump Editorial via The New Yorker?
Byline: A widely-circulated editorial about Donald Trump didn't reach viral popularity until it was misattributed to the magazine 'The New Yorker.'
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Did a Retired Postman Father Over 1,300 Illegitimate Children?
Byline: “Contraception wasn’t very popular in those days,” he told local reporters in his defense.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Is This a Newly Hatched Dragon?
Byline: An image purportedly showing a baby dragon was circulated online.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Animal Testing Conducted by MAC Cosmetics?
Byline: The photograph actually shows a mass spaying and neutering event at the University of Florida — not animal testing.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Katy Perry Is JonBenét Ramsey?
Byline: Internet conspiracy theorists claim that pop star Katy Perry is actually the murdered six-year-old, but their evidence doesn't hold up.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Islamic Terror Versus Mass Shootings Meme
Byline: A meme shows a map of dots representing mass shootings since Sandy Hook, contrasting the deaths with those due to Islamic terrorism.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: No, These Photos Don't All Show the Effects of the Fukushima Disaster on Marine Life
Byline: Photos that claim to show the effects of the Fukushima nuclear disaster on marine life are actually cribbed from various unrelated corners of the internet.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did Donald Trump Supporters Wear KKK Robes to the Nevada Caucus?
Byline: While photos show two people in Ku Klux Klan robes showing support for Donald Trump at the Nevada caucus, it's unclear if they were actually members of the KKK.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: No, Sony Hasn't Announced Plans to Remake 'Mrs. Doubtfire' Starring Jonah Hill
Byline: A fake news article claimed that Sony Pictures was remaking the movie "Mrs. Doubtfire" with Jonah Hill.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Obama Administration Fighting to Allow Non-Citizens to Vote?
Byline: A Facebook video post featuring Lou Dobbs misleadingly claimed that the Obama administration is fighting in court to allow non-citizens to vote.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Sandra Day O'Connor Calls GOP 'Vile Obstructionists'?
Byline: A poorly punctuated Facebook post led many people to believe that Sandra Day O'Connor had some extra-harsh words for the Republican party.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Are There Worms in Lipton Tea Bags?
Byline: The substance seen in a viral Facebook video in Lipton tea bags isn't worm-based, it's lemon flavoring.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Donald Trump iPhone Boycott Tweet Controversy
Byline: Donald Trump did call for a boycott of Apple products, but the tweet didn't come from his iPhone.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Photograph Shows Endangered Fennec Hare?
Byline: The "fennec hare," while adorable, isn't endangered — because it doesn't exist.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Internet Celebrity Daniel Lara Wasn't Mugged for His Shoes
Byline: A fake news article claimed Lara, who goes by "Damn Daniel" on Vine, had been robbed for his signature Vans.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Trump Tower Chicago 'No' Pic
Byline: A photograph that appeared to show the residents of Chicago's Trump Tower objecting to his campaign was digitally altered.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: 'Share Your Ears' Make-A-Wish Disney Fundraiser?
Byline: From 29 January to 14 March 2016, Disney Parks will donate $5 to Make-A-Wish for every ear photo shared online.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Sharpie Anniversary Giveaway Scam
Byline: Sharpie isn't giving away a giant set of markers to celebrate their anniversary -- the offer is another online survey scam.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Bernie Sanders Supporters Chant 'English Only' at Dolores Huerta in Nevada?
Byline: Activist Dolores Huerta sent a tweet claiming Bernie Sanders supporters shouted 'English only' at her, but witnesses gave conflicting accounts.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Earth in a 'Cradle of Clouds'
Byline: A supposed Hubble Telescope photograph of Earth within a "cradle of clouds" is actually an artwork.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Did 'Django Unchained' Feature a Real Onscreen Death?
Byline: A Facebook meme claimed that actor Ato Essandoh was really killed by dogs while cameras rolled for authenticity's sake.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: USPS Did Not Issue Bernie Sanders Forever Stamps
Byline: While there is an envelope featuring the likeness of Bernie Sanders, the United States Postal Service has not issued a forever stamp endorsing the Democratic candidate.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Man Arrested for Not Paying Student Loans?
Byline: A story about a man being arrested for not paying a student loan is circulating on the internet — but without all of the facts.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Vladimir Putin Didn't Call Obama an Idiot for Socialist Policies
Byline: A years-old fake quote from Vladimir Putin started recirculating on the internet for some reason in February 2016.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Donald Trump Taunts Jeb Bush on Twitter over Domain?
Byline: JebBush.com redirects to the web site of Donald Trump, but a purported tweet from Trump taunting Bush didn't come from Trump's official account.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Photograph Shows Rhinoceros Trying to Save Zebra Foal?
Byline: While a photograph does show a rhinoceros interacting with a zebra foal, the image doesn't tell the complete (and far less uplifting) story.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Does This Photograph Show Bill Clinton, George H. W. Bush, and George Wallace?
Byline: Possibly one of the unlikelier political trios of the 1980s.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Kim Kardashian Didn't Wear a Dog Fur Coat
Byline: A Facebook user claimed that the reality star wore a coat made out of dog fur to Kanye West's fashion show, but later admitted they had made it up.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Are California Fruits Irrigated with Toxic Fracking Wastewater?
Byline: A number of social media and blog posts claimed that some California fruits were grown in toxic fracking-related or oil refinery wastewater.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: No, Ted Cruz Did Not Threaten to Deport Beyoncé
Byline: An image of a tweet ostensibly sent by Ted Cruz about deporting the singer over her Super Bowl performance was shared on social media.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Is the Russian Army Using Exosuits?
Byline: A viral image purportedly shows two Russian soldiers wearing "exosuits" in Syria.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Mark Cuban Said Fact-Checking Millennials Will Vote for Democrats?
Byline: A meme incorrectly attributing a quote to Mark Cuban went viral on Facebook.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Solar Panels Don't Drain the Sun of Energy
Byline: An intendedly humorous meme claims that the use of solar panels drains the sun of energy.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Is the Levi's Logo Racist?
Byline: A social media post claimed Levi's jeans' "two horse" logo was a racist symbol representing a slave's being killed.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Does This Video Capture a Weather Reporter Slapped in the Face by a Large Fish?
Byline: A viral video showed a "weather reporter" getting smacked in the face by a flying fish during a broadcast, but the footage appeared to be faked.
Author: Brooke Binkowski

Title: Aborted Fetuses Found in Michigan Dumpster?
Byline: A graphic image shows fetuses found along a riverbank in Nepal, not fetuses discovered in a Dumpster behind a Michigan abortion clinic.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Does McDonald's Food Not Rot?
Byline: Photographs of an ancient McDonald's order went viral on Facebook, but the "phenomenon" of non-decomposing fast food isn't so straightforward.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Airline Ticket Giveaway Scam
Byline: Airlines are not giving away free tickets or spending money to Facebook users who share and like a page.  Those offers are a form of online scam.
Author: Snopes Staff

Title: Company Anniversary Free Product Scam
Byline: Businesses are not celebrating their anniversaries by giving away free product to Facebook users who share and like a page.  Those offers are a form of online scam.
Author: David Mikkelson

Title: Does Febreze Contain Peanut Oil?
Byline: Social media users shared anecdotal reports of undeclared peanut and tree nut oils or byproducts in Febreze and other Procter & Gamble products, but P&G stated their non-food items are either appropriately labeled or nut-free.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Southwest Airlines Las Vegas Ticket Giveaway Scam
Byline: Southwest Airlines is not giving away four tickets to Las Vegas and $5,000 spending money to Facebook users who share and like a page.
Author: David Mikkelson

Title: Mother Teresa at 18
Byline: A viral photograph does not actually show famous Roman Catholic missionary Mother Teresa at age 18.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Photograph Doesn't Show Bernie and Jane Sanders at an LGBT March
Byline: An image from the movie 'The Rocky Horror Picture Show' is being shared as a photograph Bernie and Jane Sanders at a 1975 LGBT march.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Siberian Tigers Stalk Firefighter in Washington Cascades
Byline: A satirical Facebook group shared a photograph purportedly showing a pair of Siberian tigers stalking a firefighter.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Bernie Sanders: A Loser's Life?
Byline: A meme about Democratic presidential candidate Bernie Sanders displayed questionable accuracy and relevance.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Nordstrom Gift Card Survey Scam
Byline: A slicker-than-average Facebook coupon scam is circulating, baiting users with the promise of a $200 Nordstrom gift card.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Bernie Sanders Wants to 'Dethrone God' and Destroy Capitalism?
Byline: A fake image purportedly showing a tweet from Senator Bernie Sanders claims that the senator wants to "dethrone God."
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Donald Trump Didn't Pay Sarah Palin for Her Endorsement
Byline: An online rumor claimed that presidential candidate Donald Trump paid Sarah Palin $10 million for her endorsement.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Wegmans $80 Coupon Scam
Byline: Grocery chain Wegmans warned Facebook users that a digital coupon was a scam.
Author: Kim LaCapria

Title: Delta First Class Gift Boxes Scam
Byline: Facebook-based scam claims Delta Air Lines is giving away free boxes with first-class air travel tickets and $10,000 in cash to those who follow online links.
Author: David Mikkelson

Title: Facebook Bans Unlicensed Private Gun Sales
Byline: Unlicensed private gun sellers will no longer be able to use the Facebook social media network to broker firearms sales.
Author: Dan Evon

Title: Teletubby Lake Is Not Real
Byline: A purported image of 'Teletubby Lake' is a digital manipulation created for a Photoshop contest, not a real photograph.
Author: Dan Evon
